loans.name: Siajabu

texts.en:
Siajabu, age 25, is married with a three-year-old. For a living, she makes and sells chapatis from 6am to 6pm daily. From this business, which she started in March, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $22.

Siajabu hopes for a loan to purchase more chapati ingredients. She belongs to the loan group, Tuaminiane, whose members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more food ingredients to make chapatis

loans.name: Porfia's Group

texts.en:
The Committee of Entrepreneuring women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya which targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live in dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these poor women, as members of a Committee, the energy and motivation to reach success.

Raquel, a woman who belonged previously to a Committee of Entrepreneuring women invited her friends to form a new one. They set up a meeting and invited many women from the town. There Raquel shared with these women their previous experience in the Committee and explained to them how the Committee changed her life. Raquel’s hopeful words stimulated optimism among these women and they decided to form a Committee.

Porficia M. sells coal, Raquel I. sells jewelry, Diana G. and Patricia M. own a hair salon, Limpia Nunez sells cleaning products, Justa R. is a cook, Agustina G. makes and sells chipas, Sonia M., Rossana B. and Agueda S. sell cosmetics, Francisca Caniza owns a grocery store, Blanca R. and Dora A. sell food, Graciela L. sells silver products, and Angela M. sells natural remedies.

The credit provided will be used for the purchase of sugar, drinks, milk, cheese, cleaning products, flour, eggs, hair accessories, cosmetics, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, drinks, milk, cheese, cleaning products, flour, eggs, hair accessories, cosmetics and others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock in bulk

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.en:
Porfirio Nunez Carmona is married to Sinforosa Riquelme, and they live in Horqueta. The couple has 13 sons, but only 3 of them are under Porfirio and Sinforosa’s care; the rest are economically independent.

Porfirio works as director in construction. With the income generated by this job, he was able to raise and educate 13 children.

In 2006 Porfirio became a client of Fundacion Paraguaya since he formed a committee of entrepreneuring men. Because of his punctual repayments in previous loans, Porfirio is considered a very trustworthy costumer by Fundacion Paraguaya.

The money provided by the credit will be used in the purchase of raw materials and tools for construction.

loans.use: purchase of raw materials and tools for construction

loans.name: Rehema's Hatuyumbi Group

texts.en:
Rehema, age 26, makes and sells chapatis from 6am to 6pm daily. From this business, which she started in February, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $30.

Rehema hopes for a loan to purchase more chapati ingredients. She will share this loan with her subgroup, whose members belong to the loan group, Hatuyumbi. These members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy chapati ingredients

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Enelesi

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Enelesi K.. She is married and has two children aged 7 and 12. In 2005, Enelesi established her genge business. She now requires a loan in order to buy more stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, where the business owner sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people usually send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To buy more stock in bulk.

loans.name: Subilaga

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Subilaga M.. She is not married and has no children. In 2003, Subilaga established her tailoring business. She now requires a loan in order to buy more stock for her boutique. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her boutique.

loans.name: Restaurador Group

texts.en:
The Committee of Entrepreneuring women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya which targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live in dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these poor women, as member of a Committee, the energy and motivation to reach success.

Eight women who belonged previously to a Committee of Entrepreneuring women decided to form a new one with their new friends and neighbors. They set up a meeting and invited many women from the town. There they shared with these women their previous experience in the Committee and explained to them how the Committee changed their lives. Their hopeful words stimulated optimism among these women and they decided to form a Committee.

The Committee is formed by 18 women whose entrepreneurial activities include: sewing shops, stationeries, grocery stores, sales of drinks, vegetables, jewelry, clothes, lingerie.

The credit provided will be used for the purchase of: fabrics, thread, cloth, lingerie, drinks, vegetables, books, papers, pens, pencils and others.

loans.use: purchase of: fabrics, thread, cloth, lingerie, drinks, vegetables, books, papers, pens, pencils, sugar, meat, oil, flour and others

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 35 year-old Fatuma R.. She is married and has one child aged 14. In 2004, Fatuma established her tailoring mart business. She now requires a loan in order to buy more stock of boutique in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more stock of boutique in bulk.

loans.name: Virinia

texts.en:
Virina is a single mother of three sons, the oldest one is 28, the other 22, and the youngest one 18 years old.

Virina used to work as a housekeeper. Since her salary was extremely low she decided to change her job. She started collecting cardboard and then recycled it. Later on she invested in the purchase of a little cart to collect and transport recycling products such as cardboard, plastic, and glass.

Virina wants to save some money to invest in the purchase of a car to facilitate transportation. The money from this loan will be used to buy recyclable materials such as paperboard, plastic and glass.

loans.use: Purchase of paperboard, plastic, glass for recycling

loans.name: Asia's Shida Huzaa Nifa Group

texts.en:
Asia, aged 24, is married with two children (aged 8 and 6 months). She makes a living by selling sarongs and fabrics, a business she started in October 2007. She works from 10am to 4pm daily. From this business, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $27.

Asia hopes for a loan to purchase more sarongs and fabrics to sell. She will share this loan with her subgroup, as they are members of the loan group, Shida Huzaa Nifa. The members of this loan group guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more sarongs and fabrics to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Bakia

texts.en:
Bakia, age 38, is married with three children (aged 4, 8, and 11). She makes a living by selling fish and chapatis and works from 6am to 6pm daily. From this business, which she started in February, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $25.

Bakia hopes for a loan to purchase more fish and chapati ingredients. She belongs to the loan group, Muweza Mungu. The members of this loan group guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more fish and chapati ingredients

loans.name: Esteria

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Esteria M.. She is not married but has been blessed with five children aged between 8 and 18 who live with her because they are orphans. In 1998, Esteria established her genge business. She now requires a loan in order to buy additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, where the owner sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people usually send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To buy additional stock in bulk.

loans.name: Cristo Vive Group

texts.en:
Miline Palveuts is a 25 year-old woman who lives with her 5 children (ages: 9, 7, 6, 4, 6 months) and husband in the small community of Imbert in the Dominican Republic. To support her family, Miline sells used clothing in the street. She is on her feet 10 hours a day, which is exhausting. Miline hopes that one day she'll be able to afford to rent a store near her home.

That is why Miline and 14 other women--all of who emigrated form Haiti in the hopes of finding a better life--have applied for a collective loan of $2,225 U.S. dollars.

In her free time, Miline enjoys going to church and reading her Bible. The entire group would like to thank every Kiva lender and tell them God bless.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Comite 3 De Junio Group

texts.en:
The Committee of Entrepreneuring Women called “3 de junio” was formed in the neighborhood San Jose, located in the city of Villa Elisa. The neighbors set up a meeting and discussed the ideas of forming a committee to lift themselves out of poverty. Motivated by the desire of changing their situation, they started analyzing different business opportunities which they considered profitable. That is how the Committee “3 de junio” was born. The members have good professional and personal relationships. They are not only partners but also friends. The group is on their fourth loan cycle and they repay punctually.

The group is formed of 19 women who run different sorts of businesses. For instance, Delia M., Maria Cristina D., Maxima Iriarte Enciso and Benita O. each own a despensa (grocery store). Alicia Graciela C. ,Nilza Noemi B. and Maria Victoria L. sell clothes. Elva P., Pablina G., Benigna M. and Felicita R. sell fruits and vegetables. Francis L. sells tickets for games such as bingo, lottery, etc., Norma Catalina L. coal, and Lidia L. chipas. Maria del Rosario Patino makes and sells cleaning products; Maria Melissa M. sells ingredients for terere and mate (typical drinks from Paraguay). Laura Carolina C. owns a hair salon and Maria Veronica T. Servin recycles.

The money provided by the credit will be used for the purchase of products for their businesses. For example: meat, drinks, rice, pasta, thread, chemical products, fabrics, buttons, glass, cardboard, plastic, and others.

loans.use: purchase of meat, drinks, rice, pasta, thread, chemical products, fabrics, buttons, glass, cardboard, plastic and others

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is married with two children (aged 4 and 1). She makes a living by selling charcoal and firewood from 6am to 6pm everyday. From this business, which she started in August last year, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $25.

Zainab hopes for a loan to purchase more charcoal and firewood. She is a member of the loan group, Shida Huzaa M'fa. The members of this loan group guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood to sell

loans.name: Fatma's Hatutaki Matatizo Group

texts.en:
Fatma, age 34, is divorced and takes care of her four children (aged 15, 14, 7, and 2). She makes a living by selling food at her small cafe and works there from 6am to 3pm daily. From this business, which she started in April of last year, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $35.

Fatma hopes for a loan to purchase more food items for her cafe. She will share this loan with her subgroup, as they are members of the loan group, Hatutaki Matatizo. The members of this loan group guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more food stock for her cafe

loans.name: Comite Mujeres Unidas De Villa Elisa Group

texts.en:
The committee “Mujeres Unidas” started as an initiative of women from the neighborhood Villa Bonita in Villa Elisa. The members of the group have characteristics in common: they are all mothers who need to take care of their children and send them to school. This necessity of bringing benefits to their families makes them work very hard. All the 17 members of “Mujeres Unidas” are partners and friends. This sense of belonging to a group gives these poor women the energy and motivation to reach success.

They run different businesses. To mention some: grocery stores, sewing shops, sales of clothes, fruits, coal, cosmetics, vegetables, food among others. The money provided by the loan will be invested in the purchase of products such as meat, drinks, rice, pasta, thread, fabrics, buttons and others.

loans.use: purchase of products such as meat, drinks, rice, pasta, thread, fabrics, buttons and others

loans.name: Nji Richard

texts.en:
Born in 1949, Ade Pa Richard is married and has three children, two of who are below the age of fifteen years. Due to poverty and the untimely death of his father, he was unable to continue his education. His widowed mother was unable to help him and his younger siblings. She could not raise enough money to educate the children, take care of their hospital bills, or to provide for the basic household needs like salt and magi (a seasoning cube used every day in Cameroon).

As a young boy, Richard decided to start the business of buying and selling petrol. When he got married, he was very eager to add to his business capital by starting a business weaving bags. He decided to become a member of GHAPE in 2002, where he was trained in business and marketing techniques, So far he has obtained and successfully repaid four loans from GHAPE.

Given a loan, he plans to continue his petrol business and buy materials for the weaving of bags. He is convinced that his business is going to be successful because he has experience and a lot of customers. He plans to repay the loan in 24 months. The first installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of fibers, colors and petrol

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura Raquel F. Ramirez (25) is the single mother of a 2-year-old boy.

Laura is an entrepreneur who has the ability to spot business opportunities. In Paraguay is like a tradition for men to play soccer in the evening. After the game, they usually drink some beers and eat. Thinking about this fact, Laura decided to open a mini-restaurant where she sells hamburgers and different types of drinks. The restaurant is opened from 5 pm to midnight. Laura employs two poor women from her neighborhood to help her in serving the customers.

The money provided by the loan will be invested in the purchase of products such as drinks and ingredients to prepare the hamburgers for Laura’s mini-restaurant.

loans.use: Purchase of drinks and ingredients to prepare hamburgers

loans.name: Jesus Nuestra Esperanza Group

texts.en:
Claudio and Sonya V. live in the community of Las Avispas, the Dominican Republic, with their three children (ages: 8, 7, 5). To support their family, Sonya sells fruit and jewelry at a small shop in her community. Her dream is that she'll have a large and successful business in the future, so that she will be able to help other women in her community. Her favorite foods are lentils, meat, and rice and in her free time she likes to attend church with her friends in Las Avispas.

She and four other women have applied for loan of $1,025 U.S. dollars so they can all achieve the dreams of a better life.

loans.use: Earrings, necklaces, rings.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Rachael Agwa

texts.en:
Born in 1962, Ma Rachael is married to a polygamist, Chief Foguh. They are blessed with six children, three of whom are under the age of fifteen years. The fact that she was unable to acquire a basic education has made life very difficult for Ma Rachael. She also struggled in the past with the frustration of being unable to help her husband provide for their family. Worst of all, she could not give her children three square meals a day or pay for schools fees.

She was motivated to become a member of GHAPE in 2002 by a friend who is also a GHAPE member. Since then, she has taken out four loans and repaid them on time. The profit from these loans helped her pay her children’s school fees and meet some of her family’s basic needs, like food.

Given this loan, she plans to buy goats, cassava (a starchy root that is a staple in Cameroon), and seedlings. Ma Rachael has been growing crops such as cassava and preparing garri for resale. With her new investments, she will be able to breed and raise goats and expand her farm. She knows her business is going to succeed because she has acquired some basic training on finance management and managing a business from GHAPE.

Ma Rachael plans to pay her loan in 24 months. The first installment is due on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of goats, cassava, and seedlings

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras De Villa Elisa Group

texts.en:
The Committee of Entrepreneuring Women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya which targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live in dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these poor women, as members of a Committee, the energy and motivation to reach success.

In a neighborhood called Villa Bonita, located in Villa Elisa, the neighbors set up a meeting and discussed the idea of forming a Committee to lift themselves out of poverty. Motivated by the desire to change their situation, they started analyzing different business opportunities which they considered profitable. That is how the Committee “Mujeres Trabajadoras” was born. The members have good professional and personal relationships. They are not only partners but also friends. The group is in its fourth loan cycle and they repay punctually.

The businesses these women run include: despensas (grocery stores), sewing shops, sales of coal, fruits, vegetables, food, cosmetics and cleaning products. Some of them are artisans.

The money provided by the loan will be used for the purchase of products. For example, meat, drinks, rice, pasta, thread, chemical products, fabrics, buttons and others.

loans.use: Purchase of meat, drinks, rice, milk, vegetables, fruits, pasta, thread, chemical products, fabrics, buttons and others.

loans.name: Asombangni Fru

texts.en:
Born in 1946, Fru P. is married and has six children. He has worked very hard to provide for the needs of his family. As the head of the family, he has many burdens, especially educating his children and providing food and shelter for them. He has been a member of GHAPE since its creation and has taken out loans that he has successfully repaid. With this loan he plans to buy a motor bike for transportation and also seedlings. The bike will provide the community with transportation because in his locality the roads are bad. He will use the profits to repay his loan and pay his children's school fees.

He plans to repay the loan in 24 months. His first installment will be due on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of motorbike

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena, age 29, is married with a four-year-old. She makes a living by selling clothing, and also has a mill which she charges usage for. She started these businesses last year. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm and is able to make a monthly profit of about $90.

Zena hopes for a loan to purchase more clothing to sell. She is a member of the loan group, Tupendane. The members of this loan group guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Myrian

texts.en:
Myrian B. de Fretes (47) is divorced and lives with her daughter who is 10 years old. Myrian works very hard to send her daughter to school. Both live in Nemby.

Myrian owns a sewing shop, where she makes clothes for women, such as cardigans, pants, T-shirts and others. Before her divorce, Myrian’s economic situation was much better. Her husband helped her buy the required machines. But after the divorce, her husband took all of them away from Myrian. As a result, she needed to start all over again.

Myrian sells her products to different customers from the neighborhood. In addition, she sells to various fashion shops.

She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of a sewing machine to improve the quality of her clothes.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Pablino

texts.en:
Pablino A. (41) is divorced and has two sons. The oldest one is 16 and the youngest 9 years old. Pablino’s ex-wife is living abroad. As a result, Paulino is responsible for his two sons. Paraguayans tend to emigrate from Paraguay to countries such as Spain and Argentina in order to produce more income. According to these people, there is no solution other than migration, because they do not find jobs in our country.

Pablino owns a truck where he delivers products from and to a well-known market called “Mercado Central de Abasto de la ciudad de Asuncion”. He started with this business 22 years ago as a driver. Ten years ago he bought his own truck and started working independently.

The money provided by the credit will be used to repair Pablino’s truck and to buy new tires.

loans.use: To repair his truck and purchase new tires.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andres A. is a gentleman native of the city of Chinandega, where he runs his business selling basic grains in the Villanueva municipality. He is married and is the father of six children, who have characterized themselves as being good students thanks to the motivation offered by their mother and father, who make great efforts every day so that they are never in need.

The sale of grains such as rice, beans, corn, etc, requires much dedication being that one must generate massive publicity to captivate potential clients, and one must have sufficient products on hand ready to sell. For this reason, Andres is seeking support in Ceprodel to benefit from a loan that will allow him to acquire basic grains such as rice, beans and corn for its respective sale.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Andres A. es un caballero originario de la ciudad de Chinandega el cual posee su negocio de venta de granos básicos en el municipio de Villanueva de donde es originario. Es casado y padre de seis hijos los cuales se han caracterizado por ser buenos alumnos gracias a la motivación de su padre y madre que a diario se esfuerzan para que a estos no les falte nada.

El negocio de la venta de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, maíz, etc. requiere de mucha dedicación para ofertarlo a sus clientes ya que se debe de dar una masiva publicidad para captar una potencial clientela y para esto se debe de contar con suficientes productos para comercializarlos. Es por este motivo que el caballero Andres busca apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con el crédito necesario que le permita la adquisición de los granos básicos tales como arroz, frijoles, maíz, etc. para su respectiva comercialización.

loans.use: Purchase basic grains such as rice, beans and corn.

loans.name: Claret Antonia

texts.es:
Claret O. is currently facing the need to reconstruct her home in the Villanueva municipality in Chinandega. She would like to do this to improve the living conditions of her three children, who need her support to progress.

After starting the reconstruction of her home, the project was put on hold due to financial reasons. Today, however, she very wisely wishes to proceed with this project being that the winter season is quickly approaching, and to avoid health problems and colds for her children, she has decided to apply for a loan from Ceprodel to purchase construction materials such as zinc sheets and bricks. Through this form of support, she will benefit as well as her family.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Claret O. es una dama que actualmente atraviesa la necesidad de reconstruir su casa de habitación en el municipio de Villanueva de Chinandega. Esto con el hecho de mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus tres hijos que necesitan de su apoyo para salir adelante.

Al haber iniciado la reconstrucción de la vivienda esta obra se vio paralizada por el motivo del factor económico. Sin embargo, hoy en día muy sabiamente desea iniciar nuevamente con el proceso de reconstrucción debido a que pronto inicia el invierno y para evitar problemas de enfermedad y resfríos en sus hijos decide hacer un préstamo en Ceprodel para la compra de los materiales como laminas de zinc y ladrillos. Por medio de este apoyo se beneficia tanto ella como su familia.

loans.use: Purchase materials such as metal sheets and bricks for the reconstruction of her home.

loans.name: Cleotilde Francisca

texts.es:
Cleotilde R. currently lives in the Villanueva municipality in the city of Chinandega. She owns a small grocery store, which she has been stocking with many different products over its 14 years of existence. Her husband and three children have all supported her by attending her clients and shopping for the products at the market or in supply stores.

The necessity Cleotilde is facing today is the need to purchase products to sell in her store immediately. For this reason, she has turned to Ceprodel to receive a loan that will allow her to buy the necessary merchandise to then resell in her store, and in that way continue with the maintenance of her humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Cleotilde R. actualmente vive en el municipio de Villanueva en la ciudad de Chinandega. Su negocio es el de pulpería el cual ha venido surtiendo de diferentes productos a medida que los años han venido transcurriendo ya que este negocio posee 14 años de existir. Su esposo y sus tres hijos han apoyado de igual manera a la señora Cleotilde atendiendo a sus clientes y realizando las compras de los productos en el mercado o tiendas proveedoras.

La necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa la señora Cleotilde es la pronta necesidad de adquirir sus productos para comercializarlos. Es por esto que ella acude a CEPRODEL para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de su mercadería para luego venderla a sus clientes y de esta manera continuar con el mantenimiento de su humilde hogar.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell in her small grocery store.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
In the municipality of Villanueva in the city of Chinandega, David Rodriguez runs a small general store, which he has managed to establish with much effort over the last 5 years from his own home.

He is married, and he is a father with the responsibility of offering his family the best possible living conditions. To do this, he sells by-products in his general store with the sole purpose of improving his living conditions little by little. Ceprodel has been a pillar for his business by providing loans that have allowed him to purchase his products. Today, he once again turns to this support trusting that he will receive a loan to purchase his products.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega el señor David R. se dedica al negocio de pulpería el cual ha logrado establecer muy esforzadamente desde hace 5 años en su propia localidad en este municipio.

Es padre casado que tiene la responsabilidad de brindar las mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Para ello lleva a cabo su actividad económica de la venta de de subproductos en la pulpería con el único propósito de ir mejorando poco a poco las condiciones de su hogar. Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en su negocio por el hecho de que le ha proporcionado créditos que le han permitido la compra de sus productos. Hoy en día una vez mas busca el apoyo confiando en que le será otorgado el crédito para la compra de sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase products to sell in his general store.

loans.name: Ermida

texts.en:
Ermida L. S. has a business selling beef in the village of Loma Linda, high in the sierras of the La Libertad Region. She’s run the business for four years and now knows exactly how to make the most of each day. She currently rents a stand in the most popular market.

Ermida is 40 years old and married with two children. Before starting her current business, she knitted. Now she really enjoys interacting with all the different people and helping pay for her children’s education.

A member of the community bank Jesus Nazareno, Ermida is requesting a loan of s/1200 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to invest in more beef.

loans.use: She will use the loan to invest in more beef.

loans.name: Dulex Antonio

texts.es:
Dulex is a gentleman from the Villanueva municipality in the beautiful city of Chinandega. Currently, he places great effort into his general store, which he operates in his home, and sells all types of products to the customers in his sector. His wife supports him at all times in the sale of these products, and together they have managed to offer their children the well-being they need through their schooling.

The necessity Dulex is facing is the immediate need to invest in the purchase of more products. For this reason, he has turned to Ceprodel to receive the necessary funds to purchase these products. Through this loan, it will be possible for him to purchase his merchandise, and in this way, obtain income to continue maintaining his wife and children.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Dulex es un caballero del municipio de Villanueva en la hermosa ciudad de Chinandega. Actualmente se dedica muy esforzadamente al negocio de pulpera el que atiende en su casa de habitación vendiendo todo tipo de productos a sus clientes en su sector. Su cónyuge es una dama que en todo momento lo apoya en la venta de los productos y ambos han logrado proporcionarles a sus hijos el bienestar que ellos necesitan por medio de sus estudios.

Hoy en día la necesidad atravesada por el negocio del caballero Dulex es la pronta inversión en los productos. Es por ello que acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de estos productos. Por medio de este crédito se permite que él compre su mercadería y de esta manera percibe ingresos para continuar manteniendo a sus hijos y esposa.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell in his store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Nelly Rosa

texts.en:
Nelly Rosa Alforo Z. runs a business buying and selling meat in the town of Aguallpampa, high in the sierras of the La Libertad Region. She has 25 years of experience running the business with her husband. They specialize in the sale of beef, chicken, and pork. She is very well connected in the community and has many loyal customers.

Nelly is 50 years old and has three children. Her focus is to grow her business and help her children study at a university.

A member of the community bank Jesus Nazareno, Nelly is requesting a loan of s/1500 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to invest in more meat.

loans.use: She will use the loan to invest in more meat.

loans.name: Nila Violeta

texts.en:
Nila Violeta Zavalet C. has a general store in the town of Agaullpampa, high in the sierras of the La Libertad Region. She has 4 years of experience and sells candy, oil, rice, sodas, and much more. Her store has a wonderful location in the center of town.

Nila is 47 years old and married with 4 children. She loves her business because she now has more independence and dignity. She doesn’t have to ask her husband for money and can help pay for her children’s tuition.

A member of the community bank Jesus Nazareno, Nila is requesting a loan of s/1000 to repay over 6 months. She will restock her store with all her best selling products.

loans.use: She will restock her store with all her best selling products

loans.name: Ericka Francisca

texts.es:
Erika E.’s occupation is in the field of education, being that she is an elementary school teacher in a small school in the municipality of Villanueva in the city of Chinandega. She is the mother of two school-aged daughters who she has to maintain and offer the necessary conditions to subsist. For this reason, she is looking for the means to reconstruct her house being that it has suffered considerable damage over the years due to the effects of natural phenomena.

To proceed with the reconstruction of her home, it is necessary to emphasize that she had already initiated this project, but when she lacked funds, she decided to wait some time until she obtained the money required to finish the reconstruction. For this, she has sought refuge in Ceprodel to obtain the necessary funds that will allow her to purchase materials and continue with the reconstruction of her home, which she has invested so much in.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La labor a la que se dedica la señora Erika E. es a la docencia siendo maestra de primaria en un pequeño colegio de la ciudad de Chinandega del municipio de Villanueva. Es madre de dos hijas en edad escolar que tiene la obligación de mantener y proporcionarle las condiciones necesarias para subsistir. Para ello busca la manera de cómo reconstruir su casa de habitación ya que a través de los años ha venido sufriendo el desgaste físico proporcionado por los fenómenos naturales.

Para llevar a cabo la reconstrucción de su vivienda es necesario destacar que primeramente había iniciado esta labor pero al hacerle falta al recurso económico decidió esperar un momento para obtener el dinero para continuar con la reconstrucción de su casa. Para ello ha buscado refugio en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario que le permita obtener los materiales para continuar con la reconstrucción de su vivienda que tanto ha invertido en ella.

loans.use: Purchase materials for the reconstruction of her home.

loans.name: Asucena Mavila

texts.en:
Asucena Mavila C. U. owns a general store and a business raising pigs and preparing ham. She lives in the town of Salpo, high in the Andes of the La Libertad Region. She has ten years of experience preparing her ham. She is very busy from May to September preparing for the Fiesta Patronal where she does a lot of business.

Asucena is 43 years old, married and has three children. She works hard so her children can study and have the opportunity to become professionals. She enjoys building relationships and working with her family.

A member of the community bank Virgen de Las Mercedes, Asucena is requesting a loan of s/1000 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to restock her store with rice, beer, oil, candy, and more.

loans.use: She will use the loan to restock her store with rice, beer, oil, candy, and more.

loans.name: Idania María

texts.es:
Idania R., like all Nicaraguan women, stands out for being a very hardworking person, succeeding in the livestock business by breeding pigs, with which she has supported her family for the past five years, offering them the minimum conditions necessary to subsist.

The necessity this woman is facing is the urgent need for financial resources to purchase more pigs. For this reason, she has turned to Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will allow her to acquire the livestock with the goal of breeding them and later selling to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Idania R. como toda mujer nicaragüense se destaca por ser una persona muy trabajadora sobresaliendo en el negocio de ganadería (crianza de cerdos)con el cual alimenta a su familia desde hace cinco años proporcionándole las condiciones mínimas necesarias para subsistir.

La necesidad que esta dama hoy en día atraviesa es la urgencia de adquisición de recursos económicos para la compra de los cerdos, es por esta razón que ella acude a Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan adquirir el ganado con el único fin de criar los terneros para sacarles el máximo provecho para luego venderlos a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase livestock (pigs) for breeding.

loans.name: Perpetua Dionicia

texts.en:
Perpetua Dionicia L. S. is a busy business-woman in the town of Salpo, high in the sierras of the La Libertad Region. She runs a general store, serves food, raises small animals, and rents rooms in her house. Her house is located in the center of town so she has plenty of loyal customers.

Perpetua is 40 years old, single and has four children. She is happy she has her businesses so she can take care of her family. She plans on sending all of her children to University.

A member of the community bank Virgen de Las Mercedes, Perpetua is requesting a loan of s/1000 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to restock her store with rice, oil, noodles, school supplies, and more.

loans.use: She will use the loan to restock her store with rice, oil, noodles, school supplies, and more.

loans.name: Consuelo Inocenta

texts.en:
Consuelo Inocenta G. T. has a general store in the town of Salpo high in the sierras of the La Libertad Region. She has over 30 years of business experience. Her store is located in the center of town so she has many customers. She sells rice, sugar, soda, juices, and much more.

Consuelo is 48 years old and married with 4 children. All her children study and are planning on becoming professionals. She is happy to have her business; it has given her some independence and confidence.

A member of the community bank Virgen de Las Mercedes, Consuelo is requesting a loan of s/1000 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to restock her store with all the products her clients love.

loans.use: She will use the loan to restock her store with all the products her clients love.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan Francisco G. currently owns a business making and selling bricks in the municipality of Villanueva in the city of Chinandega. He does this with much effort, making bricks for use in construction to sell them in that sector of the municipality.

Currently, his business is facing the immediate need for materials for the production of the bricks. For this reason, Mr. G. seeks support from Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will allow him to purchase these materials and continue to run his brick business from his home in Villanueva.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El caballero Juan Francisco G. actualmente es dueño de un negocio de elaboración y venta de tejas ubicado en el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega. Se dedica a esta labor con mucho esfuerzo elaborando las tejas para construcción para ofrecerlas en el sector de ubicación en el municipio.

Actualmente la necesidad que este negocio atraviesa es la pronta inversión en los materiales para la elaboración de las tejas. Es por este motivo que el señor G. busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener crédito que le permita la compra de estos materiales y así proseguir con su negocio de tejas en su localidad de habitación en Villanueva.

loans.use: Purchase material to make bricks.

loans.name: Zubeda Ally Group

texts.en:
Zubeda A., age 30, is married with three children (ages 10, 7, and 2). She owns two businesses--selling cosmetics and clothes. She works from 11am to 5pm daily. She started these businesses in 2005 and now makes a monthly profit of about $243 from her sales.

She hopes for a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her capital. She will share this loan with her loan group, which totals 21 members.

In the picture, Zubeda is the second person from the right, in the front row wearing a white dress.

loans.use: To increase capital for cosmetic and clothing sales

loans.name: Estefania Hortenzia

texts.en:
Estefania has a small business preparing ham in the village of Salpo, high in the Sierras of the La Liberted Region. With over 20 years of experience, Estefania knows how to prepare the tastiest ham. She has many loyal clients and often sends her meats to customers in Peru’s third largest city, Trujillo.

Estefania is 85 years old, married and has 6 children. Although towards the end of her life, Estefania is healthy and lucid. She has no problem hustling around her village situated at over 10,000 ft above see level and enjoys taking care of her family.

A member of the community bank Virgen de Las Mercedes, Estefania is requesting a loan of s/1000 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy more meat to prepare her popular ham.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy more meat to prepare her popular ham.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana M. is a native of the city of Chinandega from the municipality of Villanueva. Over the course of the years, along with her husband, she has put great effort into her own general store with the goal of improving the condition of her home in order to offer better customer service and thus offer her children better living conditions.

It is necessary to point out that since starting her business, she has improved her financial situation somewhat, but her home is not fit for running the general store, and so it is her dream to expand the area. For this reason, she turns to Ceprodel for support in obtaining a loan that will allow her to expand the area where she tends to her clients so that she may continue with her business, being that the store is the sole source of income with which she maintains her family.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana M. es una dama originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega del municipio de Villanueva. A través de los años, en conjunto con su cónyuge se ha venido esforzando en su negocio de pulpería con el único fin de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda para brindar mejores condiciones de atención a sus clientes y así proporcionarles a sus hijos las condiciones necesarias para la vivienda.

Es necesario destacar que al haber iniciado con el negocio de la pulpería ha logrado mejorar en parte su situación pero su casa de habitaron no presta las condiciones para llevar a cabo el negocio por lo que son sus sueños iniciar con la ampliación de su local. Por esto hoy en día una vez mas busca el apoyo en CEPRODEL para obtener el crédito que le permita invertir en la ampliación de su local donde atiende a sus clientes para así continuar con su negocio de pulpería siendo este su único ingreso con el que mantiene su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase materials to expand the space in her home where her general store is situated.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Leyla

texts.es:
Leyla V. has been running her business selling clothing and footwear for three years in the Villanueva municipality in the city of Chinandega. Since she started her business, she has faced multiple financial hardships being that she is a single mother with three children to support.

The hardship she is facing today is the urgent need to acquire clothing and footwear so that she may sell in her business. For this reason, she turns to Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will allow her to purchase these items. Through this purchase, it will be possible to sell the items through her business and obtain financial resources to continue with the maintenance of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Leyla V. es una dama que se dedica desde hace tres años al negocio de la venta de ropa y calzado en el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega. Desde sus inicios en el negocio ella ha atravesado múltiples adversidades económicas ya que es madre soltera y con tres hijos que mantener.

La necesidad que ella atraviesa hoy en día es la pronta adquisición de la ropa y el calzado para comercializarlo, es por este motivo que acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita adquirir estos productos. Por medio de esta compra a los proveedores, se da lugar a que pueda comercializar sus productos en su negocio lo que permite que se obtengan recursos económicos para continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and footwear to sell in her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Logia Esther

texts.es:
The activity to which Logia A. puts such great effort is the rental of videogames, having her own establishment in her home in the municipality of Villanueva in the city of Chinandega.

It is necessary to point out that Logia is a very hard worker who has managed to carry on thanks to the unconditional support provided by Ceprodel, which allows her to acquire videogames and provide maintenance for all the equipment. Today, she faces the urgent need to acquire financial resources to provide the necessary maintenance to the videogame stations. She trusts that Ceprodel will support her by offering the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La actividad económica a la que muy esforzadamente se dedica la dama Logia A. es al alquiler de videojuegos teniendo su propio establecimiento de alquiler en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Es necesario destacar que la señora Logia es una dama muy esforzada que ha logrado salir adelante gracias al apoyo incondicional proporcionado por Ceprodel el cual le permite adquirir los videojuegos y darle mantenimiento a cada una de las maquinas. Hoy en día la necesidad atravesada por la dama Logia es la urgencia de adquirir el recurso económico para darle el respectivo mantenimiento a las maquinas y es por esto que espera confiadamente en que Ceprodel le apoyará brindándole el crédito necesario.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase and maintenance of videogame stations.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.en:
Maria Eugenia Palzcio is a married mother and with six children, three of which are still under her care and in need of an education. She lives in the municipality of Villanueva making and selling tortillas out of her house where her customers come to make their purchases.

It is important to emphasize the effort she puts forth in spite of very large economic difficulties. Her spirit of overcoming those obstacles has permitted her to get ahead thinking about the future of her children.

She has come to CEPRODEL to obtain a loan that will permit her to buy raw materials like fire wood and corn. It is important to emphasize that she is a very loyal client of Ceprodel, and has paid off all of her credit in accordance with the loan agreements she entered into.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Maria Eugenia P. es madre casada y con seis hijos de los cuales tres de ellos están bajo su responsabilidad por lo que les debe de proporcionar los estudios que ellos se merecen. Habita en el municipio de Villanueva elaborando y vendiendo tortillas en su casa de habitación donde es visitada por sus clientes.

Es necesario destacar que esta esforzada dama ha atravesado grandes dificultades económicas pero su espíritu de superación ha permitido salir adelante pensando en el futuro de sus hijos.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a CEPRODEL para obtener crédito que le permita la compra de la materia prima como lo es la leña y el maíz. Es necesario destacar que ella es una fiel cliente de Ceprodel habiendo cancelado sus créditos en la forma correspondiente de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to make tortillas

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa M. has dedicated herself to her business of raising pigs for the past 4 years in her home town of Villanueva de Chinandega. With much effort and sacrifice she is able to find the way to support her family despite the fact that she is a single mother. It is very difficult to try and maintain 5 children playing the role of both mother and father.

Today she is in urgent need of pigs for breeding. For this she is soliciting a loan from Ceprodel in order to obtain the help necessary to buy those animals. It must be emphasized that with her experience en this business she has been able to build up a customer base that acquire all of their animals through her.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

La dama Narcisa M. se dedica desde hace 4 años al negocio de la crianza de cerdos en su localidad en el municipio de Villanueva de Chinandega. Con muchísimo esfuerzo y sacrificio busca la manera de cómo mantener a su familia por el hecho de que es una dama soltera y con la difícil necesidad de mantener a sus 5 hijos haciendo el papel de padre y madre.

Hoy en día la necesidad que ella atraviesa es la urgente adquisición de los cerdos para su respectiva crianza en el Ganado. Para ello, ella solicita créditos en Ceprodel para obtener el apoyo necesario para la compra de estos animales. Es necesario destacar que con su experiencia en el negocio, ha logrado alcanzar clientes que adquieren de ella los animales o los productos derivados de estos animales.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs

loans.name: Noelia Dilena

texts.en:
One of the principle things that every human being has the right to is a place to live with dignity. Conscience of that, Noelia M. has worked very hard to be able to offer her little children the conditions necessary to be able to live in her home in the city of Villanueva in Chinandega.

With this motive the need for repair of yearly weather damage to her home is very evident. She has decided to reconstruct her home, and has already begun. She is working through Ceprodel to obtain a loan that would allow her to buy the materials for construction in order to carry out this job. This way she will be able to maintain her family and never need help from her mother.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Una de las principales cosas que todo ser humano tiene derecho es a una vivienda digna donde habitar. Consciente de esto, la señora Noelia M. con mucho esfuerzo labora para brindarles a sus pequeños hijos las condiciones necesarias para poder vivir en su casa de habitación en el sector de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Es por este motivo que al ver la necesidad que ha atravesado su casa por haber sido lastimada por los fenómenos físicos de la naturaleza, ella ha decidido reconstruir su vivienda habiendo iniciado en parte esta labor. Para ello busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de los materiales de construcción para así llevar a cabo esta labor y de este modo mantener a sus hijos que hoy mas que nunca necesitan del apoyo de su mamá.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Pastor

texts.en:
Pastor P. has been dedicated to the business of cattle ranching for the last 16 years in the municipality of Villanueva in Chinandega. This business requires a lot of dedication for the fact that is demands a lot of effort to carry out the breeding. This is also true due to the fact that it requires the strict control of every one of the animals and at the same time feed and care for those that are older.

It is necessary to emphasize through this business Mr. P. is able to maintain his spouse and son. It is because of this he his soliciting a loan through Ceprodel . The credit will allow him to be the animals, which he will turn around and sell to the Villanueva community.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

El caballero Pastor P. se dedica al negocio de la ganadería desde hace 16 años en el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega. Este negocio requiere de mucha dedicación por el hecho de que se necesita de mucho esfuerzo para llevar a cabo la crianza de ganado debido a que se debe de tener un estricto control de cada uno de los animales y a su vez alimentar de la manera mas adecuada.

Es necesario destacar que por medio de este negocio, el señor P. logra mantener a su cónyuge y su hijo en edad escolar. Es por este motivo que hoy en día busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan la compra de los animales (terneros) para su respectiva comercialización en la comunidad de Villanueva.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
In the community of Villanueva, city of Chinandega, Reyna R. earns a living raising pigs. She has been doing this for five years now and from that she is able to provide for her two sons. Her two sons now need the most support from their mother in order to survive.

It’s very important to point out that Reyna has put in a lot of effort into her business. With much sacrifice, she has successfully run her business and has been able to provide for her family. For that reason today she needs a loan from Ceprodel. With this money she will purchase more pigs to be able to raise them and sell them.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San R. High School, Kiva volunteer

En el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Reyna R. se dedica a la labor de crianza de cerdos desde hace cinco años con el cual alimenta a sus dos hijos que hoy mas que nunca necesitan de su apoyo para subsistir.

Es de suma importancia destacar que esta dama se ha esforzado mucho en el negocio de los credos por lo que ha logrado con muchísimo sacrificio suplir las necesidades de su humilde hogar de habitación. Para ello hoy en día solicita crédito en Ceprodel con el único propósito de adquirir los cerdos para su respectiva crianza y venta en su local de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase pigs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Rosa Antonia

texts.es:
Rosa R. has dedicated 9 years of her life, to selling cheese, milk and other goods. She has her own store that she runs out of her home in the community of Villanueva and in the city of Chinandega.

It is important to point out that because of Rosa’s good relationships with her customers, she has been able to earn the money need to provide for her two daughters and herself. In order to continue the sale of these products, as with all businesses, she is in need of an investment in the purchase of milk products to sell. For this reason she is asking for the support of Ceprodel and she is very hopeful that she will receive the loan that she needs to be able to make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Gabe and Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

La dama Rosa R. por mas de nueve años se ha dedicado al negocio de venta de productos lácteos como lo son queso, cuajada y leche teniendo su propio establecimiento en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Es necesario destacar que debido a sus buenas relaciones con las demás personas, ha logrado salir adelante proporcionándole a su familia (ella y sus dos hijas) un bienestar para su futuro. Para continuar con su labor de venta de estos productos, como en todo negocio ella requiere la inversión en la compra de sus productos lácteos para comercializarlos. Por esto es que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel confiando que le será otorgado y de esta manera logrará mejorar la condición de su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Karolina De Las Merc

texts.es:
Ms. Z. has been working with our institution for the last two years. She has obtained two loans which she has used as working capital and to purchase fixed assets. When she began her business she kept her merchandise in bags and sacks. She now has two display cases where she displays her product. She is single and lives with one of her sisters in her mother’s home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Z. trabaja con nuestra institución desdehace dos años donde ha obtenido dos creditos los que ha utilizado para capital de trabajo y la compra de activo fijo, cuando inicio ella tenia el negocio pero su mercaderia la mantenia en bolsas y sacos, actualmente tiene dos vitrinas donde exibe el producto, ella es soltera vive con una hermana en la casa de su madre.

loans.use: Working capital and fixed assets. Clothing, cosmetics, shoes and a display case.

loans.name: Rosa Esperanza

texts.es:
Rosa Esperanza is a young woman who has worked hard for the past five years to start a small grocery store in her home which is in the community of Villanueva and in the city of Chinadega. Despite the economic troubles that she has suffered in her past, she has been able to better herself with the support of her husband and children, who occasionally help her to attend customers at her store.

Ceprodel has helped Rosa Esperanza with over five loans. These loans have provided her with the funds to buy more products for her store. Now she is asking for another loans so that she will be able achieve her dreams of expanding her small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Gabe and Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

La señora Rosa Esperanza P. Rios es una dama muy esforzada que desde hace cinco años se ha venido desempeñando en el negocio de pulpería el cual atiende en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Villanueva en Chinandega. A pesar de su difícil situación económica que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado, ha logrado salir adelante con el apoyo de su esposo e hijos que en ocasiones le ayudan en la venta.

Ceprodel le ha beneficiado más de cinco veces otorgándole créditos que le han permitido la adquisición de la mercadería para su comercialización. Hoy en día ella busca la manera de recibir una vez mas este apoyo confiando en que el crédito le será otorgado y de esta manera logrará cumplir su sueño de ampliación en su pulpería.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ciriaco Eluterio

texts.es:
Ciriaco A. is a man that owns his owns store where he sells different types of products. He has a variety of clients that live in the community of Villanueva, in the city of Chinandega in Nicaragua.

He started his business 8 years ago selling a limited variety of products, but time has gone by, and his inventory has increased and his business has grown thanks to the support that Ceprodel has given him. Coprodel has given him various loans and he has used the funds to purchase products to sell at his store. Presently, he is asking for another loan from Ceprodel so that he will be able to stock his store with more products.

Translated from Spanish by Gabe and Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

Ciriaco A. es un caballero que posee su propia pulpería donde vende diferentes tipos de productos a sus diferentes clientes habitantes del municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega en Nicaragua.

El negocio del señor A. nació desde hace 8 años ofreciendo pocos productos pero a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo, lo ha logrado desarrollar gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual le ha otorgado créditos que los ha utilizado para invertir en la compra de los productos para el negocio. Hoy en día, una vez más él busca el apoyo en la institución para ser privilegiado con los créditos que le permitan la compra de los productos para suplir su pulpería que tanto le ha costado desarrollar.

loans.use: Buy more products to stock his store

loans.name: Suyen Nataly

texts.es:
Suyen Vasquez is a single mother with two young children who is obligated to maintain and provide all of the daily needs for her kids' develpomkent. She is originally from the community of Villanueva in the city of Chinandega. Presently her biggest worry is having to fix her home, she hasn't had a chance to finish it due to her low daily income.

For that reason, today she is asking Ceprodel for a loan to be able to provide her children a safe, comfortable place to live. The loan will cover all the materials needed to continue fixing her home in Villanueva.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Suyen Vasquez es una madre soltera y con dos hijos infantes que tiene el deber de mantener y proporcionarles las condiciones de vida necesarias para su desarrollo. Ella es originaria del municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega. Actualmente la problemática que ella atraviesa es la urgencia de continuar con la reparación de su casa debido a que al haber iniciado esta labor, no la terminó por el hecho de que el recurso económico no lo tenía.

Por este motivo, hoy en día acude a Ceprodel con el convencimiento de que sus hijos necesitan un techo digno y para ello ha solicitado un crédito que le permita adquirir los materiales de construcción para continuar con su ardua labor de reconstrucción de su casa de habitación en Villanueva.

loans.use: Buy construction materials.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Ms. R. has been working with our institution for the last four years. She has obtained six loans which she has used as working capital. Growth in her business is apparent since her business has diversified and she now sells natural medicine. She is a single mother and has a son who is ill. She lives in her own home where she also has her business. Because Ms. R. was out, her employee is shown in the picture.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora R. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace cuatro años obteniendo seis creditos los que ha utilizado para capital de trabajo, se puede observar crecimiento en su negocio ya que ha tenido un crecimiento considerable, actualmente ha diversificado el negocio ya que tambien vende medicina natural, Es madre soltera tiene un hijo el cual es enfermo vive en casa propia donde tiene su negocio. en la foto aparece un empleado que ella tiene en su ngocio ya que ella estaba fuera

loans.use: Working capital to purchase clothing in bulk.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Leon 2000 - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Tiburcio Filimón

texts.es:
Tiburcio Filemon is a hardworking gentlemen who works in algrigulture in the community of Villanueva in the city of Chinandega. He is married and provides for his son. He works hard to provide everything his son needs.

Presently, Tiburcio M. is making sacfrices and working hard to make his buisness grow. For that he is requesting a loan that will allow him to purchase baby cows with the purpose of feeding them and raising them. His goal is to then be able to get the most return from the sale of milk products. This is why he is waiting anxiosly for Ceprodel to provide the help he needs to make his buisness grow.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Tiburcio Filimon es un caballero muy trabajador que se dedica al negocio agropecuario en el municipio de Villanueva de Chinandega. Es un caballero casado y con un hijo en su responsabilidad el cual se esfuerza para proporcionarle todo lo que le haga falta.

Hoy en día, con mucho sacrificio en su trabajo, el señor Tiburcio M. duplica sus esfuerzos en el negocio y para ello solicita en Ceprodel un crédito que le permita la compra de los terneros con el fin de alimentarlos y sacarle el máximo provecho de sus productos derivados para luego comercializarlos. Es por este motivo que espera muy confiadamente en que Ceprodel le proporcione el apoyo para así salir adelante en su negocio.

loans.use: purchase baby cows

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ms. V. has been working with our institution for the last eight years. She dedicates herself to the sale of clothing as a street vendor. She purchases her product in Managua, Honduras and El Salvador to bring merchandise to Nicaragua. When she first started working with us she rented a home, through her business she was able to purchase a lot of land where she currently makes her home. She is a single mother and has three children that are in grammar school and middle school.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora V. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace ocho años ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante ella compra en managua y viaja a Honduras y el Salvador del mismo modo trae mercadería de esos paises a nicaragua, cuando comenzo a trabajar con nosotros alquilaba casa, producto de su negocio logro comprar un solar donde actualmente tiene una regular vivienda, ella es madre soltera tiene tres hijos los que etudian dos en primaria y uno en secundaria.

loans.use: Working capital to purchase new clothing

loans.name: Martha Cristina

texts.es:
Ms. T. has been working with our institution for the last seven years. She has been given thirteen loans which she has used as working capital for her business. Her main business is the sale of tortillas but she also sells milk every morning and sells food on the weekends. She is a single mother and lives with one daughter who is in grammar school and with her mother. Her mother and another employee help her look after the business. It is important to note that good living conditions are apparent in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora T. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace unos seis años habiendosele otorgado trece creditos los que utiliza para capital de trabajo, su negocio principal es la venta de tortillas pero adicionalmente vende leche de vaca todas las mañanas y los fines de semana vende comida, es madre soltera vive con una hija la cual estudia en educación primaria, ademas vive con su madre quienes le ayudan a ver los negocios ademas de una empleada que tiene, cabe destacar que se puede observar en su casa buenas condiciones de vida .

loans.use: Working capital, corn, firewood and lime.

loans.name: Bocc Dieuf Group

texts.fr:
The group Bocc Dieuf comprises women who work n the fabrication of textile goods and the trade of food products, activities which do not require exorbitant means for women who have become the heads of their households to pull themselves out of precarious living conditions. This loan will allow the group to increase its supplies obtained from the louma (the weekly local market), to diversify its wares in both quality and quantity, to raise capital geared towards increasing business profits, and to revitalize its productivity and diversify the range of products intended for sale in the loumas.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Le groupement Bocc Dieuf est constitué de femmes qui s'activent dans la confection des articles textiles et dans le commerce de produits alimentaires, un travail ne nécessitant pas les voies royales pour sortir les femmes devenues chefs de ménage de la précarité. Ce prêt permettra d'élargir le systéme d'approvisionnement des louma et diversifier les offres en qualité et en quantité, renforcer le capital du groupemnt destiné aux activités de commerce pour augmenter les bénéfices, redynamiser la productitivté et diversifer des produits destinés à la vente dans les loumas. (Deux (2) membres ne sont pas sur la photo)

loans.use: To trade food products and to make textile goods

loans.name: Martha Alma

texts.es:
Ms. Toruno C. has been working with our institution for the last five years. During this time she has obtained seven loans which she has used as working capital to invest in the purchase of merchandise. She has also been given a loan to improve her home. She purchases her products from local businesses and sells to recurring clients. She is married and has older children who live on their own. Her husband is retired and she is the breadwinner.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora T. C. Trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace unos cinco obteniendo en este periodo siete creditos los que a utilizado para capital de trabajo invirtiendo en la compra de mercadería y se le ha otorgado credito para mejoramiento de su vivienda, ella compra en casas comerciales locales y vende a asalariados clientes fijos, es casada con hijos amyores que viven aparte de ella, el esposo es jubilado ella es el sosten de la casa y del negocio.

loans.use: Working capital and home improvements.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Leon 2000 - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ilela Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Agripina M. is a 26-year-old average Kenyan woman who is married with two children.

She has been in the business of selling fruits and vegetables for two years. She got her capital from accumulating small savings with a women’s group, a program that is commonly referred to as a “merry-go-round.” She currently operates a small grocery stall selling fruits and vegetables in the neighborhood where she resides with her family.

Agripina uses the profits from her business to feed, clothe, and educate her children. Her husband also relies on her, as he does not have a job. With the help of her loan, Agripina will be able to increase her grocery stock and also diversify her business to include selling fruit juice. This will help her to increase her monthly sales.

loans.use: To increase stock of grocery

loans.name: Carmen Beatriz

texts.es:
My name is Carmen Beatriz C. B., currently I am in the business of selling typical clothing in the village of Cruz Blanca of San Juan Sacatepequez where I live.  It has been approximately four years since I came into the business of selling clothing.  At first I helped a woman sell her merchandise on commission.  At that time I worked at a vegetable packing plant and, since I had already acquired experience selling clothing, I started to invest part of my salary in selling sweaters.  Thereafter, I got married and had a daughter so I dedicated myself completely to the business which is why I saw the need to invest more capital in the business.  I now also sell local clothing such as guipiles, shirts, shawls, girdles and other products which my clients might request such as sandals.  Since I now have a fixed clientele, I deliver the clothing to my customers' homes or they stop by my home to make their purchases.  What I want to accomplish is to be able to invest more capital and to put a stall in San Juan Sacatepequz.  However, this requires a lot of capital which is why I want to increase my clientele to obtain this capital.  This will allow me to take advantage of the important upcoming holidays. 



 Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.



Soy Carmen Beatriz C. B., actualmente mi negocio es vender ropa típica en la aldea Cruz Blanca de San Juan Sacatepéquez, es donde yo vivo. 
Hace aproximadamente  cuatro años que inicie en el negocio de la venta de ropa, pero primero yo únicamente le ayudaba a una señora a vender su mercadería y ella me pagaba una comisión, en ese entonces yo tenia un trabajo en una empacadora de verduras y con el salario que tenia, como yo ya había adquirido experiencia en la venta de ropa empecé a invertir parte de mi salario para vender suéteres, pero después que me case y que tengo ya una nena, me dediqué totalmente al negocio, por eso vi la necesidad de invertir más capital ya que, ahora vendo cortes típicos, güipiles, blusas, rebozos, fajas, y alguna otra cosa que mis clientas me van solicitando, como sandalias.  Como ya cuento con clientes fijos, la ropa la entrego en las casas de ellas o ellas llegan  a mi casa para comprar, pero lo que quiero lograr es poder invertir más capital y poder poner un local en San Juan Sacatepéquez, pero eso requiere de mucho capital, por lo que quiero primero ganar más clientes obtener ese capital que necesito y aprovechar las fechas importantes más próximas para vender y que en un plazo no muy largo pueda poner mi local.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of typical clothing

loans.name: Jamaica Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Ireen L. is an average young Kenyan woman; she is married and has four children of her own, as well as one child left by her late sister.

Ireen started her tailoring business two years ago, after completing a tailoring course in the town of Bungoma. Before venturing into the tailoring business, Ireen used to work for her aunt for a commission in Bungoma Municipality market, from which she accumulated the savings to start her own business. She initially started with one sewing machine, but she has worked hard to expand her business; she currently has two sewing machines, and she would like to purchase another sewing machine to allow her to train women who would like to be tailors also.

With the little profit that she makes from her business, she is still able to provide food, clothing, and shelter for her children. With the help of her loan, Ireen will be able to purchase another sewing machine and also buy some material to make clothing.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and materials to make clothing

loans.name: Trois Cocotiers 1 Group

texts.fr:
Trois Cocotiers is a group of women who are inspired by the same desire, and who work to provide local women with the power of decision. The group offers as a primary business the buying and selling of seafood products. This involves buying these highly desired products at the local market and then reselling them at a good price to the local population.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Trois cocotiers est un groupement de femmes animées d'une même volonté et qui oeuvrent pour le pouvoir de décision des femmes dans leur milieu. Le groupement se propose une activité principale qui consiste à l'achat et à la vente de produits halieutiques. il s'agit d'acheter les produits halieutiques trés sollicités dans le marché local et les revendre à bon prix aux populations locales.

loans.use: Achat et revente de produits halieutiques

loans.name: Juhudi Youth Group

texts.en:
Roselyne K. is married and is a middle-aged mother of two children. She also houses two other children, whom she has to feed, educate, and clothe. Roselyne is the breadwinner for her family, as her husband is currently a temporary worker in a local hotel and hence has little money to support the family.

Roselyne’s business is fish vending, which she started four years ago. She mainly concentrates on tilapia and omena (fingerlings), which she sells to her regular customers in the neighborhood. With the help of her loan, Roselyne will be able to expand her fish business to increase her monthly sales.

loans.use: To expand her fish business

loans.name: Serveliona

texts.en:
Serveliona P. (60) is a widow. She has three sons; two of them are married and living with their own families. The other one is living with his mother and helping her economically.

She was bon in Villarrica but 20 years ago she left her town to move to the city. She used to take care of some animals they owned, while her husband was working and generating most of the house’s income. But later on, Serveliona’s husband got sick and died. That is when Serveliona started worrying and looking for a way to earn some money.

Since she lives near two public schools, Serveliona had the ability to spot a business opportunity and she decided to open a stationary. In addition, she bought a sewing machine to make uniforms and then sell them to the schools.

The money provided by the credit will be used for the purchase of fabrics to produce more uniforms and to buy products for the stationary such as papers, pens, pencils among others.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics to produce more uniforms and to buy products for the stationary

loans.name: Trois Cocotiers 2 Group

texts.fr:
Ndiaye Ndiaye lacks a population capable of consuming all of its seafood production, which includes shrimp, oysters, and smoked fish.
