This is why these women have formed a group to finance their purchase of storage material to keep the seafood products fresh, and especially to transport the products to the larger cities to sell.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Ndiaye ndiaye est dépourvu de populations capable de consommer toute la production en produits de mer, comme les crevettes, les huitres se, les poissons fumés. C'est pourquoi les femmes se sont constitués en Groupement pour disposer de financements qui leur permettent d'acheter du matériel de stockage pour mettre bien au frais les produits halieutiques mais surtout à pouvoir acheminer les produits dans les grandes villes et les vendre.

loans.use: To buy material for the storage and re-sale of seafood products

loans.name: Víctor Alejandro

texts.es:
I have built some rooms on the second floor of this house.  I still need a concrete slab and exterior walls to completely finish the work and make the rooms ready for my kids.  I'm applying for a $1,000 loan for the slab and walls to complete the second floor addition.
Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
Tengo construidos unos cuartos en el segundo piso de la casa. Los cuales les esta haciendo falta la losa y los acabado del exterior para estar total mente terminados y así poderlos habitarla ya que son los cuartos de mis hijos e hijas. Solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls. para la losa y acabados del los cuartos en segundo piso de la casa.

loans.use: Concrete slab and exterior finishes for second floor addition.

loans.name: Bateni

texts.fr:
Mr. L. was born on December 31st, 1973 in Bogou in the community of Tandjoaré, in northern Togo. He is single and takes care of his two little brothers, both of whom go to school. By training he is a computer IT specialist. But in 2006, he started a business selling tires in Akodessewa neighborhood in Lomé, Togo's capital city. He buys his tires at the Lomé port. His main clients are auto mechanics. With his first credit, he would like to purchase 20 tires, in different sizes, so as to provide a good selection to his clients.

Translated from French by Megan Berwick, Kiva Fellow at WAGES.

Monsieur L. Bateni est né le 31 décembre 1973 à Bogou dans la préfecture de Tandjoaré au nord du Togo. Il est célibataire et assure la charge de ses deux (2) petits frères qui vont à l’école. Il est informaticien de formation. Mais en 2006, il s’est lancé dans le commerce de pneus dans le quartier d’Akodessewa à Lomé. Il s’approvisionne au port autonome de Lomé. Ses principaux clients sont les mécaniciens à quatre roux. Avec ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite il envisage acheter vingt (20) pneus de véhicules.

loans.use: The purchase of tires in a variety of sizes to offer a good selection to his clients.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
We have been making improvements to the house but we still need to waterproof the roof and finish the exterior. At the moment, however, we don't have all the funds we need to do the work. We're applying for a $1,200 loan to waterproof the roof before the upcoming rainy season.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Hace tiempo le hemos estado haciendo mejoras a la casa pero nada mas nos esta haciendo falta impermeabilizar el techo y los acabados del exterior de la casa. Pero por el mometo no tenemos le monto necesario para realizar estos detalles. Solicitamos un préstamo de $ 1,200.00 dlls. Para impermeabilizar el techo ya que se esta presentando la temporada de lluvias.

loans.use: Waterproofing and exterior finishes.

loans.name: Youssifou

texts.fr:
Born on August 5th, 1975 in Kpalimé, in the county of Kloto, about 120km from Lomé, Mr. D. is married and the father of two children. He sells leather shoes and wallets at the Main Market in Lomé. He started this business in 2006, and performs it with a professionalism which has won him the confidence of his clients. This is his first loan, and it will permit him to increase his stock by buying four boxes of shoes of two different qualities.

Translated from French by Megan Berwick, Kiva Fellow at WAGES.

Né le 05 août 1975 à Kpalimé dans la préfecture de Kloto (à 120 km de Lomé), Monsieur D. Youssifou est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. Il a pour activité principale la vente de chaussures et de porte monnaies au grand marché de Lomé. Il a commencé cette activité et l’exerce avec professionnalisme depuis 2006 ; ce qui lui fait gagner la confiance de ses clients. Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’augmenter son stock par l’achat de quatre (4) cartons de chaussures de deux qualités différentes.

loans.use: To purchase two different styles of shoes to offer a variety to his clients.

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ivania lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of Managua. She's 24 years old, married and the mother of three children: 4, 6 and 7 years old. Her husband works as a construction laborer, contributing to the family's expenses. Ivania operates a "pulperia", a small general store, that is now a year old. She started the business with a loan from AFODENIC.

The loan that Ivania wants is to for inventory and new products. In the future, she wants to improve her modest house and give her children a decent place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Ivania habita en los Laureles Norte, es casada tiene 24 años de edad tiene tres hijos de 4,6 y 7 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja de ayudante de albañilería y aporta a los gasto de la familia, el negocio que tiene la Sra. es una pulpería, que tiene un año. Su negocio lo inicio con un crédito que le brindo AFODENIC.

El préstamo lo quiere para comprar inventario y comprar más productos. A futuro poder levantar su casa ya que es humilde, lograr un techo mas digno para sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Yenoubé Sinandja

texts.fr:
Mr. Yenoubé Sinandja K. was born on August 7th, 1969 in Korbongou, in the county of Tône in the far northern region of Togo. He is single, and takes care of two other people. Since 2003, he has run a shop that sells tires, motor oil, and spare parts. The name of his shop is "Fidel Routier" or the Honest Road. It is situated in Nukafu neighborhood in Lomé. One year later, he opened another shop in the Attikoumé neighborhood to be closer to his clients from the northwest part of the city. This is his first loan, and with it he will buy twenty tires, and three containers of oil. 

Translated from French by Megan Berwick, Kiva Fellow at WAGES. 

Monsieur K. Yenoubé Sinandja est  né le 07 août 1969 à Korbongou dans la préfecture de Tône à l’extrême nord du Togo. Il est célibataire et a deux personnes à charge. Depuis 2003, il a mis en place un magasin de vente de pneus, d’huile à moteur et des pièces de rechange sous le nom de « FIDEL ROUTIER » dans le quartier de Nukafu à Lomé. Un an plutard, il a ouvert un magasin annexe dans le quartier Attikoumé pour être plus proche de ses clients qui viennent des quartiers situant au nord ouest de Lomé.
Le premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter vingt (20) pneus d’occasion et trois (3) bidons d’huile à moteur.

loans.use: To purchase tires, motor oil, and spare parts.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
We bought the house some years ago, but we haven't been able to do the work necessary to finish it as we planned because we don't have the capital to do so. That's why I'm applying for a $700 loan: to complete the inside of the house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Tenemos ya algunos años que adquirimos la vivienda. Pero no hemos podido dar el mantenimiento que necesita de los acabados por falta de capital. Es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $700.00 dlls. Para los acabados del interior de la casa.

loans.use: Complete renovations of interior.

loans.name: Heidy

texts.es:
The house that we own is one that was built inexpensively and, like others, somewhat small.  We want to add a room but we lack the materials to finish the work.  We're applying for a $500 loan to buy materials to finish the room.
Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
La casa que tenemos es de las económicas y están algo reducidas. Queremos terminar un cuarto pero nos esta faltando material para terminarlo. Solicitamos un préstamo de $500.00 dlls. Para la comprar de material para la terminación de un cuarto.

loans.use: Finish room.

loans.name: Aboudoudermane

texts.fr:
Born in 1979 in the city of Amaide in the county of Tchaoudjo, Mr. Aboudoudermane Y. is married, and father of three children, all of whom go to school. In 1998, he opened this shop to sell goods and basic necessities, as the neighborhood is a bit removed from central Lomé. It is primarily a Muslim neighborhood. He has the only shop of this kind in the neighborhood, and maintains strong sales. As he has many customers, he is taking his first loan in order to augment his stock with six sacks of rice, three barrels of vegetable oil, and two cartons of milk.

Translated from French by Megan Berwick, Kiva Fellow at WAGES. 

Né en 1979 à Amaide dans la préfecture de Tchaoudjo, Monsieur Y. Aboudoudermane est marié et père de trois (3) enfants qui fréquentent tous. En 1998, il a ouvert un magasin de vente des produits de premières nécessités dans un quartier peu éloigné de Lomé. Actuellement ce quartier est habité par les musulmans. Il est le seul à ouvrir son magasin dans ce quartier et réalise beaucoup de vente. Compte tenu de l’affluence des acheteurs, il sollicite pour la première fois un prêts pour acheter six (6) sacs de riz, trois (3) bidons d’huile végétale et deux (2) cartons de lait.

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking oil, and milk to sell in his general store.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Señor Vicente Villaba is married to Señora Zulma Ramirez. They have 2 kids: a girl, Zulema, who is in 4th grade, and a boy, David, who is in 2nd grade. Vicente tells us that his children are the biggest miracle in his life, and all of the work and sacrifice that he does is to provide them with a better future.

Vicente has a hardware store where he sells various articles like paint, cables, hammers, nails, wires, electrical items, flashlights, pliers, and other items. Vicente told us that he started his business in 1986 and sold bazaar items. He then added hardware items, and this is currently his main business since there are few businesses in the area that sell these type of items.

Today he would like to expand his stock of merchandise, especially paint, since there is a shortage of paint in the city. He hopes to be one of the biggest suppliers of quality paint in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El Señor Vicente Villaba esta casado con la Sra. Zulma Ramirez y tienen dos hijos; una niña Zulema que está cursando el 4to grado de la primaria y David que está en el 2do. Grado; Vicente cuenta que sus hijos son el milagro más grande de su vida y que todo el trabajo y sacrificio que hace es para proveerles a ellos de un mejor futuro.

Vicente posee una ferretería en donde comercializa artículos varios como pinturas, cables, martillos, clavos, alambres, artículos eléctricos, focos, pinzas, entre otros. Vicente nos contó que empezó su negocio en el año 1.986 primeramente vendía artículos de bazar y mercería; luego fue agregando artículos de ferretería y actualmente este es el rubro principal, ya que en la zona existen muy pocos negocios que se dediquen a la venta de este tipo de artículos.

Hoy día el tiene proyectado ampliar su stock de mercaderías especialmente de pinturas, ya que en la ciudad escasea la venta de pinturas y el desea ser uno de los mayores proveedores de pinturas de la ciudad.

loans.use: To purchase paint

loans.name: Akpénè

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akpénè F., maiden name D., was born on September 29th, 1961 in Gbalavé. She is married and the mother of two children. She has sold cloth in the Hédzranawoé Market in Lomé since 1993. She usually buys cloth that comes from China at the Main Market in Lomé, and sells it at her stand in the Hédzranawoé Market. She also helps her husband who sells beverages. She currently has a wide variety of cloth, so with her first loan she would like to diversify her business by selling cosmetic products. To that end, she would like to buy two boxes of cream and one box of perfurme. She will also augment her stock of cloth with twenty seven new pieces of cloth, each in different styles and designs.

Translated from French by Megan Berwick, Kiva Fellow at WAGES.

Madame F. E. D. Akpénè est née le 29 septembre 1961 à Gbalavé. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Depuis 1993, elle exerce le commerce de pagne dans le marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Elle a l’habitude d’acheter les pagnes au grand marché de Lomé et de la chine avant de les revendre dans le marché de Hédzranawoé. Elle aide son mari qui est un revendeur de boisson. Actuellement son stock de pagne n’est pas épuisé mais avec le crédit qu’elle sollicite, elle désire associer le commerce des produits cosmétiques. A cet effet elle désir acheter deux (2) cartons de crème, un (1) carton de parfum, et vingt sept (27) pièces de pagne.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to diversify her business, as well as new types of cloth.

loans.name: Antolín

texts.es:
Mr. Antolín C., 45 years old, has been married for 19 years to Mrs. Rosalina Arellano, 35 years old, and together they have 3 daughters, ages 10, 5 and 3. The older two are studying in elementary school and the youngest will start next year.

Antonín has worked for several years in a disassembly business, but with a reduction in staff he finds himself without a job. With the compensation that he recieved he opened his own capentry shop and already has a good clientele. His main clients are the big furniture stores in the city for whom he prepares pieces of furnitures such as tables, beds, sofa sets, and others. His wifes helps him in tending to the business, while he focuses exclusively on making the furniture.

Thanks to the great demand for his work, today he is requesting a loan to buy wood in large quantity so that he can get a good price from his suppliers.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Antolín C. de 45 años de edad está casado hace 19 años con la señora Rosalina Arellano de 35 años, la pareja tiene tres hijas de 10, 5 y 3 años; las dos hijas mayores están estudiando ya van a la escuela primaria, y la mas pequeña asistirá el próximo año.

El señor Antolín trabajo varios años en un desmontadora, pero con una reducción de personal que hubo el quedo sin empleo. Con el dinero que cobró como indemnización que abrió su propio taller de carpintería y actualmente ya cuenta con una buena clientela formada. Sus principales clientes son mueblerías grandes de la ciudad para los cuales el prepara mubles como mesas, camas, juegos de sillones, entre otros. Su esposa la ayuda con la atención del negocio, mientras que el se dedica exclusivamente a la fabricación de los muebles.

Gracias a la gran demanda de su trabajo el hoy solicita el préstamo para la comprar maderas en grandes cantidades ya que de este modo consigue buen precio de sus proveedores.

loans.use: Buying wood for his capentry business

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Sr. Enrique Martínez is 53 years old and is married to 49-year old Venancia Cáceres. They have four children aged 27, 25, 22, and 19. The eldest is employed in a well-known business in the city, and the others are university students in Business Administration and Accounting.

Enrique raises and sells cattle. He began this work in 1972 when he was still single. After getting married, he continued with the same work but with the help of his family. A year ago he opened his own butcher's shop located on the main street of the town.

His butcher's shop is one of the biggest in the city with a large number of clients who shop there every day for meat and meat products. Currently the couple's main objective is for their children to complete their university education so that one day they can manage and expand the business started by their father.

Enrique is asking for a loan to buy cattle to raise and then sell the meat in his butcher's shop, and in this way satisfy the big demand for his products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Enrique Martínez de 53 años de edad está casado hace 28 años con la señora Venancia Cáceres de 49 años, la pareja tiene cuatro hijos de 27,25, 22 y 19 años; el mayor de todos trabaja como empleado en una conocida empresa de la ciudad, y los demás están estudiando carreras universitaria de Administración de Empresa y Contabilidad

El señor Enrique se dedica a la cría y venta de animales vacunos, se inicio en este trabajo en el año 1972 cuando aún era soltero; luego de casarse él continuo con el mismo junto con el apoyo de su familia y hace un año inauguró su propia carnicería ubicado sobre la avenida principal de la ciudad.

La carnicería es una de las más grandes de la ciudad, posee una buena cantidad de clientes que todos los días acuden a su negocio para comprar carne y derivados. Actualmente la pareja tiene como objetivo principal que sus hijos terminen su carrera universitaria, para que el día de mañana ellos puedan administrar y expandir el negocio iniciado por su padre.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de animales vacunos para luego faenar y comercializar en su carnicería y de este modo abastecer la gran demanda de carne que hay.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Ligia Maria

texts.es:
Señora Ligia is 38-years-old. She lives in Laureles Sur. She is single and has three children, who are 2, 10, and 15. Her business is a grocery store, and she has 7 years of experience. She started her business with her own funds and with help from her family. Her daughters help her to wait on customers, and together they break barriers and myths to get ahead.

She would like this loan to invest more in her grocery store, to have more to offer her customers, and to satisfy basic needs. In the future, she would like her kids to better themselves and become professionals so they can have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Ligia tiene 38 años de edad, vive el los Laureles Sur, es soltera y tiene tres hijos de 2, 10, y 15 años. El negocio es una pulpería, y tiene siete años de experiencia, y su negocio lo comenzó con sus propios fondo y ayuda familiar, sus hijas le ayudan a despachar y juntas van rompiendo barreras y mitos para salir adelante.

El préstamo lo quiere par invertir mas en la pulpería, y así tener mas que ofrecer a sus clientes y sastifacer las necesidades básicas. A futuro es que sus hijos puedan superarse que sean personas profesionales para que tengan un nivel de vida mejor.

loans.use: Purchase of products for her grocery store

loans.name: Santos Antonia

texts.es:
Mrs. C. lives in Bertha Diaz. She is 59 years old and has one daughter. She is single and she sells prepared food. She has been doing good because she has a good location at the market with access to two roads. She started her business with her own money and she settled at a terminal on Route 106. Currently, she runs the business along with a helper because her daughter got married and is independent now. She plans to invest the loan to purchase a line of perfumes and cosmetics. In the future she wishes to set up a small café.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. C. habita en el barrio Bertha Díaz , tiene 59 años de edad, y una hija, es soltera y su negocio es que tiene un comedor de comida, y son ya diez años de experiencia y le ha ido bien, por que esta en un buen puesto en el mercado y es una Terminal de rutas. Su negocio lo comenzó con fondos propios y se instalo en una Terminal de la ruta 106. Actualmente el negocio solo ella y su ayudanta lo administran, ya que su hija ya se caso y es independiente, con el préstamo desea invertir una línea de cosmético y perfume. A futuro desea poner un cafetín.

loans.use: Invest in business diversification.

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es:
Señora G. is married and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She is 32-years-old and has 3 children, who are 2, 10, and 12. Her husband is a teacher at a high school. Her business is selling American clothing. She has 3 years of experience. She started her business with her own funds.

She would like this loan to finish constructing a wall for better security for her home. In the future, she hopes to start a store in her house, to finish constructing her house, and to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. G., es casada y vive en el barrio Laureles Norte tiene 32 años de edad y tiene tres hijos de 2, 10 y 12 años de edad.Su esposo trabaja es docente de un colegio y aporta a su familia. Su negocio de ella es la venta de ropa americana tiene tres años de experiencia, comenzó su negocio con fondos propios.

loans.use: Construction of a wall to protect her home

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Sr. Mario Goiri is 31 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the city of Caaguazú. A few years ago, Mario worked in a carpenter's shop where he learned the skills to become a carpenter himself. He worked hard to save a small amount of capital, enough to start his own carpentry business.

He has owned this business since 1991. He makes fine furniture such as beds with turned legs and headboards, carved beds, carved wardrobes, laminate wardrobes, cabinets, chests of drawers, and dining room sets.

Because of the quality and range of his products, he has built up a regular clientele. The loan requested will be used to buy hardware such as nails, locks, wrenches, and adhesive so he can continue responding to the many requests of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Mario Goiri de 31 años de edad es soltero, vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Caaguazú. Hace unos años atrás, Mario fue empleado de una carpintería, en donde adquirió suficiente experiencia para ejercer esta profesión. Con trabajo él fué ahorrando hasta obtener capital mínimo pero suficiente para emprender su propia carpintería.

Desde el año 1.991, Mario, posee su carpintería y se dedica a fabricar finos muebles como: camas torneadas, camas talladas, roperos tallados y formicados, placares, cómodas y juegos de comedores.

Gracias a la calidad y variedad de sus productos tiene una clientela bien formada. El crédito que solicita fue para comprar artículos de ferretería como clavos, cerraduras, llaves y pegamento para poder seguir abasteciendo la amplia demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy nails, locks, wrenches, and adhesive.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Señor José is 36-years-old, and he lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. He is married and has 2 children, who are 10 and 13. His wife works as a receptionist and supports him with paying for their home's expenses.

Señor Zúniga is a driver, and he would like this loan to construct a garage. In the future, he wants to finish his house so his children have a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. José tiene 36 años de edad, y habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, es casado y le tienen dos hijos de 10 y 13 años de edad. Su esposa trabaja como conserje y aporta alos gastos del hogar.

El Sr. Zúniga es conductor y el préstamo lo quiere para construir un garaje a futuro terminar de hacer su casa y que sus hijos tengan una vivienda digna.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Tarajio Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Mildred A. is an average 40-year-old Kenyan woman who is married with four children. Also living with her are two orphaned children, left by her late sister.

Mildred started operating her business six years ago because the income of her husband, who is a small-scale farmer, was too little to support all their family's needs. Mildred is now able to purchase at least three bales of secondhand bags every week to sell to her regular customers. With the little profit that she gets from this small-scale business, Mildred is able to feed, clothe, and educate her children. With the help of her loan, Mildred hopes to purchase more bales of secondhand bags to enable her to increase her monthly sales. In the future, Mildred would like to open a shop in her hometown, Bungoma, in the Western part of Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase handbags in bulk

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina is a 64 year old woman that has spent all of her life looking for ways to bring income into her home. She has always taken advantage of any business opportunity. Throughout her life she has sold everything from seafood to pants during the Christmas season. She says she was 12 years old when she started to work, including offering cleaning services inside some houses. Once she was married she managed to have a family and have six children, whom are all now adults. When she separated from her husband, the need to have a more stable job increased. It was with the help of one of her daughters, Elena Suarez, that she started a business selling food. It has been 13 years that they both have been selling sandwiches, sodas and beer at nights in a counter outside of her house.

Despite the adversities that Sabina has faced, such as the passing of one of her children four years ago and the aggravation of her illness (due to circulation), she has continued ahead because she has the unconditional support of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Sabina es una mujer de sesenta y cuatro años que ha pasado toda su vida buscando el modo de llevar un ingreso a su hogar. Siempre aprovechaba cualquier oportunidad de negocio. Así, a lo largo de su vida ella ha vendido desde pescado hasta panetones en temporada navideña. Ella cuenta que desde que tenía doce años empezó a trabajar, incluso ofreciendo servicios de limpieza dentro de algunas casas. Una vez que contrajo matrimonio llegó a formar su familia y tener seis hijos, quienes ya son mayores. Cuando se separo de su esposo, la necesidad de contar con un trabajo más estable creció. Fue con la ayuda de una de sus hijas, Elena Suarez que se animo a empezar el negocio de venta de comidas. Desde hace trece años ambas se dedican a vender sandwiches, gaseosas y cerveza por las noches en una especie de fuente de soda afuera de su casa. A pesar de las adversidades que se la ha presentado a Sabína, como el fallecimiento de uno de sus hijos hace cuatro años y el agravamiento de su enfermedad (de la circulación), ella sigue adelante pues tiene el apoyo incondicional de sus hijos.

loans.use: To supply her food kiosk

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
Señora M. has worked with our institution since two years ago when she obtained four credits that she used to buy general merchandise. In addition to her shop, she has a cybercafe in her house. She is married with three young children. Her husband works, and they display acceptable conditions of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora M. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace dos años obteniendo cuatro creditos los que ha utilizado para compra de mercadería en general ademas del negocio de mercaderia tiene un cyber en su casa es casada con tres hijos menores su esposo trabaja y presentan condiciones de vida aceptables.

loans.use: Working capital for general merchandise

loans.name: Jose De La Cruz

texts.es:
Señor José is married. He has one daughter and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. His wife works as a merchant and supports him with paying for the home's expenses. Señor José has a grocery store and has 25 years of experience. He started his business with his own funds. It was hard for him to acquire customers when he opened the store, but now he has many and sells a lot.

With this loan, he hopes to improve the bathrooms in his home because they are in bad shape. In the future, he hopes to expand his grocery store and support his daughter by giving her a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El Sr., José es casado, le tienen una hija y habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, su esposa trabaja como comerciante y apoya en los gastos del hogar. El Sr. José tiene una pulpería y con veinte cinco años de experiencia. Su negocio lo comenzó con fondos propios, y le costo conseguir clientes en su apertura pero ahora ya tiene muchos cliente y vende bastante.

Con el préstamo desea mejorar los baños de su casa que están en mal estado. A futuro desea agrandar más la pulpería y apoyar a su hija y darle una preparación educativa.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
When she was in her second year of college studying education Blanca suffered the loss of her husband. The obligation to look after the support and attention of her children made her abandon her studies in order to look for a job. She managed to work in a school as a teacher for a couple of years and it was going well for her but she also need to look after her house and children. For this reason it occurred to her to set up a daycare center in her own home since she loves children. There she takes care of children from 3 to 10 years of age. She has been offering this service (Mondays-Saturday) for five years.

The goal that Blanca is pursuing is seeing her children finish school and college. The children have for their part promised that when they grow up and have a good job she will not have to work anymore. Until that time, she will continue giving her all in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Cuando cursaba el segundo año de su carrera de Pedagogía Blanca sufrió la pérdida de su esposo. La obligación de ocuparse del mantenimiento y atención de sus tres hijos hizo que abandonara sus estudios para poder buscar un trabajo. Llego a trabajar en un colegio como profesora por un par de años, le iba bien pero también debía ocuparse de su casa y de sus hijos. Es así que se le ocurrió poner una guardería en su propia vivienda ya que le gustaban los niños. Ahí ella cuida de niños desde tres años hasta diez años de edad. Actualmente lleva cinco años ofreciendo este servicio de lunes a sábado.

La meta que persigue Blanca es ver a sus hijos terminar sus estudios escolares y universitarios. Ellos por su parte le han prometido que cuando ellos crezcan y tengan un buen trabajo ella no tendrá la necesidad de trabajar más. Hasta ese momento ella seguirá dando todo de si en su trabajo.

loans.use: Buying educational materials for her child care center

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Señora P. has worked with our institution since about nine years ago when she used a loan to invest in working capital, reinvesting her profits in improving her house and lifestyle. She has noticed growth in her business. She is married, and her husband helps her with the business and works for a security company. She has two children, one married and one sickly.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora P. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace unos nueve años los que ha utilizado para invertir en capital de trabajo, reinvirtiendo utilidades en mejoras de su casa y condiciones de vida se nota un crecimiento del negocio es casada su esposo le ayuda en el negocio y trabaja en una empresa de seguridad, tiene dos hijos una casada y un hijo con problemas de enfermedad.

loans.use: Working Capital for General Merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Leon 2000 - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Señora Victoria is 57 years old and married to 62-year old Luis. They have two children who are married with their own families.

Victoria is a street vendor, selling products such as clothing, sheets, perfume, and silver jewellery. In her free time she makes clothing. She already has built up a regular clientele because she offers low prices with easy credit terms that can be paid in convenient instalments.

Victoria wants to open a small shop in which to display her products and so get more customers. She is saving up for this and plans to realise her dream in the coming year. At this time she is asking for a loan with which to buy items for re-sale, items such as silver jewellery and perfume since these are the products most in demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Victoria de 57 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Luis de 62 años de edad. El Matrimonio tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya están casados y han formado su propia familia.

Doña Victoria es vendedora ambulante de ropas, sabanas, perfumes, joyas de plata y en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la costura de ropas. Ella ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada, ofrece sus productos a bajo precio y con buena facilidad de pago, ya que ofrece sus mercaderías en cómodas cuotas.

La Sra. Victoria desea poner una boutique para exhibir sus productos y obtener mayor clientela, para ello esta ahorrando y proyecta realizar su sueño el año que viene. Hoy ella está solicitando un préstamo con el que podrá adquirir mercaderías como joyas platas, y perfumes para la venta ya que estos son los de mayor demanda por sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy jewellery and perfume

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Señora Elisa is 62 years old and is married to 65-year old Sr. Juan. They have four children all of whom are married. Elisa is the owner of a store which she started in 1990. The business was inherited from her mother, and Elisa has built up a regular clientele because of the good service that she offers. Her husband also helps in the store.

Elisa's personal dream is to expand her business so that she can offer more convenience and a wider range of products to her customers.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as a range of drinks, rice, noodles, vegetables, fruit, and corn, for which there is a great demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Elisa de 62 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Juan de 65 años de edad. El Matrimonio tiene cuatro hijos los cuales ya están casados.

Doña Elisa es propietaria de una despensa en el cual se inició en el año 1990. El negocio heredo de su madre, Elisa ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada gracias a la buena atención que le ofrece a sus clientes, en el negocio recibe la ayuda de su marido.

Elisa como un sueño personal, desea ampliar su negocio para llegar a ofrecer mejor comodidad y más variedades de productos a sus clientes.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como: bebidas en general, arroz, fideos, verduras, frutas y granos de maíz, ya que tiene mucha de demanda de dichos productos.

loans.use: To purchase a range of drinks, rice, noodles, vegetables, fruit, and corn.

loans.name: Rosario Angelina

texts.es:
Señora Rosario has worked with our institution since some 14 years ago when she obtained 19 credits that she used to kick start her business, located in the bus station. She is able to see that through these years she has bettered her lifestyle and also that the business has helped a daughter who is out of the country. She is a widow living with one daughter who helps her mother with the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace unos catorce años obteniendo diecinueve creditos los que ha utilizado para surtir su negocio ubicado en la terminal de buses, se puede observar que atraves de estos años ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida ya que ademas del negocio cuenta con ayuda de una hija que esta fuera del pais, es viuda vive con una hija la que le ayude en el negocio.

loans.use: Working capital to buy fruits and vegetables

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Leon 2000 - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria M. is 35 years old. She lives in Laureles Norte. She is married and her husband gives her unconditional support. She works as a saleswoman at a local optical store called Alfa. She has three children and all her effort goes towards providing them with the best life possible. She has made some improvement to her home using money from her salary but she needs this credit line in order to repair the roof.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

La Joven Señora Maria M. de 35 años de edad, habita en los Laureles Norte , es casada su esposo es un apoyo incondional , ella trabaja con vendedora en la optica alfa, tiene tres hijos y todo su esfuerzo es pra darles lo mejor a ellos quien con su saalrio ha ido mejorando la vivienda pero necesita el credito para realizarle unas mejoras en el techo

loans.use: Home improvement.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Ever since she had her first opportunity to work Rosario hasn't rested when it's come to work. She has always liked business and once she married her husband she thought about opening her own grocery store. Upon building her house they dedicated space for the store. And today, it has been 25 years since Rosario started managing it, tending to it and helping it grow.

On the other hand, Rosario and her husband, who has already retired from working in a soft drink factory, prepare around 200 tamales on the weekends to sell to friends and family. Thanks to this, the flavorful cooking of Rosario has become known and she frequently receives requests for her tamales for events and parties. In any case, on the weekends she also, apart from selling her tamales and attending to her grocery store, prepares typical platters to also sell at the store.

She only lives with her husband and grandson of 10 years of age, whom they take care of and support. Rosario says that she doesn't receive any allowance from her son to take care of her grandson so she dedicates the money that she receives from renting a room in her house for his expenses. In the future, she would like to convert her grocery store into a bazaar since she considers that would be more more profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde que tuvo su primera oportunidad de trabajar Rosario no ha descansado nunca cuando de trabajo se trataba. A ella siempre le gusto el negocio y una vez que se caso con su esposo pensó en abrir una bodega propia. Al construir su casa designaron un espacio para ambientar el local de su bodega. Y hoy ya hace veinticinco años que Rosario se encarga de manejarla, de atender y de hacerla crecer.

Por otro lado, Rosario y su esposo quien ya e jubilado por trabajar en una fábrica de bebidas gasificadas, preparan alrededor de 200 tamales los fines de semana para venderlos amigos y familiares. Gracias a esto, la sazón de Rosario se ha hecho conocida y frecuentemente recibe pedidos de tamales para algunos eventos o fiestas. De todos modos, ella los fines de semana a parte de vender sus tamales y de atender en su bodega, prepara algunos platos típicos y los vende en su bodega también.

Ella vive únicamente con su esposo y con su nieto de diez años, a quien cuida y mantiene también. Rosario cuenta que no recibe ninguna pensión de su hijo para el cuidado de su nieto es así que destina el dinero que recibe por el alquiler de una habitación en su casa para los gastos de él. Más adelante ella desearía convertir su bodega en un bazar pues lo considera más rentable.

loans.use: Buying merchandise to supply her grocery store

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
Mr. Juan lives in Caralampio. He is 44 years old and married. His wife works in the retail business and helps out with the home's expenses. They have three children - one of them works and the other two are in school. Juan's business is an auto shop specialized in electrical repairs that he started with his own money. This venture has grown steadily and he wishes to apply the loan to make improvements and buy replacement parts for the shop so that he can better serve his customers. He plans on keep expanding his auto shop because his family's survival depends on it.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Juan, habita en San Caralampio, es casado de 44 años de edad, su esposa es comerciante y aporta en los gasto del hogar, le tienen tres hijos, uno ya trabaja y los otros estudian. El negocio del Sr. Juan es un taller de electricidad automotriz que comenzó con fondos propios, su negocio ha venido creciendo y con el préstamo desea mejorar las condiciones del taller y comprar repuestos para sastifacer a los clientes, a futuro es seguir mejorando el taller ya que es su fuente de vida y la de su familia

loans.use: Purchase replacement parts for auto shop.

loans.name: Essodokam

texts.fr:
Mrs. Essodokam A. was born on December 23rd, 1976 in Pessare in the county of Binah. She is married with one child. In 1998, she started her sewing shop, "Couture Dieu Benit" in the Agoè neighborhood of Lomé. She is a very talented woman and employs a number of young women enjoy learning how to sew and make clothing in her shop. In fact, she has a group of nine young women who are her apprentices. Her business is going well, and she needs more machines to keep up with the work. For this reason, she has requested a loan to purchase a new sewing machine.

Translated from French by Megan Berwick, Kiva Fellow at WAGES.

Madame A. Essodokam est née le 23 décembre 1976 à Pessare dans la préfecture de la BINAH. Elle est mariée et a un enfant. En 1998, elle a crée un atelier de couture « COUTURE DIEU BENIT » dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Elle est une femme très talentueuse et les jeunes filles aiment apprendre la couture chez elle. Actuellement, elle encadre neuf (9) filles qui sont en apprentissage. Son atelier marche bien et elle a besoin de s’équipier en machines nécessaires pour son métier, c’est d’ailleurs, ce qui l’amène à solliciter ce prêt pour acquérir une machine à plainte.

loans.use: Mrs. Assale will buy a new sewing machine for her shop.

loans.name: Villa Florida Group

texts.en:
“Villa Florida” is a small rural community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari project, which provides its credit with education services in the rural areas of Huancavelica. Huancavelica is considered one of the poorest regions of Peru and has many limitations being a very mountainous area (altituD. ranges from 2,000 – 5,000 meters above sea level), the cold, the difficulty of growing crops and the lack of an adequate infrastructure of roads and communication systems.

BCR “Villa Florida” is located at approximately 3,500 meters above sea-level, in the community of Huanchos, in the district of Paucarbamba, province of Churcampa. The main activities of the population are the growing of corn, potatoes and wheat, and also raising cows, bulls and sheep. In the small town the population have some shops and proviD. several services.

Currently the bank has initiated its fourth loan cycle with 15 female borrowers and a total loan of 6,200 soles (about 2,225 US$). The loans range from 200, 400, 600, and up to 1,200 soles. The group already is in its fourth loan cycle, with one and half years of existence, and is one of the “oldest” community banks is the Wari project. In the time with FINCA Peru the members have learned to save, be more responsible with money and in their business. They have learned to be punctual and to respect each other. The dream for all is to make their business grow and to have a higher income in future. Most of the members use their loans for buying school supplies for the children or to increase merchandise for their business.

One of the members of the community bank is Sonilda Tristán T.. Sonilda has a small shop where she sells marmalades and sweets with she buys in Huancayo. With her 200 soles loan, she will buy more things for her business. Over time, with FINCA Perú she was able to save over 500 soles, which she used took out to buy herself a refrigerator. And her future savings she will use for making her house a little more comfortable and buying a television.

Another story tells of Flor Edith V. Tristán, a mother of 2 children: one of 6 years, the other 3 years old. She has her business of raising small animals like pigs, chickens and guinea-pigs. And in her small shop, she sells cheese that she buys from local producers. With her 400 soles loan she will buy more animals. When asked about her savings she tells us that she uses them for buying clothes for her children. Her dream for the future is to buy a car and to move to a bigger city, like Huancayo or the country’s capital of Lima, where it will be more easy to run a business because there is more economical movement.

loans.use: buy new supplies

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Before having her own shop, Lucila started out working for a textile company. When this company failed, she and a friend decided to put together the money they received from leaving the job and put up a textile workshop next to it. They bought the basic machines needed to start and today, two years after having started their business, they now make all types of garments.

For her part, Lucile sells creole food and diverse beverages with her mother and her seventeen year old daughter on the weekends. She also makes tamales to sell Sunday mornings. She is always looking for ways to take advantage of the time to earn money that will her support her two children and her mother. She has been both a mother and father to her two children for the 11 years since she separated from her ex-husband.

Now what she wants more than anything is to have her own restaurant and juice shop; for this she has the total support of her oldest daughter who is pursuing the same dream.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Antes de tener su taller de confección propio, Lucila trabajaba inicialmente para una compañía de textiles. Cuando esta compañía fracasó ella y una amiga decidieron juntar la liquidación que recibieron al retirarse del trabajo y poner un taller de confección por su lado. Compraron las máquinas básicas para empezar y hoy, a dos años de haber iniciado su negocio, ya confeccionan todo tipo de prendas.

Por su parte, Lucila vende comida criolla y diversas bebidas con su mamá y su hija de diecisiete años los fines de semana. Prepara también tamales para venderlos los domingos por las mañanas. Siempre está viendo el modo de aprovechar el tiempo para poder ganar un dinero que la ayude con la manutención de sus dos hijos y de su mamá. Hace once años que es padre y madre de sus hijos pues se separó de su ex esposo.

Ahora lo que ella mas quisiera es tener su restaurante y juguería, para ello cuenta el total apoyo de su hija mayor quien persigue el mismo sueño.

loans.use: Buying a machine to better finish her work

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr:
Mr. Yawo K. was born in 1971 in Kpévégo. He is married, and he publishes and sells religious books. He is the author of the majority of the books he sells. After publishing, he delivers the books to religious bookstores in Lomé, the interior of the country, as well as Cotonou in Benin, a neighboring country. This is his first loan, and it will allow him to cover the costs of printing, as well as a portion of the delivery.

Translated from French by Megan Berwick, Kiva Fellow at WAGES.

Monsieur K. Yawo est né en 1971 à Kpévégo. Il est marié et a pour activité principale l’édition et la vente de livres religieux. Il est l’auteur de la plupart des livres qu’il vend. Après édition, il fait la livraison dans les librairies évangéliques de Lomé, de l’intérieur du pays et même à Cotonou au Bénin. Le premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’assurer les coûts de l’imprimerie et une partie de ses frais de déplacement.

loans.use: Mr. Kekesi writes and sells books on religious subjects and spiritual guidance. He would like to purchase the materials to print new books.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
In my town there have been a lot of robberies lately and it can be seen that the house I live in is not properly protected. The windows are inadequately secure to protect my family, and I do not have the means to sufficiently pay for the installation of a proper security system. This is why I am soliciting a loan of $300.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

En mi colonia últimamente a habido muchos robos y como pueden ver la casa en la que vivo no cuenta con protecciones en las ventanas, por lo que necesito proteger a mi familia; como no cuento con el dinero suficiente para pagar la compra e instalación de las protecciones, es por ello que solicito el préstamo de $300.00 dll.

loans.use: Installation of security system

loans.name: Edelma

texts.es:
Señora E. U. has worked with our institution since about six years ago when she handled eight credits that she invested in her seamstress business and in the sale of adornments that she sells in the house she lives in and in the nearby towns. She is a single mother living with one daughter who helps in the business. Señora E. is the sole supporter of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora E. U. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace unos seis años donde ha manejado ocho creditos los que ha invertido en su negocio de costura y en la venta de adornos los que comercializa en su casa de habitación y en los municipios cercanos, es madre soltera vive con una hija la que le ayuda en el negocio la señora E. es el unico sosten de la familia.

loans.use: Working capital to buy thread and fabric for adornments

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Since three years ago, Roxana has worked attending her restaurant. At first she began in a rented space. She was there for two years, working daily in order to help her business grow. Nonetheless, for health reasons (an operation that she had on her ovaries) she was forced to leave her job. When she was recovered, she decided to have a restaurant again, but this time she put it in her home. Before, she had wholly dedicated herself to her fruit business. She grew and sold the fruit herself. Today, besides working at her restaurant, she also sells shoes and vacation clothes. She considers herself a multi-faceted woman who will do what it takes to raise her children, as she can no longer count on the help of the children’s father. Her goal is to keep progressing and to see her restaurant expanded, better decorated and with many customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace tres años Roxana se encarga de atender su restaurante. Al inicio empezó en un local alquilado. Estuvo por dos años trabajando a diario para que su negocio creciera; sin embargo, por motivos de salud, una operación que tuvo a los ovarios, se vio obligada a dejar su trabajo. Cuando estuvo recuperada del todo decidió volver a tener su restaurante, pero esta vez lo hizo en su casa. Anteriormente ella se dedicaba integra a su negocio de frutas. Ella las cosechaba y las vendía. Y hoy aparte de dedicarse a su restaurante también vende zapatos y ropas por temporadas. Ella se considera una mujer multifacética que busca lo necesario para criar a sus hijos. Ya que no cuenta con el apoyo del padre de ellos. Su objetivo es seguir progresando y ver a su restaurante amplio, mejor decorado y con mucha gente.

loans.use: Improve the infrastructure of her restaurant and make it cosier

loans.name: Ana Liset

texts.es:
Ana Liset C. is 26 years old and single. She has been a shopkeeper for a long time but a year ago established premises to sell market items, hosiery and clothing. Her shop is strategically located 50 metres from the Caaguazú bus stop, and her main customers are the young travelling sellers in the area.

The loan which she is requesting is to invest in purchasing autumn-winter clothing stock, such as women’s blouses, baby and children’s clothing, t-shirts, trousers, etc. In the future she would like to sell shoes and lingerie for women, as there is not much competition in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La señorita Ana Liset C., tiene 26 años y es soltera. Es comerciante hace mucho tiempo pero hace un año cuenta con un local de ventas de artículos de bazar, mercería y prendas de vestir. Su local que esta estratégicamente ubicado a 50 metros de la terminal de ómnibus de Caaguazú, y sus principales clientes son los pequeños vendedores ambulantes de la zona.

El dinero del crédito que está solicitando desea invertirlo en la compra de prendas de vestir de la temporada otoño invierno; como blusas para damas, ropas para bebes y niños, remeras, pantalones, entre otros. A ella le gustaría mas adelante vender zapatos y lencería fina para damas, ya que en la zona no existen muchos locales que se dediquen a la venta de estos.

loans.use: To purchase autumn season clothing

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Señor A. has worked with our institution since three years ago when he was granted four credits that he used to invest in the purchase of hardware products. He began with a small business which he has grown remarkably. He is a young entrepreneur , and he is married with a young child. It should be emphasized that in addition to his business, the client also studies law on the weekends, and his business has an employee.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor A. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace tres años donde se le han otorgado cuatro credito los que ha utilizado para invertir en la compra de productos de ferreteria, el comenzo con un pequeño negocio el cual ha crecido notablemente, es un joven emprendedor casado con un hijo menor cabe destacar que el cliente ademas de tener su negocio estudia los fines de semana la carrera de derecho en su negocio tiene un empleado.

loans.use: Capital to buy hardware products

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.es:
Señora G. has worked with our institution since 7 years ago when she obtained nine credits that she used to buy merchandise. She travels to Honduras to buy merchandise that she later sells in Nicaragua. She lives in poor conditions of life. Her only livelihood is the business. She is a a single mother, and she lives with one daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora G. trabaja con nuetra institución dede hace siete años donde ha obtenido nueve creditos los que ha utilizado en la compra de mercaderia, ella viaja a Honduras a comprar mercaderia la que vende luego en Nicaragua, vive en pobres condiciones de vida se mantiene unicamente del negocio es madre soltera vive con una hija.

loans.use: Working capitol for general merchandise

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Afi T. was born on October 3rd, 1964 in Badja, in the county of Zio. She is married, and the mother of three children. In 1994, she opened a roadside cafe in the Agoè neighborhood. She buys pigs from the surrounding villages, and then cooks, and sells delicious pork dishes. The pork is usually breaded with a casava-based flour, and prepared with sauce. With her first loan, which she has fully repaid, she was able to move locations to be closer to the Agoè marketplace, as well as improve her recipes. With her current loan, she will be able to buy six pigs to start off her business at the new location.

Translated from French by Megan Berwick, Kiva Fellow at WAGES.

Madame T. Afi est née le 03 octobre 1964 à Badja dans la préfecture de Zio. Elle est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. En 1994, elle a ouvert une charcuterie dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle achète les porcs dans les villages environnant, procède à la cuisson et les vend. Généralement ce repas s’accompagne avec la farine de manioc préparée avec la sauce. Le premier crédit qu’elle avait pris et terminé de rembourser lui a permis de quitter le lieu où elle vendait auparavant pour s’approcher du marché d’Agoè et améliorer ses recettes. Le crédit qu’elle sollicite actuellement lui permet d’acheter six (6) porcs pour poursuivre sa restauration.

loans.use: She would like to buy pork for her roadside cafe.

loans.name: Martha Regina

texts.es:
S. M. has obtained nine loans with Fundación Leon over the past six years. She has invested this capital in merchandise to sell, which she does from her mobile stand. The business has visibly grown over the years. She has had recent success selling a new brand of mop heads.

Her husband works as a mechanic and they live with S.' parents. They have two small children.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora S. M. Trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace seis años obteniendo nueve prestamos los que ha utilizado para la compra de mercaderia en general se puede ver que el negocio a crecido actualmente ademas de la mercaderia vende mechas de lampazo que es una nueva linea que antes no tenia, casada vive con su esposo y padres el esposo trabaja como mecanico. tiene dos hijos pequeños.

loans.use: Invest in merchandise to sell from her mobile stand

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis G. is married and has three young sons.

Years ago Luis started working as a carpenter, helping his father. There Luis gained a lot of knowledge and practice in the field. He decided to open his own carpentry nineteen years ago. One of his sons helps him every day. Luis’ clients are very loyal.

He needs the credit to repair one of his machines.

loans.use: Repair of carpentry’s machine.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel worked in the sales section of a clothing company in a large department store for twenty two years. As soon as he retired he learned about the field and techniques of carpentry from a relative. He soon realized that he enjoyed it so much that he became more of an expert than his teacher. And as a result her started up his own carpentry business. He knew little but enough to grow and design another business project. For eighteen years, when he had enough money he bought an area of land close to his home and opened a parking lot to rent. He now has basically taken over this business, whilst his oldest son, a carpenter also, is in charge of the carpentry business. Today, he lives with his second wife and youngest child, who is eighteen years old. His plan is to build more rooms in the house to rent so that they can live off this money in the future. He feels tied as carpentry is not easy and at sixty six years of age he wants to establish his last business to feel complete.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Veintidós años Manuel estuvo trabajando en la sección de ventas de una compañía de telas y ropas dentro de un gran centro comercial. Una vez que se retiro aprendió gracias a un familiar el oficio y las tecinas de la carpintería. Él afirma que le gusto tanto que llego a especializarse más que su maestro. Esto le sirvió para poner su negocio propio de carpintería. Fue haciéndose conocido de a pocos pero lo suficiente como para crecer e idear otro proyecto de negocios. Hace dieciocho años, cuando tuvo el dinero suficiente compro un terreno cerca de su casa y abrió una playa de estacionamiento para alquiler. El ahora se encarga básicamente de este negocio mientras que su hijo mayor, carpintero como él, se encarga del negocio de la carpintería. En la actualidad, el vive con su segunda esposa y con su menor hijo de dieciocho años. Su plan radica en construir más ambientes en la casa que tiene para alquilarlos y poder vivir de las rentas en un futuro. El dice sentirse cansado pues su trabajo de carpintero no es tan fácil y a sus sesenta y seis años lo que busca es establecer y formalizar un último negocio para sentirse tranquilo y realizado.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his carpentry business

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
The young Ms. S. has obtained six loans with Fundación Leon over the past four years. She has invested this capital to buy merchandise for her mobile stand. She started by selling bread and soft drinks and with much effort she has improved her small business and also managed to put herslf through law school.

Ms. S. lives with her husband in her mother's house.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La joven S. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace unos cuatro años obteniendo seis creditos los que ha invertido en la compra de mercaderia en general, cuando empezo a trabajar ella vendia pan y fresco con esfuerzo a logrado cambiar de negocio y se graduo de abogado recientemente es una joven emprendedora es casada y vive con su esposo en la casa de su madre.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her mobile stand

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia is mother to five children, to whom she dedicated all her time. However she then had the opportunity to work in a tailor’s shop. It was her job to repair leather items such as shoes. The business gave her the opportunity to work from home, allowing her to take on independent orders. That is when she decided to start her leather-dying business. Despite this, she has not abandoned the tailor’s shop and still works for them. Today she has been in business for two years and has become an expert. At fifty three years old she is still working on various projects, one of which is finishing building her house and relocating her business to a more central location. She has the full support of her daughters and husband, who works as a car painter.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Antonia es madre de cinco hijos, toda su vida estuvo dedicada a ellos. Hasta que tuvo la oportunidad de trabajar en una sastrería. Su tarea era reparar las prendas de cuero ya sean casas o zapatos. La empresa le dio la facilidad de trabajar en su propia casa, es así que aprovecha la oportunidad para recibir pedidos independientemente de su trabajo. Es así que decide poner su negocio de teñidos de cuero. A pesar de esto ella no ha abandonado su trabajo con la sastrería, aún trabaja para ellos. Hoy ya tiene dos años dedicándose a este oficio y asegura que le va muy bien pues es toda una experta. A sus cincuenta y tres años aun tiene varios proyectos dentro de los cuales está el terminar de construir su casa y mudar su negocio a un lugar más céntrico. Por ahora, ella recibe tood el apoyo de sus hijas y de su esposo quien trabaja como pintor de automóviles.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for her leather-dying business

loans.name: Ramon Bartolo

texts.es:
Mr. A. has obtained ten loans with Fundación Leon over the past nine years. He has invested this capital to improve his mobile sale of cleaning products: he recently bought a bike, no longer having to move around on foot.

Mr. A.'s wife sells tortillas from their house. Their family is large and they live in terrible conditions. Despite this, he is an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor A. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace unos nueve años obteniendo diez creditos los que ha utilizado para comprar productos de limpieza su principal actividad, tambien compro una bisicleta en la que se moviliza a vender sus productos anteriormente andaba a pie, es casado la esposa tiene negocio en la casa vende tortillas y productos derivados del maiz su familia es numerosa y viven en pesimas condiciones. a pesar de ello el es un exelente cliente.

loans.use: Invest in

loans.name: Brigido

texts.es:
Brigido Jimenez is 54 years old and has been married to Maria Margarita Gaona for 47 years. They have eight children, two of whom are still in school. The others are older and work in the neighbouring country of Argentina.

For 35 years Brigido has been selling local traditional handicrafts such as bedspreads decorated with embroidery and povvy (a special Paraguayan sewing technique), and hammocks. He transports them to sell in Ciudad Del Este, a city located about four hours from Carapeguá.

His beautiful products are much sought after, especially by the tourists who visit our country. His wife is an artisan, and she makes the blankets, hammocks, and bedspreads which Brigido sells. Because of this highly valued and demanding work, he has been able to buy a motorcycle which he uses to take his merchandise to market. He has also purchased a car so that his family can travel in comfort, and he can make his sales even on cold and rainy days.

He is asking for a loan to buy cotton thread of various colours so that his wife can continue making her beautiful crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Brigido Jimenez tiene 54 años de edad está casado hace más de 31 años con la Sra. Maria Margarita Gaona de 47 años de edad, tienen 8 hijos dos en etapa escolar y los otros todos ya mayores de edad y que actualmente se encuentran trabajando en el vecino país Argnetina.

El señor Brigido hace 35 años que se dedica a la venta de productos artesanales y que son tradicionales de la zona como sobrecamas elaborados de hilo y poyvy (técnica de costura paraguaya) y hamacas que lleva a vender por la zona de Ciudad Del Este que es una ciudad que queda a cuatro horas de viaje desde Carapeguá.

Sus productos son muy queridos y apreciados, especialmente por turistas que visitan nuestro país. Su esposa es artesana y ella elabora las frazadas, hamacas y colchas para que Brigido las venda. Gracias a este trabajo honrado y sacrificado, pudo comprarse una motocicleta lo cual utiliza para vender sus mercadería, además también compró un auto para la comodidad de su familia y de sus ventas en los días de frío y lluvia.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos de algodón de distintos colores con los que su esposa podrá seguir trabajando elaborando sus hermosas artesanías.

loans.use: To buy coloured cotton thread

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Ramona Ignacia M. is 41 years old and a native of the city of Carapeguá. She and her husband José have been married for 23 years; they have two school-aged children and two older ones who are working.

Ramona and José married when they were very young, and as they were not engaged in any particular line of work, they decided to travel to Argentina to find work. They worked hard for several years and managed to put together a small amount of capital so they could return home and undertake some activity that would bring in regular income.

Ramona's mother was a seamstress, and she taught her daughter how to sew. Ramona then bought a sewing machine and began to make all types of clothing. She opened a workshop in her own home which today provides the majority of the family's income. Because of the high quality of her work, she has a regular clientele, and the money she earned paid for the university education of her children.

Ramona has been running her workshop for more than 10 years. She says that she is very happy that things are going well, and that demand for her work is so great. For this reason she is now asking for a loan that will be used to buy a new sewing machine so that the quality of the clothes she makes will be even higher.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Ramona Ignacia M. es una señora de 41 años de edad, oriunda de la ciudad de Carapeguá, está casada hace más de 23 años con el Sr. José de 46 años , tienen 4 hijos dos en edad escolar y dos ya son mayores de edad que ya ejercen su profesión.

Doña Romona y Don José se casaron muy jóvenes, como no tenían profesión decidieron viajar a la Argentina para trabajar, trabajaron arduamente por varios años y lograron reunir un pequeño capital para volver al país y así emprender alguna actividad que le genere ingreso para el sustento diario.

La madre de Ramona era costurera y ella aprendió de su madre el oficio, fue así que compró una maquina de coser y se inicio en la confección de ropas de todo tipo, ella abrió su propio taller de costura en su propia casa que hoy día les genera el principal sustento a la familia. Gracias a la buena calidad de su trabajo, ella ha logrado mantener su clientela y con sus ingresos pagó los estudios universitarios de sus hijos.

Hace más de diez años que Ramona monto su taller y cuenta muy feliz que le va bastante bien, y que la demanda de sus trabajos es bastante alta; es por ello que hoy ella esta solicitando un crédito con el que podrá comprarse una maquina nueva de costura, para mejorar aún más la calidad de sus ropas.

loans.use: Purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Wema Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Albert Birundi M. is a 30 year old Kenyan father of six children. Also living with him are the two orphaned children of his late sister, who passed away two years ago.

Albert started his business four years ago after accumulating savings from his previous job. He currently operates a small retail cereal stall, but he would like to expand his business and start operating a wholesale shop. He is the breadwinner for his family, and expanding his stall would enable him to support his children and wife, who has a low-paying job. With the little profit that he gets from the business, Albert still struggles to feed, clothe, and educate his children and pay the rent on his house. But with the help of his loan, he will be able to expand his business and increase his monthly sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Albert will expand his cereal stall with his portion of this group loan.

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.en:
Joaquina Ganoso is married and has two school age sons.

She owns a restaurant located next to the river. Her husband is a fisher who owns a boat with a motor. He sells fish and provides his wife with fish to prepare dishes to offer in her restaurant.

Joaquina’s husband used to have a net, but somebody stole it. That is why they need the credit, to buy a new net to continue fishing.

loans.use: Purchase of a net

loans.name: Betsi

texts.es:
Betsi started preparing deserts on request. Since 5 years, she sells pastry in her house during the morning hours.

Before that, she had worked in a marshmallow-factory during 2 years. However, she resigned because she had to take care of her third and last son.

In the evenings, she goes to her sister’s stand in a market in order to sell her deserts there.

She would like to own a soft drink’s stand. In the meantime, on top of the pastries she also sells beer so she can have an extra income. With the help of her husband, who is a carpenter and construction worker, Betsi plans to rent a stand to sell drinks in a central location.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Ella empezó preparando postres a pedido y desde hace cinco años se dedica a vender repostería en su casa durante las mañanas.

Anteriormente, trabajo en una fábrica de marshmallows por el periodo de dos años; sin embargo, lo dejo porque quedo embarazada de su tercer último hijo.

Por las tardes se va al negocio de su hermana, quien tiene un puesto en un mercado, a ofrecer sus postres.

Ella busca tener una fuente de soda, mientras tanto, ofrece cerveza como complemento a sus postres para seguir obteniendo más ganancias que la ayuden a cumplir sus planes.

Betsi planea alquilar un local en un lugar céntrico con la ayuda de su esposo, quien es carpintero y obrero de construcción, y abrir una fuente de soda.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools for the bakery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To waterproof and repair the outside of the house

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
My house had been built mainly from wood and the walls have been added in different stages. I would like to build the house in cement and to lay a floor because living like this can be risky due to bad weather. This is important because I would not like to risk loosing it. Therefore, I request a loan of 850 USD. 

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi casa en un principio era de madera y poco a poco e ido construyendo en ella ya cuenta con sus paredes alrededor, me gustaría pronto tener mi casa de concreto y colocarle la loza ya que mi vivienda a estado en riesgo por los malos tiempos, así una vez terminada no perderla, de esta forma solicito la cantidad de $850.00 dll.

loans.use: To lay concrete floor

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Some time ago, we started building two rooms for our daughters. However, we still need to lay the floor. As we do not have enough money to buy the construction material and to pay the workers, we request a loan of 1000 USD.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace algún tiempo empezamos a construir dos cuartos los cuales los queremos para nuestra hijas. Pero nos esta haciendo falto ponerles la losa. No hemos tenido el dinero suficiente para el material y la mano de obra. Es por eso que solicitamos un préstamo de $1,000.00 dlls. Para la comprar de material y poder ponerle la losa a los dos cuartos.

loans.use: To lay the floor in the rooms

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
I almost finished building my house. The only thing missing is the floor in one of the rooms. However, I do not have enough money to buy the necessary construction material. This is why I request a loan of 600 USD.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo ya casi terminada mi casa solo me esta haciendo falto la losa. Pero no he tenido el capital suficiente para la comprar del material que se necesita para la elaboración de la losa en un cuarto. Solicito un préstamo de $600.00 dlls. Para la compra del material.

loans.use: To lay the floor in the house

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
Rosa is a 22-year old university student, studying history at the Nacional Mayor university in San Marcos. She's currently in the seventh stage of her course and, since she only has classes in the afternoon, she's taking advantage of the extra time to work. In the mornings, she sells ice cream and cold drinks and before she goes to class she prepares what she needs to make fritters in the evenings. This business isn't operated by her alone. Rosa counts on help from her mother and aunt. And though she doesn't consider it necessary to work, she doesn't want to waste the chance to do so. It's always nice to have extra money to help with other goals, after all. Setting up a business raising chickens with her mother, perhaps.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa es una estudiante universitaria de veintidós años que cursa la carrera de Historia en la Universidad Nacional Mayor de San Marcos. Actualmente cursa el séptimo ciclo de su carrera y, aprovechando que el horario de clases solo ocupa sus tardes, ella dedica su tiempo libre a trabajar. Por las mañanas vende helados y gaseosas y antes de irse a sus clases deja preparando lo necesario para vender frituras por la noche. Este negocio no solo maneja ella sola, Rosa cuenta con la ayuda de su madre y de su tía. Y aunque no considere necesario que trabajar, no piensa desaprovechar una oportunidad de trabajo mientras la haya, pues siempre es bueno contar con un dinero adicional que la ayuden a cumplir otras metas. Como poner con su mamá una pollería.

loans.use: Set up business and stock it with merchandise.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Some months ago, we began building a room. However, we've had some expenses and we can't finish it. We're applying for an $800 loan to finish the room because the house is rather small and there's not enough room for the kids.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Hace algunos meses empezamos la construcción de un cuarto. Pero hemos tenido algunos gastos y no podemos terminarlo. Solicitamos un préstamo de $ 800.00 dlls. Para la terminación de un cuarto ya que la casa es algo chica y no hay suficiente espacio para los niños.

loans.use: Finish room.

loans.name: Willian Jose

texts.es:
William lives in the Hialeah, Stage II neighborhood of Managua. He's 32 years old, married and has five children, three of whom work with him. He operates a bakery, something he's been doing for nine years. He started as a baker's assistance and eventually managed to set up his own business.

With the loan, he wants to buy basic ingredients (wheat, butter, yeast, sugar and sale to make his products) so that he can meet the demand of his customers for his delicious products. In the future, his hope is to set up a pastry shop that his children will manage and that will provide more economic security.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. William habita en el barrio Hialeah II etapa, es casado tiene 32 años de edad, y una familia de cinco hijos, tres de ellos trabajan con el. Su negocio es panificador tiene nueve años de experiencia, y comenzó de ayudante de panificador y logro con el tiempo poner su propio negocio.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materia prima (harina, manteca, levadura, azúcar,y sal para elaborar su productos) y así poder sastifacer a sus clientela con sus ricos productos. A futuro es poner una repostería que la administren sus hijos y lograr mas estabilidad económica.

loans.use: Buy materials for bakery business.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
My husband and I have built the house together, bit by bit, but we still need a room in the back of the house. Since our family is still growing, we are squeezed together and want to get on with this room. At the moment, though, we don't have the money together that we need to start building the room. We're applying for a $1,200 loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Entre mi esposo y yo hemos construido poco a poco la casa pero nos esta haciendo falta un cuarto en la parte D. atrás D. la casa. Como esta creciendo la familia ya estamos algo reducidos y queremos ya tener ese cuarto. Pero por el momento no hemos podido juntar el dinero que se necesita para empezar la elaboración del cuarto. Solicitamos un préstamo D. $$1,200.00 dlls.

loans.use: Add a room.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna is married and lives in the Hialeah, Stage IV neighborhood of Managua. She's 52 years old and has five children, all of whom work and send money home. Her husband is a prison guard and also contributes to the family's expenses. Reyna is a housewife but her husband and children pitch in to maintain the house and pay daily expenses.

With the loan, she wants to build a 12-meter long wall. For the future, she hopes to improve her house for the good of all the family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Reyna es casada y vive en el barrio Hialeah IV etapa, tiene 52 años de edad y procreo cinco hijos, los cuales todo trabajan y importan a los gastos de la familia. Su esposo es Celador y también aporta a su familia. La Sra. Reyna es ama de casa pero todos sus hijos y esposo aportan los gastos del hogar y las necesidades cotidianas. Con el préstamo desea construir un muro de 12 mts, de lineales, a futuro espera construir mejor su casa para el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Home improvements.

loans.name: Maria De Los Dolores

texts.es:
