Little by little, we're adding some rooms to the house. We need the finishing touches but I don't have the capital that I need to do the work. That's why I'm applying for a $1,100 loan, so that I can finish up on what needs to be done to my house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Poco a poco hemos construido unos cuartos en la casa. Pero nos esta haciendo falta los acabados. Pero no tengo el capital que necesito para realizarlos acabados. Es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $1,100.00 dlls. Para hacerle las detalles que le están haciendo falta a mi casa.

loans.use: Finish house.

loans.name: Santos Esteban

texts.es:
Santos is 37 years old, married and lives in Ticuantepe. His wife is a salesperson and they have three children, two who are students. He has twenty years of experience which began with his own efforts, but hasn’t had the financing to improve his harvest. He will purchase agricultural supplies with the loan in order to improve production.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Don Santos es casado y vive en Ticuantepe su esposa es comerciante le tienen tres hijos dos están estudiando, tiene 37 años de edad. Con veinte años de experiencia que comenzó con esfuerzos propios, con el préstamo va a comprar insumos agrícolas para mejorar la producción que le ha faltado financiamiento para mejorar las cosechas.

loans.use: Purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Señor Jorge Téllez lives in the Ríos de Ticuantepe neighborhood. He is married, is 38-years-old, and has one son who is in school. His wife is a secretary and works.

He makes a living by farming and has 20 years of experience. He started with his own money, and he will use this loan to purchase agricultural supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. Jorge Téllez, vive en el barrio los Ríos de Ticuantepe es casado con 38 años de edad, le tienen un hijo actualmente estudia su esposa es secretaria y trabaja.

Se dedica al cultivo agrícola tiene vente años de experiencia comenzó con su propio dinero, y el préstamo lo quiere invertir para la compra de insumos agrícolas.

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural supplies

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
It is now time for us to begin to build another room for our home.  We don’t have enough money to finish the construction.  We are requesting a loan of $800 to finish the room.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Ya tenemos tiempo que empezamos a construir un cuarto más a la casa. Pero no hemos tenido el capital suficiente para terminar la construcción. Solicitamos un préstamo de $800.00 dlls. Para la terminación del cuarto.

loans.use: Finish construction of home

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda has worked selling gas for three years. The idea to involve herself in this business came from an acquaintance who assured her that it was profitable and that there were opportunities. She was immediately convinced to file all the necessary paperwork to undertake her gas business. Once she did so, she realized that these papers would also help her receive loans and start new businesses. Thanks to a loan she was able to build her home and she worked renting rooms to businesses and as apartments. Happily she has the support of her husband who works as a carpenter, and also her children. With the money she earns from her businesses, she sets aside a large part for her home and her children, and she saves the remaining money with the goal of building more rooms in order to rent them out.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Nilda se dedica a la venta de gas desde hace tres años. La idea de involucrarse en este negocio vino de un familiar quien le aseguro que era rentable y que ella tenía las posibilidades. Es así que de inmediato se convenció de legalizar todos los papeles necesarios para emprender su negocio de gas. Una vez que lo hizo se dio cuenta que estos papeles le servían también para recibir préstamos y emprender nuevos negocios. Gracias a un préstamo ella pudo construir su casa y se dedico al alquiler de habitaciones para negocios y como vivienda. Felizmente ella cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo quien trabaja como carpintero, y también de sus hijos. Con el dinero que recibe de sus negocios, ella destina una gran parte para su casa e hijos y la otra parte la ahorra con la meta de seguir construyendo más habitaciones y alquilarlas.

loans.use: Finish construction of a bedroom in her home in order to rent it out

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Mrs. V. has obtained eight loans with Fundación Leon over the past three years. She has invested this capital to increase the variety of products offered in her small grocery store.

Mrs. Vargas used to rent a house but now her family lives in their own house, thanks to the fruits of her business and support from her husband's work. The couple has two children who also help look over the store.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora V. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace uno tres años donde se le han otorgado ocho creditos los que ha utilizado en surtir su negocio de pulperia, ella ha logrado ampliar los productos que vende, anteriormente alquilaba casa, fruto del negocio mas el apoyo de su esposo ha logrado adquirir una vivienda donde vive actualmente, casada con dos hijos los que viven con ella y le ayudan a ver el negocio.

loans.use: Buy products for her small grocery store

loans.name: Karla Maricela

texts.es:
Between my husband and I, little by little we have built our house. Now we need to finish the outside of the house. At the moment we don’t have the capital that we need to finish it. We are requesting a loan of $1,000 to finish the exterior of the house.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Entre mi esposo y yo poco a poco hemos construido la casa. Pero ahora nos esta haciendo falta terminar los acabado del exterior. Por el momento no tenemos el capital que se necesita para terminarla. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,000.00 dlls. Para terminar los acabados del exterior de la casa.

loans.use: Exterior finishings of the home

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
We want to finish the construction of our house. We don’t have the slab or the finishings, but for now I would like more than anything to pour the slab. We don’t have enough money to install the slab, and for that reason we are requesting a loan of $1,000 for the installation. This way the house will be more constructed.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Queremos terminar la construcción de la casa. Nos esta haciendo falta la losa y los acabados, por el momento quisiera mas que nada ponerle la losa. Pero no he tenido suficiente capital para ponerla es por eso que. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,000.00 dlls. Para la colocación de la losa y así tener un poco más construido en la casa.

loans.use: Installation of slab for home

loans.name: Justo Manuel

texts.es:
Mr. U. has obtained eight loans with Fundación Leon over the past four years. You can already see the growth of his business compared to when he first started.

Mr. U. lives in an area of Nicaragua that is known for cattle raising. He is married to the woman in the photo and has two sons who attend school. He and his wife both run the business.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor U. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace unos cuatro años obteniendo ocho creditos con los que ha logrado incrementar su negocio ya que se puede observar el crecimiento del negocio con respecto a cuando empezo a trabajar, cabe destacar que el vive en zona del pais propicia para el sector ganadero lo que ha colaborado a la mejoria de su negocio, es casado con la señora que esta en la foto tiene dos hijos menores los que estudian, el negocio lo adminisrtra en conjunto con u esposa.

loans.use: Invest in veterinary products for his store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Leon 2000 - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
Señor Oscar is 26-years-old and lives in the neighborhooed of Héroes and Mártires de Apayal. He is married and has three kids, who are 2, 8, and 5. He works as an assistant in a grocery store. He would like this loan to buy beams and zinc to replace the roof on his house. One of his dreams is to buy his own land since he now lives on his father's land.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. Oscar tiene 26 años de edad residiendo en un barrio héroes y mártires de apayal es casado le tienen tres hijos de 2,8 y 5 años de edad, trabaja como asistente de bodega y el préstamo lo quiere para comprar perlines, zinc y cambiar el techo de su casa. Unos de su anhelo es comprar un terreno propio ya que vive en el mismo terreno con su padre.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
My house needs an extra room because my children are adolescents and want more space.  I haven’t been able to begin the construction because I don’t have the money.  I am requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase the materials for construction of a room.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

En la casa me esta haciendo falta un cuarto extra el cual lo quiero para mis hijos que ya están adolescentes y quieren su espacio. Pero no he podido empezar la construcción por  me esta haciendo falta capital. Solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 dlls. Para la compra de material para la construcción de un cuarto.

loans.use: Home expansion

loans.name: Melania Patricia

texts.es:
Mrs. V. has obtained five loans with Fundación Leon over the past 12 years. She has invested this capital in the cloth and other materials necessary for her craft. This time around she wants to buy an upgraded sewing machine to improve her small workshop.

Mrs. V. has one employee in her business. She is married with one child. Both husband and son work to help with the family's expenses.

Translated by from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

La señora V. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace dos años y medios obteniendo cinco creditos en este periodo, los cuales ha invertido en telas e insumos materiales necesarios para llevar a cabo su negocio, ella da empleo a una persona en su negocio, es casada con un hijo el marido e hjo trabajan y le ayudan con los gastos familiares, su idea es comprar una maquina de mayor capacidad y agrandar su pequeño taller.

loans.use: Invest in cloth and materials for sewing

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Leon 2000 - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Martina's Group

texts.en:
Martina is twenty-five years old and a buddimg entrepreneur. She runs a beauty salon that is well-known by people of Bonito community of Santo Domingo, her hometown. Martina is planning to use her loan buy a new line of hair care and hair treatment products to resell in her business. The entrepreneur explains that services offered at her beauty salon are still limited, but she plans on adding new ones in the future. She even thinks about hiring one or two girls to help her attend to the customers when business substantially grows.

Martina will receive the funds together with the following entrepreneurs: Juana Mercedes A. D., a beauty salon owner Rosa Yvelisse F. R., to supply a clothing store María Altagracia D. L. S. F., to buy shirts and shoes Inocencia C. M., for a small clothing shop. Picture: from left to right: Juana, Martina, Rosa, María, Inocencia

loans.use: Purchase of products for a beauty parlor.

loans.name: María Maribel's Group

texts.en:
María Maribel, a humorous but hard-working woman, is the coordinator of a group of five women, all of them entrepreneurs that live in the Bonito community of Santo Domingo. Maribel has been cooking fried dishes for more than fifteen years. “I cook like nobody’s business, and it’s always just what the doctor ordered”, she says, falling down laughing.

The entrepreneur would like to add new dishes to the menu in order to offer a wider variety of choices to the customers and increase her sales volume and revenue. María Maribel wants to have enough money to maintain a comfortable life and enjoy her golden days.

The members of Maribel’s group are: Higinia O. M., a beauty products retailer Samara M. B., to purchase women’s clothing Crucita Mercedes S., to buy beauty products for a small shop Teresa M., to buy pants and shoes Photo: from left to right: Higinia, Samara, María Maribel, Crucita, Teresa

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to start preparing new dishes in her small cafeteria.

loans.name: Beibi Yecenia's Group

texts.en:
Beibi Yecenia is a confident and hard-working entrepreneur that struggles to proviD. education and a comfortable lifestyle with her family. Beibi has been selling clothing for more than three years in the Bonito community of Santo Domingo. The entrepreneur explains that there’s a lot to be said for running that business. Actually, she used the extra profits to pay her small apartment rental, and she supports the children’s education.

Beibi plans on using her loan to add new styles of clothing to her stock. She hopes that with her business, she’ll be able to buy a house in few years. Beibi expects to be one of the most successful businesswomen of her community. She says she can achieve that goal for she’s got such a lot going for her.

Beibi Yecenia will receive her loan together with these four other entrepreneurs: Mariana C. D. L. S., to purchase beauty products for her store Mayelyns Anhaita G. S., to purchase clothing Miguelina M., to buy beauty products Ana María O. D. L. S., to buy pants and shirts to add to her stock. Photo: from left to right: Beibi, Miguelina, Mayelyns, Mariana, Ana María

loans.use: To bulk-buy purchase to keep on running her business.

loans.name: Tabrey

texts.en:
Ma B. is married to a polygamist. They are blessed with six children, all of whom go to school. Ma B. could not afford to study in school when she was younger, which has made life very difficult for her. Because of this, it is hard for her to work and assist her husband in caring for the family. Additionally, her children are unable to study freely in school because of the fees. They also cannot afford three square meals a day.

Ma B. was motivated to become a member of GHAPE by her husband, who became a GHAPE member in 2001. Since she joined, Ma B. has successfully borrowed and repaid loans six times. The profit from these loans has helped her to pay her children's school fees and provide some basic needs, like food, for the family.

Given a new loan, Ma B. plans to buy drugs, chemicals for the production of momo (which is used for washing dresses), and planting seeds. She knows her business is going to succeed because she has acquired some basic training in finance management and how to choose a good business from GHAPE. Also, she has been doing this business for several years.

She plans to pay her loan in 24 months. The first installment repayment shall be done on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: To purchase drugs, chemicals and planting seeds

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Mama Grace M. was born on the 1st of February, 1952. She is married and a mother of six children. Due to many family problems beyond her control, she is separated with her husband and single handedly takes care of the family. This includes providing for her children's needs both in school and at home. She is also responsible for paying for hospital bills and other bills of the house. Motivated by all of these circumstances, she became a member of GHAPE in 2006. Mama Grace has successfully managed to repay loans two times. The profit from these loans has helped her enormously in taking care of the above-mentioned responsibilities.

If given a loan, she intends to buy Irish potatoes and corn seeds. She also intends to continue with her cultivation of cassava. Her business is going to succeed because she has been doing it for close to 20 years. She owns a lot of farmland and has experience farming the above-mentioned crops. She intends to use the profit from this loan to educate her children, pay for hospital bills, and pay for the basic needs for her family.

She promises to repay her loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: To buy Irish potatoes, corn seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella has a small business selling interior decorations at the Central Market in Novomoskovsk, Ukraine. Her little kiosk is filled with attractive, reasonably priced items that appeal to many customers who are looking to decorate their homes or businesses. Ella has been in business for about 10 years. She likes what she sells and has developed a stable enterprise.

Ella has requested a short term loan to help purchase a new supply of items to sell.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya has a small business selling men’s clothing at a busy outdoor market in Stryi, Ukraine located near the beautiful Carpathian mountains. She has worked hard to make her business a success, even though her circumstances have sometimes been difficult. Nataliya is married and has two children, a son who is 21 and a daughter who is 15. Their family financial situation has been tough at times due to her husband’s struggles with alcohol addiction. Nataliya also takes care of her nephew while his mother is away working.

Nataliya has requested a loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven to purchase additional inventory for her business. She has been a client with Nadiya Ukraine since 2003. We are happy to have this opportunity to continue assisting her in her business endeavors.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is an entrepreneur from the city of Noviy Rosdil in western Ukraine. She has a small business selling women’s clothing from a little space at an outdoor market. Mariya has been self-employed for about nine years. Her business has been a good source of income for her and her husband, Vladimir. One of Mariya’s goals is to change out the old windows in their home with newer windows that will help them keep warmer in the winter.

Mariya has requested a short term loan to help restock her inventory for the spring and summer seasons. A new supply of clothing will allow to her maintain a good sales rate and help ensure a profitable summer.

loans.use: Restock inventory for the spring and summer seasons

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.en:
“Dios es Amor” is a small rural community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari-project which provides its credit with education services in the rural areas of Huancavelica. Huancavelica is considered one of the poorest regions of Peru and has many limitations being a very mountainous area (altituD. ranges from 2,000 – 5,000 meters above sea level), the cold, the difficulty of growing crops and the lack of an adequate infrastructure of roads and communication systems.

BCR “Dios es Amor” is located at approximately 4,000 meters above sea-level, in the community of Pilpichaca, in the district with the same name, province of Huaytará. The main activities of the population are growing potatoes and wheat at lower altitudes, and raising sheep and alpaca in the higher areas. The area is known for alpacas and their wool production. Because of the high altituD., the area is not very suitable for agriculture, but the natural grass (pasture) makes it very favorable for raising alpacas and sheep. In the small town of Pilpichaca, on the main road from Huancavelica to the “Vía Libertadores” highway that connects Ayacucho with the coast and Peru´s capital, L., there are some shops and some produce cheese, but alpaca wool and meat production is the main activity.

Currently the bank is starting its first loan cycle with 19 female borrowers and a total loan of 4,400 soles (about 1,575 US$). Most of the loans are of 200 soles, with three exceptions of loans of 400 soles. As the group is just starting its first cycle, the group was not able to save, except for the initial loan to start. But all agree to save in the future.

One of the members of the community bank is Lourdes C. C.. Lourdes has a small grocery store where she also sells sweets. Her 200 soles loan she will use to fill up her small store again. During the breaks at the local school, she also sells sweets at the entrance of the school. In the future she hopes to be able to buy a house in a bigger city and run a business there. And like most women, she wants her children to be professionals when they leave college. In the shorter run she will be saving for her children’s education and to increase her business. Now that she has entered in FINCA Peru, she wants to learn how to work more enthusiastically and responsibly and how to save.

Victoria S. D. S. has her business of selling clothes at local weekly or biweekly markets. Other business she runs are buying and selling of cheese, trout and sheep. With her 200 soles loan she will buy new merchandise to go to the markets. Her dream for the future is to have a small restaurant and to grow little by little. Victoria will save for the education of her children and for her future restaurant. Now that she will be working with FINCA Peru, she hopes to save more. A neighbor, a member of FINCA in the city of Ayacucho, told her a lot about FINCA, especially about the savings, and maD. Victoria very interested. Besides that , she will work more responsibly and receive trainings like practicing values and how to care for herself.

loans.use: Buy new supplies

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva began selling natural medicines to end the economic hardships of her home. As time has passed and thanks to the income from her sales, the business has flourished.

Currently she has many clients and her clientele is growing thanks to recommendations from satisfied customers.

Now she requests a $975 credit to be returned in six months which she will use to purchase stock at wholesale. She wants to start a sales club with this stock.

Eva has high hopes that with your help, her business will continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Stock purchase

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina Martínez began her business because she´s allways enjoyed selling and saw an opportunity to feel useful and challenge herself.

She needed an extra income which would help her with the family expenses and help her feel more independent. The money would help her supplement her husband´s income to allow them to pay for their three sons´ trade school. They are both very proud of their children.

Rufina began in March 1982, demonstrating the plastic goods in her mother-in-laws´ home. Her products were well accepted and not only did she receive a profit from the goods she sold, she also received promotional gifts from the company which she sold as well. Her clientele has been growing and she has many clients amongst her friends, family, neighbors and other persons to whom she has been recommended.

She is requesting a $675 microloan to be paid back in 5 months. She needs the money to purchase a list of pre-bought goods to meet her clients´ orders and avoid disappointing them. With your help she´ll make it.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Stock purchase

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria Isabel started her business because her husband´s income was insufficient to meet the family´s expenses. She´s allways had a knack for business and saw the opportunity to increase their earnings with her family´s help. Six years ago she began selling refreshments, fritters, and sweets amongst her neighbors. Eventually she began to sell meat next to her brother´s store on saturdays and sundays.

She is requesting a $500 credit to purchase foodstuffs to be paid back in six months. With your support, Isabel will make it.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Purchase food to prepare

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stationary supplies, notebooks, and pens. She has requests for the upcoming school year.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To diversify the products she sells in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chairs and tables for his business. To buy cooking pots and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabrics at whole-sale price

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve the amount and variety of her products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Include new items for sale, such as: televisions, blenders, irons, and mixers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in his farm land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invertir en sus tierras de arroz

loans.name: Edis

texts.es:
Business Description

Edis owns more than 2 hectares (5 acres) of land for growing rice. He has been in farming for more than 12 years. Depending on the weather and the cycle of the varieties of rice, Edis generally obtains up to 4 crops per year.

Use of the Loan

The loan is required for working capital, to buy the necessary supplies for the crop such as seeds, manure, fertilizers, renting of machinery, labor, etc.

Personal Information

Edis is 34 years old and is married. He has 6 children, four of whom are studying in local schools. His home is of mixed construction, that is, wood and cane. One of his goals is to improve quality of life through the education of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Edis posee más de 2 hectáreas de tierras propias para la cosecha de arroz. Lleva en la agricultura más de 12 años. Dependiendo del clima y del ciclo de las variedades, Edis generalmente obtiene hasta 4 cosechas al año.

Uso del Préstamo

Requiere el préstamo para capital de trabajo, esto comprando los insumos necesarios para la cosecha tales como semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, alquilando maquinarias, mano de obra. etc.

Información Personal

Edis tiene34 años. Es casado. Tiene 6 hijos de los cuales cuatro estudian en escuelas del sector. Su vivienda es de construcción mixta, es decir madera y caña. Una de sus metas es mejorar la calidad de vida a través de la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: To invest in his rice farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in the rice harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for the cultivation of rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for the cultivation of rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for the cultivation of rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For the cultivation of rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils and more food to prepare meals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy Merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve the site where he attends his clients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a show case to exhibit products in her office

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in rice for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in the purchase of merchandise for the back-to-school season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more seafood to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improvements to his business location.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Material for the shop.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz is an independent, single woman who saw in the shoe sale-by-catalog business an opportunity to generate extra income since her regular salary job paid her too little and did not provide an income that was satisfactory. She started out selling to friends and then she became more popular thanks to their recommendation.

She is requesting a credit line in the amount of US$250 which will be repaid in 3 months. It will be used to purchase new merchandise. With your help, Beatriz can continue to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Beatriz es una mujer soltera e independiente que inicio su negocio de venta de zapatos por catalogo porque vio la oportunidad de ganar dinero extra, ya que el trabajo que tenia en una empresa no le ofrece suficiente sin ingresos, porque pagan muy poco. Comenzó vendiendo entre sus conocidos y así se fue dando a conocer gracias a la recomendación de estos.

Solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía nueva. Con tu ayuda Beatriz saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia is single and sells beauty and feminine care products by catalog. She started her business for extra income. She began by selling to her coworkers and family and, little by little, has been increasing her customer base.

She requests a loan of $250 that she will repay in three months to buy new products. With your help, Julia will be able to increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia es soltera y se dedica a la venta de productos para la belleza y cuidado femenino por catalogo. Inicio el negocio en busca de un ingreso extra. EIla inicio vendiendo entre sus compañeras de trabajo y familiares y poco a poco ha incrementado su cartera de clientes.

Solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para compra nuevos productos. Con tu apoyo Julia lograra hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica started her business because she lacked well-paying work opportunities as an independent woman in need of her own income. For this reason, she began selling cosmetics by catalog, making a good income.

She requests a loan of $250 that she will repay in three months to buy merchandise. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Verónica inicio el negocio por la falta de oportunidades de trabajo bien remuneradas, ya que ella es una mujer independiente y necesitaba de sus propios ingresos. Por lo que se dedico a la venta de cosmeticos por catalogo actividad que le ha dejado buenos ingresos.

Solicita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía, con tu ayuda esto será posible.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Minelva Elizabeth

texts.es:
Minelva is married and is the mother of two adult children, a son and daughter. For over 8 years, she has been in the hammock business. From a very young age, she learned the technique from her mother and with this income has been able to help her husband with the household expenses.

She requests a loan of $250 that she will repay in three months to buy thread to make new hammocks. With your support, Minelva will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Minelva es casada y es madre de dos hijos, un hombre y una mujer. Tiene mas de 8 años dedicándose al negocio de las hamacas, ella desde muy joven aprendió estas técnicas producto de la enseñanza que su mama le transmitió, y con estos ingresos puede apoyar a su esposo con el gasto familiar.

Solicta un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar hilos para urdir hamacas nuevas. Con tu apoyo Minelva saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase Thread

loans.name: Gladys Jassivi

texts.es:
Gladys started her business selling cosmetics three years ago when she needed to pay for her studies. Now she pays for her studies and sells her products to her classmates, family, and friends.

She requests a $250 loan that she will repay in three months. There is going to be a fair in her hometown and she would like to increase her inventory to be ready to sell more during the fair. With your help, Gladys will succeed in continuing her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Gladys inicio el negocio de venta de cosméticos hace 3 años, ya que se vio en la necesidad de colaborar con los gastos de sus estudios, ahora ella sola los costea y vende entre sus compañeros de escuela, familiares y amigos estos productos.

Solicta un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses ya que pronto habrá una feria en el pueblo donde vive y desea incrementar su inventario para estar lista para esas fechas, y poder vender mas. Con tu ayuda Gladys lograra continuar con sus estudios.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Mirma Eunice

texts.es:
Mirma started her business in anticipation of her children’s future because her two children are in elementary school and her husband’s earnings are not enough. Mirma and her husband want their children to go to college and know that Mirma’s husband’s earnings will not make that possible. To make that possible and to support the family, they decided to devote a small area in their house for the sale of scrap metal. Thanks to their dedication, it has been successful.

Presently, Mirma requests a loan of $250 that she will repay in three months to buy more merchandise. With your support, Mirma will reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mirma inicio su negocio ante la preocupación del futuro de sus hijos, porque sus 2 hijos están en la primaria y con lo que gana su marido no le alcanza, ellos desean que sus hijos en un futuro sean universitarios y sabia que con los ingresos de su esposo esto no podrá ser posible, para apoyarlo decidió adecuar en su casa un pequeño lugar para la venta de chatarra, y así apoyar en los gastos familiares. Gracias a su dedicación le ha ido bien.

Actualmente solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar más mercancía para su venta. Con tu apoyo ella lograra sus metas.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Yrma Rosaura

texts.es:
From a very young age Yrma has been in retail. With much effort and the support of her husband, she saved a little capital that she put into the making and selling of hammocks. This has provided her with income to support her children and to afford their schooling.

Presently, she requests a loan of $250 that she will repay in three months to buy thread to make more hammocks. With your help, she will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Yrma desde muy temprana edad se dedica al comercio, y a base de mucho esfuerzo, y con ayuda de su esposo, logro juntar un pequeño capital el cual puso a trabajar en la elaboración y venta de hamacas, lo cual le permite tener un ingreso para mantener a sus hijos y poder costearles sus estudios.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar hilos para fabricar mas hamacas. Con tu ayuda ella saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of Supplies

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Patricia had dedicated herself to selling food for more than four years. She started as a kitchen assistant, and after seeing that the income was insufficient and that she had the necessary knowledge, she decided to start her own business. It has been prospering.

Patricia is requesting a $250 loan, which she plans to repay with three months, to purchase the ingredients she needs to be ready when the town fair comes and there is more demand for her product. She wants to be prepared with foods and drinks for this two-week event.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Patricia tiene mas de 4 años dedicándose a la venta de comida, ella empezó como ayudante de cocina y al ver que no le alcanzaban sus ingresos, y contar con los conocimientos necesarios decidió poner su propio negocio en el cual ha ido prosperando.

Solicta un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar materia prima ya que en los próximos días habrá fiesta en el pueblo y las ventas suben, desea prepararse en comprar insumos y refrescos para este evento que dura dos semanas.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and drinks / Comprar materia prima

loans.name: Martina Concepcion

texts.es:
Martina is married and had a 12-year-old daughter and an 8-year-old son. She has always like selling things, which is why four years ago she decided to sell clothes to acquaintances and help her husband with family expenses.

Martina is requesting a $250 loan, which she plans to repay within three months, to purchase more supplies and increase her income. With your help she'll be able to keep moving ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Martina es casada y madre de una niña de 12 años y un niño de 8 años. siempre le han gustado las ventas, por lo que hace 4 años vio una oportunidad de dedicarse a vender ropa entre conocidos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.

Solicta un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y obtener mejores ingreso. Con tu ayuda Martina podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase clothing / Comprar mercancia

loans.name: Wendy Candelaria

texts.es:
Wendy separated from her husband five years ago, and faced the situation of providing for her two 9-year-old children on her own. So she started selling clothes as a means of subsistance, which has worked out very well. Now along with her son's allowance they are better off, and she currently is in a relationship and has a 9-month-old baby.

Wendy is requesting a $250 loan, which she plans to repay within three months, to purchase her supplies and prepare her self for the town fair. With your help she'll keep move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Wendy, hace 5 años se separo de su esposo y tuvo que enfrentar sola la situación de mantener a sus 2 hijo de 9 años, por lo que empezó a vender ropa como medio de subsistencia, la cual le ha funcionado muy bien y ahora con la pensión de su hijo vive mejor, actualmente vive en unión libre y tiene un bebe de 9 meses.

Solicta un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y aprovechar la feria del pueblo. Con tu ayuda Jenny saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase clothing / Comprar mercancia

loans.name: Elda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elda is a very active and enterprising woman. She likes to make her own money, which is why she opened her business selling antojitos, a traditional Mexican dish, out of her home two years ago. She also sells two other traditional dishes, panuchos and salbutes, and with the income she earns she can help with family expenses. She is married and has two children, ages 4 and 1.

Elda is requesting a $250 loan, which she plans to repay within three months, to purchase ingredients so she can be able to sell her foods at the town fair. With your support she'll continue making progress.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Elda es una mujer muy activa y emprendedora, le gusta tener su propio dinero, por lo que abrió su negocio de venta de antojitos mexicanos en su casa hace 2 años donde vende panuchos y salbutes con los ingresos que obtiene le permiten contribuir con el gasto familiar. Es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 4 años y 1 año.

Solicta un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar materia prima y poder vender en la feria del pueblo. Con tu apoyo ella seguirá progresando.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients / Comprar materia prima

loans.name: Neydi

texts.es:
Neydi is a mother of three daughters. Six years ago she divorced her husband after being overwhelmed by family problems, which forced her to look for a way to earn money and keep her occupied, so she decided to dedicate herself to selling cosmetics. Now not only does she sell perfumes, but also hammocks. Even though she has rebuilt her live, the business keeps going.

Neydi is requesting a $250 loan, which she plans to repay in three months, to purchase her supplies. With your help she will keep moving ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Neydi es madre de tres mujeres, hace 6 años se divorcio agobiada por los problemas familiares, esto la motivo a buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos y la mantuviera ocupada por lo que decidió dedicarse a las ventas de cosméticos, ahora no solo vende perfumes, sino también urde hamacas, y aunque rehizo su vida, el negocio lo continúa.

Solicta un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetic supplies / comprar mercancia

loans.name: Esmeralda De La Cruz

texts.es:
Esmeralda started selling food to her friends and neighbors five years ago. A divorce forced her to care for her two children, now 11 and 9 years old and in school, on her own, which is why she started the business. With time things have improved.

Now she needs a $775 loan, which she plans to repay in six months, to purchase of chairs, tables and a new stove because the old one is worn down, so she provide a better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Esmeralda empezó hace 5 años vendiendo comida entre sus vecinas y amigos, ya que después de su divorcio tenia que mantener a sus dos hijos, que actualmente tienen 11 y 9 años y son estudiantes, por lo que emprendió este negocio. Con el tiempo le ha ido bien.

Ahora necesita un crédito por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mesas y sillas para brindar un mejor servicio a sus comensales y una estufa nueva por que la anterior estaba muy deteriorada

loans.use: Purchase tables, chairs and a new stove / Comprar mobiliario

loans.name: Victorino

texts.es:
Victorino started making and selling ice cream 11 years ago, after leaving his job as a driver because he needed to earn more money to take care of his children. He purchased an ice cream machine on credit, and he and his wife worked together in the business. Now they need more capital to increase their income. They are requesting a loan, to be repaid in six months, to purchase needed supplies. With your support they can continue to grow the business and improve their situation.

Victorino inicio en el negocio de fabricación y venta de helados hace 11 años al dejar su trabajo de chofer de camión urbano por sus bajos ingresos, ya que sus hijos necesitaban mayores ingresos, compro una maquina para hacer helado a crédito, y con su esposa ha trabajado ahora requiere mayor capital de trabajo.

Solicta un préstamo por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar insumos, con tu poyo el saldrá adelante.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE SUPPLIES FOR THEIR ICE CREAM BUSINESS

loans.name: Jorge Armando

texts.es:
Jorge Amando inherited his freight business from his father, and has been working in the business for the last 20 years. He has been successful thanks to his good customer base. Jorge is a single father and takes care of his 17 year old son. He will use the loan of $150, which he will repay in 5 months, to invest in his business. With your support he can continue to grow his business and care for his son.

Jorge Armando, heredo de su papa la concesión para realizar fletes, negocio al cual se ha dedicado durante 20 años, se ha mantenido en el negocio gracias a su cartera amplia de clientes, es padre soltero y mantiene a su hijo de 17 años.

Ahora solicita un crédito por $150 que pagara en 5 meses para tener capital de trabajo y continuar con su negocio de mudanzas y fletes. Con tu apoyo Jorge seguirá progresando.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HIS FREIGHT BUSINESS

loans.name: Wendy Noemi

texts.es:
<

Wendy realized that in addition to the need to earn income for herself, there was an opportunity in her area because there was no shop. So 8 years ago she decided to open a small shop and little by little she has grown the business thanks to her hard work and dedication. Today she runs a small general store. With the loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase merchandise and expand her stock, allowing her to offer better service to her customers, increase her income and continue to help with her family's household costs.

Wendy, es una mujer soltera quien ante la necesidad de buenos ingresos para satisfacer sus necesidades, y al ver que en su colonia no había ninguna tienda, y ante la necesidad de esta, decidió poner un pequeño puesto hace 8 años, el cual poco a poco ha ido creciendo gracias a su empeño y dedicación, hasta convertirla en una tienda de abarrotes.

Ella pide un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses, para comprar mercancía e incrementar su inventario y así ofrecerle un mejor servicio a su clientela, tener un mas de ganancias y así ayudar al gasto familiar.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HER SMALL GENERAL STORE, OFFER MORE VARIETY TO HER CUSTOMERS, INCREASE HER INCOME, AND ENABLEHER TO HELP WITH HER FAMILY'S HOUSEHOLD EXPENSES.

loans.name: Santos Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge is married with one son, 11 years old. He began his business when he realized he was not able to cover his family's expenses with his salary. 10 years ago he purchased a small plot of land outside the city, and began to raise chickens. In 2002, hurricane Isidoro destroyed his chicken coops and he had to rebuild. Little by little he has been rebuilding, but now he needs to invest in more chickens and chicken feed in order to be fully operational.

He is requesting a loan, which he will repay in 6 months, so he can continue to run his business. We can help Jorge continue to improve his situation.

Jorge, es casado y tiñe un hijo de 11 años, empezó su negocio al ver que no alcanzaba a cubrir los gastos familiares con su sueldo de empleado, por lo que hace 10 años compro un terreno a las afueras de la ciudad y ahí construyo gallineros para la crianza de pollos, pero en el año 2002 el huracán Isidoro se los destruyo, poco a poco ha logrado ir reconstruyendo los gallineros, ahora necesita invertir en pollos y alimento para tener el ciclo completo.

Para ello solicita un préstamo por US $725 que pagara en 6 meses, para así poder continuar con su negocio. Apoyemos a jorge a salir adelante.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE CHICKENS AND CHICKEN FEED FOR HIS BUSINESS.  AFTER HURRICANE ISIDORO DESTROYED HIS CHICKEN COOPS IN 2002, HE HAS HAD TO SLOWLY REBUILD.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro is married and has a 23 year old son. 8 years ago he decided to start a charcoal business. Thanks to his hard work he was able to purchase a truck which he uses to transport and sell the charcoal. He is requesting a loan, which he will repay in 6 months, so he can increase his inventory and provide charcoal to other towns nearby, expanding his sales and increasing his income. With your support, Pedro can grow his business.

Pedro, es casado y tiene un hijo de 23 años, desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de carbón, gracias a su trabajo arduo ha logrado comprar un vehiculo que le facilita el transporte y venta del producto.

Ahora solicita un préstamo por US $725 que pagara en 6 meses ya que desea incrementar su inventario para cubrir otras poblaciones cercanas y tener mejores ganancias. Con tu apoyo Pedro lograra incrementar sus ventas.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE INVENTORY FOR HIS CHARCOAL BUSINESS, ENABLING HIM TO SELL TO OTHER TOWNS IN THE SURROUNDING AREAS, GROWING HIS BUSINESS AND INCREASING HIS INCOME.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha T. is a farmer and grocer in Makak village. In order to make her rice plantation produce a better crop, she has asked for a loan, partly to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her field and partly to pay for laborers who will help her working her rice field.

Mrs. Sokha T. is 44 and lives in Kampong Speu Province. She is married with six children, two of whom are working in a garment factory while another is cutting bamboo to sell for a profit. The rest are attending school. Her husband, Chhom Cheam, is a farmer and bamboo cutter. Mrs. Sokha T. already obtained a loan from AMK to buy pigs for breeding.

Last year her children got dengue fever and Mrs. Sokha T. spent a lot of money to have them healed. That’s why she is now short of money to buy supplies to improve her rice field. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and insecticide for her field and partly to pay for laborers

loans.name: Deurn

texts.en:
The monsoon season is coming soon, so Mrs. Deurn Y. needs a loan to cultivate her rice field; thus, she has asked for a loan to buy cows to use as draft animals to plow her rice field. On the plantation, Mrs. Deurn Y. faced a drought last year and this year she hopes nature will give her a chance for doing a rice field.

Mrs. Deurn Y. lives in Trauk Leak Village in Kampong Speu province. She is 38 and married with a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband, Pheap Prum, is a farmer who always works with his wife on the rice field.

In May last year, Mrs. Deurn Y. got typhoid and the family faced unforeseen expenses. For this reason the family suffered an economic decline; thus, Mrs. Deurn Y. has now decided to request a loan to work on their rice plantation. Her husband and child are with Mrs. Deurn Y. in the photo.

loans.use: Buy cows to use as draft animals to plow her rice field

loans.name: Hafiz Allah

texts.en: Hafiz Allah lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and the father of three children. He is a carpet weaver. He was in Pakistan for about 8 years where he was involved in carpentry. When he came back, he started his business in Kabul. Now he wants to expand his business so he has requested an individual loan to complete his stock and make a good income to help his family in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Abdul Latif

texts.en: Abdul Latif lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and the father of 2 sons. He lives with his own family. He has a retail shop. He was in the army, but when he was injured he left the army and opened a retail shop. His business is going well but he is unable to expand his business so he has requested an individual loan to complete his stock and make a good income to help himself and his family.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Mariam's Boko Group

texts.en:
Mariam is 39 years old and is a married woman with a 9 year old child. She and her husband also take care of 3 other children, ages 26, 24 and 22 years old. Mariam sells water. She started in 2003. Every day, she works from 6am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more water for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Raya, Asha, Fatuma, Mwanaisha and Mwashabani, who have businesses selling soap, cosmetics, clothing, and food.

loans.use: To buy more water for her business.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is 35 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 9,5,3 and 2 years old. She and her husband also take care of 3 other people, ages 42 ,30 and 25 years old. Hadija sells charcoal. She started in 2000. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Hadija has taken two loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business and repaid both loans on time. She now hopes for a third loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Mwanahamis's Umoja Group

texts.en:
Mwanahamis is 40 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, ages 2-15 years old. Mwanahamis owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 5.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $45 from her sales.

Mwanahamis has already taken and successfully repaid a loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members. Tatu, Blandina, Mary, Rehema, and Ziada, who sell charcoal, clothing, and food.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Mariam's Umoja Group

texts.en:
Mariam is 28 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 5 and 2 years old. Mariam sells clothes and chips. She started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

In the past, Mariam has taken out and successfully repaid a loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Bashira, Shani, Salima and Shani D., who sell beverages, food sales, clothes, and small market sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is 42 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 20, 15, 8, and 5 years old. Mwanisha sells clothes. She started in 2005. Every day, she works from 7.30am to 5.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

In the past, Mwanaisha has taken out and successfully repaid a loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mwanaidi's Bustani Group

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is 37 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 10 and 5 years old. Mwanaidi owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2004. Every day, she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Mwanaidi has taken out and successfully repaid two loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Zena, Elizabeth, and Zaina, who sell cosmetics and food and operate a kiosk.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Reourn

texts.en:
Mrs. Reourn S. is 48 and is a subsistence farmer. She has asked for a loan to buy more timbers to build a house in order to improve her living conditions. She lives in Kos Prak Village in Kandal Province. She is the mother of five children, four of whom are working in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending state school. Her husband, Sophal Ven, is also a farmer and he always helps his wife in the fields.

Last year, Mrs. Reourn S.’s children got a cold and they had to buy medicines to cure them causing a financial crisis for the family.

Mrs. Reourn S. has never obtained a loan before but now, in order to build a new house, she has asked for a loan. In the picture you can see Mrs. Reourn S. with her husband and, in the background, the pillars of their new house.

loans.use: Buy more timbers to build a new house

loans.name: Argash

texts.ru:
Argash R. lives in the Jomi region. He is 52 years old, is married and has 7 children. He works in agriculture and farms. Argash plants wheat. Right now he needs to pay rent for his land, but he cannot afford to pay it before he collects his harvest. Argash would like to get a loan to pay the rent. He will pay back the loan over a 10 month period. The loan will help his family to solve their difficult situation.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Равшанов Эргаш житель района Джоми. Возраст 52 года , он женат и имеет 7 детей. Занимается сельским хозяйством. Имеет дехканское хозяйство. Засеивает землю пшеницей. Сейчас ему необходимо оплатить аренду за землю. Но пока он не собрал урожай его финансовое положение не позволяет ему оплатить аренду. Поэтому сейчас он хочет получить кредит. Погасить его он сможет в течении 10 мох. Кредит поможет его семье выйти ихз трудного положения.

loans.use: Rent land

loans.name: Abdulkosim

texts.ru:
Abdulkosim S. lives in the Jomi region. He is 42 years old, married and has eight children. He has been in agriculture for the past six years. The time of harvest season has come as well as the time for pay for the rent of land. But until he is able to collect the harvest and sell it Abdulkosim still needs to pay the rent. This is why he needs a loan which he will pay off within 10 months. He has a large family and they live happily together.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шерназаров Абдулкосим житель района Джоми. Возраст 42 года. Женат и имеет 8 детей. Занимается земледелдием.Занимается этиим видом бизнеса уже 6 лет. По сезону пршло время собирать урожай и платить аренду на землю , но до получения урожая и его продажи клиент должен оплатить аренду. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит , который планирует погасить в течении 10 месяцев. У него очень большая семья , но они живут весело и дружно.

loans.use: To pay for the rent of land

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine M. is a 40 year-old resident of Benzi Beach in Dar es Salaam. She has run a bar and restaurant in the area for the past five years. She is in need of a loan to help her expand the restaurant and bar to accommodate more customers.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant and bar

loans.name: Raphel

texts.en: Raphel L. is a pharmacist by professional. She runs a pharmacy in Masaki, together with her husband, who is a medical doctor at the national hospital. She is in need of a loan to help her buy more inventory and expand her pharmacy.

loans.use: To increase her inventory and expand her pharmacy

loans.name: Dushan

texts.ru:
Dushan H. lives in the region of Jomi. He is married and has eight children. He has secondary education and plot of land which he sows with wheat and potatoes. It's the time to collect the harvest and he needs to rent a tractor, a combine and other equipment as well as buy the bags for packing. For this Dushan needs a loan which will help save his harvest. He plans to pay of the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Хасанов душан живет в районе Джоми. Женат и имеет 8 детей. Образование среднее. Имеет дехканское хозяйство. Засеивает землю пшеницей и картофелем.Пришло время сбороа урожая , поэтому ему нужно нанимать трактор . комбайн и другую технику для сбора. Кроме того нужно закупить мешки для упаковки продукции. Для этого ему нужно получить кредит , который поможет ему не потерять урожай. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To rent equipment and buy supplies

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is 64 years old and is a married woman with 10 children, ages 18-32 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other people, ages 40 and 49 years old. Halima owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 10am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales. She now hopes for a loan to open a new cafe.

loans.use: To open a new cafe

loans.name: Asha's Maua Group

texts.en:
Asha is 25 years old and is a married woman with a 4-year-old child. Asha sells vegetables. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Mwanaisha, Mariam J., Monica, Mariam Z. and Sophia, who sell clothing and food.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her buesiness.

loans.name: Rustambek

texts.ru:
Rustambek B. lives in the region of Jomi. He has secondary education and is in the business of buying and selling cattle. After feeding them for about two months he sells the calves for meat. He has been in this business for the past four years. He wants to increase sales by getting a loan. He plans to pay off the loan within 10 months. Rustambek is married and has two children and this business is the only source of income for his family.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Бердыев Рустамбек житель района Джоми.Образование среднее. Занимается купле-продажей крупно-рогатого скота. После откормки , которая длится около 2 месяцев он продает уже готовых бычков на мясо. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 4 года. Хочет увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев. Рустамбек женат и имеет 2 детей и его бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam K. is 29 year old resident of Kinondoni in Dar Es Salaam. She runs a tie and dye-making store, which she has been doing for five years. She makes traditional attire, commonly known as vitenge, at her store and usually bought by ladies. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her traditional clothing business

loans.name: Sadatu

texts.en:
Sadatu is married and has one child. She is thirty years old. She buys millet, beans and maize in bulk and then sells them to her community.

Sadatu travels to the northern part of Ghana (a twelve-hour drive) to buy her products. She wants to use her loan to buy more millet, beans and maize, because she has run out of stock. She also wants to buy a in larger quantities to avoid price hikes and to reduce her frequent travels to the north.

Sadatu is a member the group called “Agyenkwa Nyame” (meaning "Soul Saving God"). Members agree to support and guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Sadatu holding her baby in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more millet, beans and maize.

loans.name: Sadbargul

texts.ru:
Sadbargul Gulomovna F. lives in the region of Bohtar. She is married with three children. She does not hold a job, but works at home by keeping and tending to a plot of land for sowing of potatoes and she also does animal husbandry. At this time she wants to buy another calf for feeding. She also need to stock up with fodder. Sadbargul does not have enough money for this and decided to apply for a loan. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months with the help of her husband as he will be selling the grown animals and help make the profit.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Файзова Садбаргул Гуломовна жительница района Бохтар. Замужем и имеет 3 детей. Нигде не работает , но занимается домашним хозяйством. Имеет участок земли , для посева картофеля , а также занимяется животноводством. Сейчас хочет купить еще одного бычка для откормки. Кроме того нужно сделать запас комбикорма. Для этого у нее нет денег и она решила получить кредит. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев при помощи мужа, так как он может продавать откормленных животных , получая этим прибыль.

loans.use: To buy a calf and fodder

loans.name: Msami

texts.en: Msami S., is 22 year-old high-school student residing in Kibaha town, a few kilometers from Dar Es Salaam. He runs a kiosk and small restaurant in Dar Es Salaam. The profits he makes help him pay his school fees and also help his mother. His mother is always in charge of the business when he is away from school. Msami needs a loan to help him expand his business and increase his profits so that he can pay his school fees and support his family.

loans.use: To expand his restaurant

loans.name: Halima's Mkombozi Group

texts.en:
Halima is 40 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. Halima owns a small salon, which she started in 1993. Every day, she works from 8am to 10pm at her business.

In the past, Halima has taken out and repaid two loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Riziki, Pendo, and Kuruthum, who have a cafe and a shop, and sell clothing.

loans.use: To buy more salon items for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Eating of meat pie during snacks time is very popular in the Ghanaian working community. This has created a new market for many people, especially women.

Agnes has been operating a baking business for five years. She prepares and sells her pastry in the afternoon to the working community in Koforidua, a brisk town in Ghana. She wants to use her loan to buy more flour, margarine, vegetable oil, sugar, etc., to increase her inventory and to avoid price hikes.

Agnes is a member of the group called “Agyenkwa Nyame” (meaning "Soul Saving God"). Members help each other by guaranteeing for themselves as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more flour, margarine, vegetable oil, sugar, etc., for her bakery

loans.name: Rehema's Mkombozi Group

texts.en:
Rehema is 30 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 5 and 10 years old. Rehema sells rice. She started in 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Rehema has taken out and repaid a loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more rice for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Maimuna and Zainabu, who sell charcoal and clothing.

loans.use: To buy more rice for her business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is thirty five years old and the mother of four children. All of her children are in school. She sells groceries, such as vegetable oil, canned tomatoes, canned fish, and pasta, in the community market. She wants to use her loan to buy more products to increase her inventory and to avoid price hikes.

Janet is a member of the group called “Agyenkwa Nyame” (meaning "The Soul-Saving God"). Members guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products like canned fish, vegetable oil, canned tomatoes, and spices

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 47344

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has been operating a hair dressing salon in her town for the past ten years. She has two apprentices currently learning the trade. Beatrice is thirty three years old and the mother of two children.

She wants to use her loan to buy more hair products to expand her operation. She is a member of the group called Solace. Members agree in principle to support and guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

In the photo, Beatrice is dressing a customer 's hair.

loans.use: To buy more hair products

loans.name: Tuo's Utulivu Group

texts.en:
Tuo is 30 years old and is a married woman with a 5-year-old child. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 15 and 17 years old. Tuo makes and sells batik. She started in 1999. Every day, she works from 7am to 5.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Bernadetha, Tabia, and Happyness, who sell batik, clothes, and food.

loans.use: To buy more clothes item for her business.

loans.name: Khadija's Ngarambe Group

texts.en:
Proscovia is 30 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 10 and 7 years old. Proscovia owns a small salon, which she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

In the past, Proscovia has taken out and successfully repaid 2 loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Khadija and Mariam, who sell clothing.

loans.use: To buy more salon items for her business.

loans.name: Happy

texts.en:
As her name implies, Happy is a happy young woman of twenty six years old. She has been selling ladies' clothing, such as skirts and blouses, jeans, lingerie, and toiletries, in her town for a little over one year. Happy wants to use her loan to buy more ladies' dresses and lingerie to increase her inventory and earn more income.

She is the member of the group called “Awurade Akae Me” (meaning "God has remembered me.") Members of the group use group guarantee principle where each member guarantees for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more ladies clothing and toiletries

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 47348

loans.name: Mwanaidi's Mkombozi Group

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is 48 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 25, 14 and 8 years old. Mwanaidi sells clothes and food. She started in 2001. Every day, she works from 6.30am to 9.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

Mwanaidi has already taken out and successfully repaid 2 loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes and food for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Siwa, who sells food and clothing.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and food items for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is thirty eight years old and the mother of two children. One of the children is currently in school. She has been selling grocery products and cosmetics for four years now. She wants to use her loan to buy more products, because, as she reports, the products sells fast in the market and she needs to increase her inventory.

Millicent is a member of the group called "By His Grace." Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and grocery products.

loans.name: Emilia's Mji Mpya Group

texts.en:
Emilia is 31 years old and is a married woman with a 12-year-old child. Emilia sells vegetables. She started in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

In the past, Emilia has taken and successfully repaid loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Juliana, Sikujua, Kanisia, and Sabina, who sell clothing and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is the mother of 3 children. Her husband is working in the foreign ministry in Kabul and she is a tailor. She works in her home. She has a good number of clients and she wants to open a shop. She has requested an individual loan to complete her tailoring necessities and buy new machines to further her business with more success and help her family.

loans.use: To complete her tailoring necessities

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is thirty one years old and she has one child. Her daughter is in school. She has her own store and she sells grocery products such as soft drinks, rice, sugar, washing powder, vegetables, and spices, in her community. She wants to use her loan to buy more products in order to increase her inventory and to avoid price hikes in the products.

Elizabeth is a member of the group called "By His Grace." Members in unity agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Elizabeth appears in the photo with her daughter.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Halima's Udugu Group

texts.en:
Halima is 42 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 22, 19 and 13 years old. Halima sells clothes. She started in 2008. Every day, she works from 9am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $72 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Mariam and Bahati, who sell clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Maria's Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Maria is 25 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 6 and 2 years old. Maria sells clothes. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Sikujua, who sells charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Tatu's Jiliwaze Group

texts.en:
Tatu is 45 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 25, 13 and 5 years old. Tatu sells clothes. She started in 1992. Every day, she works from 6am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Tatu A. and Magreth, who sell clothing and food.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Jane's Udugu Group

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with a 1-year-old child. Jane owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Fatuma, Frida, and Siwema, who have grocery stores and a studio.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Lucia's Udugu Group

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman with 4 children, ages 26, 22, 20 and 16 years old. Lucia sells clothes. She started in 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Josephina and Aneth, who have sell fish and other food.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Maua

texts.en:
Maua is 32 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 12, 7, and 5 years old. Maua owns a small grocery store and sells clothes. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $49 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To  buy more clothes and food items for her business for her business.

loans.name: Amra

texts.en: Amra is 25 years old and she is married. She is from Đurđevik, a small suburb of the town of Živinice. Her husband works in a coal-mine and his monthly salary is 600 KM (about US$ 480).  This is her second loan at MCO WWI and Amra will use it to start up a chicken-fattening business  and to buy thread for crochet in order to fill her free time and at the same time generate additional income for her family  by selling chickens and eggs.

loans.use: To buy chickens and crochet thread

loans.name: Mary's Udugu Group

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old and is a married woman with 6 children, ages 8-18 years old. Mary sells clothes. She started in 2001. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Marieta and Jenifa, who have tailoring and clothing sales businesses.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Judith S.. She is married and has 2 children, ages 4 months and 6. In 2005 Judith established her natural therapies and nutrition centre business. Judith has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from SELFINA, and she now requires a new loan in order to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand her natural therapies and nutrition centre business

loans.name: Halima's Udugu Group

texts.en:
Halima is 30 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 15, 9 and 4 years old. Halima sells rice. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more rice for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Asia and Mwanaisha, who have businesses dealing in food vending and salon.

loans.use: To buy more rice for her business.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 31-year-old Janeth I.. She is widowed and has 2 children aged 3 and 8. In 2006 Janeth established her farming business. Janeth requires a loan in order to purchase inputs and equipment to grow more crops. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase inputs and equipment in order to grow more crops

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 31-year-old Stella M.. She is single and has 1 child, age 10. In 2005 Stella established her grains business. Stella has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from SELFINA, and she now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of maize and beans in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of beans and maize in bulk

loans.name: Aziza's Udugu Group

texts.en:
Aziza is 42 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, ages 30, 27, 25, 22, 19 and 16 years old. Aziza owns a small grocery store and sells fish. She opened her store 16 years ago in 1991. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food and fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Hery, who also sells food.

loans.use: To buy mre food items and fish for her business.

loans.name: Matrida

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Matrida M.. She is married and has 2 children aged 7 and 10. In 2006 Matrida established her grocery business. Matrida requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of soda, sugar, oil, and soap in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of oil, sugar, soda, and soap in bulk

loans.name: Asha's Taifa Group

texts.en:
Asha is 31 years old and is married woman with 3 children, ages 14,12 and 9 years old. Asha has a bicycle rental business. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more bicycle items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Mwajabu, Anna Makobora ,and Anna M., who have businesses renting bicycles and selling clothing.

loans.use: To buy more  bicycles for hiring.

loans.name: Asha's Taifa Group

texts.en:
Asha is 31 years old and is married woman with 3 children, ages 14,12 and 9 years old. Asha hiring bicycles, she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more bicycles items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwajabu, Anna Makobora and Anna M., who have businesses dealing in bicycles hiring and clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more  bicycles for hiring.

loans.name: Carmen Delia

texts.es:
Carmen started her business because she has always been on her own and had to look for a way to support her children.
