Meskipun harga minyak goreng terus naik, tapi itu tidak menyurutkan niat Ni Ketut untuk terus menekuni usaha jualan krupuk ayam. Setiap hari, Ni Ketut, yang bertempat tinggal di Jl.Raya Sading, kira-kira pukul 05.00 pagi berangkat ke Pasar Sempidi untuk membeli ceker ayam. Stelah tiba dirumah, kemudian ceker itu direbus selama 1 jam lalu ditiriskan. Setelah dingin, ceker ayam dipisahkan dari tulang dan kulit, lalu kemudian dijemur. Setelah kering lalu digoreng dan dibungkus. Pada sore harinya krupuk ceker siap untuk diantar ke warung-warung diseputaran sading. Dai usaha ini ia bisa membiayai sekolah kedua anaknya dan juga untuk biaya hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To increase funding for her business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret M. is thirty years old. She is married with a child. She has been a retailer of charcoal for five years. Margaret is very grateful for the previous loan which made a big difference in her business and family's life. She wants to use the next loan to buy more charcoal stock to serve her customers. She also wants to expand the business to include food stuffs like maize and plantain which are mostly requested by customers. She believes this can help to increase her income to provide a decent shelter for her family. She belongs to the community group called Nyame Asomafo (God’s Ambassadors). Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 38 year old man. He lives in the Beirut suburbs, in the town of Borj Barajneh.

Fouad is a curtain ttailor. This is the sixth time he has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. With the loan, he is planning to buy a car for business use.

loans.use: He is planning to buy a car

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en:
Mazen is a 30 year old man. He lives in the Beirut suburbs, in the town of Borj Barajneh.

Mazen sells natural food. This is the third time he has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. With this loan, he wants to buy provisions for his natural food store.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 66 year old man. He has four children. He lives in the Beirut suburbs, in the town of Borj Barajneh.

Fouad owns a grocery store. This is the second time he has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. With the loan, he wants to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his grocery business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Zaynab

texts.en:
Zaynab is a 30 year old woman. She has one child. She lives in the Beirut suburbs, in the town of Borj Barajneh.

Zaynab sells women's and children's clothing. This is the fourth time she has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. She wants to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Zaynab

texts.en:
Zaynab is a 40 year old woman. She has two children. She lives with her family in the Beirut suburbs, in the town of Borj Barajneh.

Zaynab owns a grocery store. This is the first time she has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. She wants to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business with this loan.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 49 year old man. He has one child. He lives in Borj Barajneh, in the Beirut suburbs.

Jamal owns an artisan store. This is the first time he has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. With the loan, he wants to buy seashells to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy seashells

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa E. is a thirty-three-year-old business woman. She is married with three children aged 13, 10, and 6 years respectively. She sells charcoal and used clothing in a nearby community market. She is happy that her first loan worked miracles in her business and family situation since her family now enjoys improved living conditions.

She wants to use the next loan to buy more supplies of charcoal and bales of used clothes to increase her stock. She believes this will help her meet her customers' demands and allow her to increase her income for her children’s education.

Theresa belongs to the community group called Nyame Asomafo (God’s Ambassadors). Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan capital.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of charcoal and bales of used clothes

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 26, 2008)
Correction due to overpayment for business 47437

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 28 year old man. He lives in Borj Barajneh, in the Beirut suburbs.

Mohamad is an artisan. This is the fourth time he has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. With the loan, he wants to buy material for his business. He plans to use the increased income generated from the loan for his house.

loans.use: To buy materials

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 43 year old man. He has 4 children. He lives in Borj Barajneh, in the suburbs of Beirut.

Ali is a mechanic. This is the fifth time he has applied for a loan with Al Majmoua. With the loan, he wants to buy material for his business.

loans.use: To buy materials

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba Sakyiwa is forty three years old. She is married with six children who are in school. She is a food vendor and sells Kenkey. Kenkey is a local food prepared from maize and is taken with pepper and tomato sauce and fish. Aba has many customers because of good quality and taste. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize for keep due to increasing price of maize because of the recent food crisis. She believes this business can help her to sponsor the children’s education to the university level with assistance from you. She belongs to the community group called Nyame Asomafo (God’s Ambassadors). Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, tomatoes and fish.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva B. A. is a thirty-one year old business woman. She is married with three children who are in school. Eva owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, etc. She is also an interior decorator with skills in room and business decoration. She wants to use the loan to buy more stock of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, etc. to expand her business. She believes that with the increased income, she can build a shop for her decoration business. She belongs to the community group called Steadfast Trust Group. Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk etc.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene D. is twenty-seven years old. She is a wife and mother of two children aged six and four years old. She is the owner and operator of a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, rice, evaporated milk, assorted food spices, cooking oil, candies, biscuits, etc. Irene enjoys selling and works hard to support her family's needs. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, assorted biscuits, cooking oil, cartons of milk, and soaps to increase her stock. She belongs to the community group called Steadfast Trust Group. Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, assorted biscuits, cooking oil, cartons of milk, and soaps.

loans.name: Moussou Sagna

texts.fr:
This member, holder of an account at IMCEC Ziguinchor, is the owner of an inn. She is applying for a 12-month loan to equip her inn.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Cette sociétaire titulaire d'un compte a IMCEC Ziguinchor est propriétaire d’une auberge, elle sollicite un pret sur 12 mois pour équiper son auberge.

loans.use: To equip her inn

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine D. is forty-three years old. She is a wife and the mother of three children who are in school. She is a very industrious woman and her biggest wish is to provide a quality education for her children to give them better opportunities in life . Josephine owns and operates a grocery shop with items like rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, evaporated milk, etc. She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks, and cooking oil to increase her stock of goods. With increased stock of different varieties, she hopes to make more income to provide for the educational needs of her children. She belongs to the community group called Steadfast Trust Group. Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Firmine

texts.fr:
Born on 10 December 1980 in DANGBO in the department of OUEME, Mrs. Firmine S. is married to François AMIGO, a refrigeration technician in the city of COTONOU. She is the mother of 3 children : Alvine, aged 7, Francky, aged 4, and Anicet, aged 2. All of her children are in school and are in the care of their parents.

She is based in ADOGLETE, a suburb of COTONOU, where she runs a business selling various products such as canned food, eggs, liquor, rice, and other goods. An upstanding woman, Mrs. Firmine S. is on her fifth loan and has always repaid her debts without incident. Currently, she faces some difficulty in satisfying all her customers. For this reason, she is asking for this loan in order to supply herself so as to meet the demands of her clientele, as well as to diversify her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 10 décembre 1980 à DANGBO dans le département de l’OUEME, dame S. Firmine est mariée à AMIGO François, frigoriste dans la ville de COTONOU. Elle est mère de 3 enfants; Alvine 7 ans, Francky 4 ans et Anicet 2 ans. Tous ses enfants sont scolarisés et sont à la charge de leurs géniteurs.

Elle s’est installée à ADOGLETA, un bidonville de COTONOU où elle mène son activité de vente de divers produits tels que les boîtes de conserve, les œufs, les liqueurs, le riz et autres produits. De bonne moralité, dame S. Firmine est à son cinquième prêt et a toujours fait un bon remboursement. Actuellement, elle éprouve quelques difficultés à satisfaire tous ses clients. Pour cela, elle sollicite ce prêt pour pouvoir s’approvisionner afin de satisfaire les demandes de sa clientèle et aussi pour diversifier son activité.

loans.use: To buy 20 trays of eggs, 10 bags of rice, 2 boxes of canned food, and 2 boxes of liquor

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac L. M. is forty years old. He is married and the father of five children who are currently in school. Isaac is a manufacturer of liquid soap and has supplied his products to restaurants and canteen operators over the last year. His production is on a very small scale due to capital inadequacy. He wants to use the loan to buy more stock of raw materials like base, salt, colour, and bottles to expand his production and increase his income. His dream is to see his business grow bigger to allow him to better support his family’s basic needs and children’s educational needs. He belongs to the community group called Steadfast Trust Group. Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock of raw materials like base, salt, colour, and bottles.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
This woman sells fish at the fishing dock, and she is asking for a loan to be repaid in 12 months in order to buy boxes and to strengthen her fish business.

Cette femme vend du poisson au quai de pêche, elle sollicite un prêt remboursable en 12 mois pour acheter des bacs et renforcer son commerce de poissons.

loans.use: To buy boxes and to strengthen her fish-selling business

loans.name: Ghislaine

texts.fr:
Born on 6 October 1979 in COTONOU, the economic capital of BENIN, Mrs.Ghislaine Z. is married and has twins named Conty and Constantine, who are 5 years old and in the first year of elementary school. She is a hairstylist by profession and has had a salon in YENAWA, a populous area of COTONOU, for more than 12 years. But alongside her hairstyling job, she sells trays of fresh eggs which she delivers to retailers and wholesalers. Due to the demand being very high, especially recently, she is asking for this loan to supply herself in order to meet the demands of her clientele.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 6 octobre 1979 à COTONOU dans la capitale économique du BENIN, dame Z. Ghislaine est mariée et mère de 2 jumeaux Conty et Constantine âgés de 5 ans et en classe de CI (Cours d'Initiation). Elle est coiffeuse de profession ayant son  salon de coiffure à YENAWA, un quartier populaire de COTONOU depuis plus de 12 ans. Mais parallèlement à la coiffure, elle vend des plateaux d’œufs frais qu’elle livre aux détaillants et aux semi-grossistes. La demande étant très forte surtout ces derniers temps, elle sollicite ce prêt pour s’approvisionner afin de répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy various cosmetic products and 100 trays of fresh eggs

He wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of foam mattresses to increase his stock. He dreams of expanding his business to include additional stock like pillows, bedspreads, curtains, etc. to meet the needs of his customers and increase his income. loans.name: El Hadji Saloum

texts.fr:
This young entrepreneur offers services: sales of credit cards and of newspapers in the south capital. By investing in this niche, instead of going the route of illegal immigration, this youngster demonstrates that people can really undertake a worthwhile business if they believe in it. With this loan, he wants to diversify his business by offering fruit (apples, oranges, etc.) to his loyal customers, who are composed of management personnel from the administration and from the private sector (NGO projects) who, as they buy the daily paper, would be able to pay for a little fruit for their families. He is also counting on bolstering his inventory of credit cards, which is going to add up to more profit for his commerce.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Ce jeune entrepreneur offre des services : vente de cartes de crédit et vente de journaux dans la capitale du sud.En investissant ce créneau, ce jeune au lieu de prendre les chemins de l'immigration clandestine, est un exemple qu'on peut bien entreprendre une activité rentable si l'on y croit. Il veut ,par ce prêt , diversifier ses activités en proposant des fruits (pommes, oranges etc) à sa fidéle clientéle constituée du personnel cadre de l'administration et du secteur privé (projets, ONGs) qui en achetant la presse du jour pourrait également payer un peu de fruits pour leurs familles. Aussi il compte renforcer son stock de cartes de crédit, ce qui va constituer davantage de bénéfices pour son commerce.

loans.use: Diversification of his business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for UIMCEC, a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Suzy

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 40 year-old Suzy I.. She is married, and has three children between the ages of 7 and 17. She also has one other dependent. In 2004, Suzy established her tailoring and grains business. She is assisted by her two employees. Suzy requires a loan in order to purchase stocks of cloth and grain in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets. The lack of tangible collateral assets means they are deemed not-creditworthy by financial institutions, restricting access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of cloth and grain in bulk.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 30 year-old Anipha A.. She is married, and has three children between the ages of 3 and 12. In 2006, Anipha established her small retail business. She earns about US $150 every month from this business. Anipha requires a loan in order to purchase stocks of soap and oil in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets. The lack of tangible collateral assets means they are deemed not-creditworthy by financial institutions, restricting access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of soap and oil in bulk.

loans.name: Elici

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 40 year-old Elici L.. She is married and has six children aged between 7 and 23. In 1999, Elici established her seamstress business. She is assisted by her three employees. Elici requires a loan to purchase stocks of cloth and sewing accessories in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets. The lack of tangible collateral assets means they are deemed not-creditworthy by financial institutions, restricting access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of cloth and sewing accessories in bulk.

loans.name: Fedelis' Keko Group

texts.en:
Fedelis, age 32, is married with a three year old son. He owns a phone card business where he sells vouchers from 7am to 8pm daily. He started this work a year back and now makes about $460 a month from his sales.

In the past, Fedelis borrowed a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more phone vouchers. Having paid this back successfully, he now hopes for a new loan to start up his voucher business in another location. He will share this loan with his subgroup, whose members have cafe, soft drink, clothing, and food vending businesses. These members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Fedelis is standing on the right.

loans.use: To buy more phone vouchers to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen G. M. has a general store in the town of Cruz del Pardo high in the sierras of La Libertad Region. She started the store two years ago from a room in her home. Before the general store, she had a business buying and selling different vegetables.

Carmen is 33 years old and single with 1 child. She is happy to have her business because she can work from home, spend time with her child, and her economic situation has improved. In the future she hopes to send her child to school and keep on growing her store.

A member of the community bank Luchando Progreso, Carmen is requesting a loan of s/1500 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to restock her store with the best selling products.

loans.use: She will use the loan to restock her store with the best selling products.

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.en:
Juana Isabel C. C. has a business selling milk in the town of Carabamba, high in the sierras of La Libertad Region. She has 2 years of experience. She built relationships with many farmers and sells the milk for them in Carabamba.

Juana is 34 years old, single, and has 2 children. Before she started her business she worked in a house washing clothes. She now has more dignity and many more friends. She plans on growing her business and sending her children to school.

A member of the community bank Union y Fuerzo, Juana is requesting a loan of s/1000 to repay over 4 months. She will use the extra capital to buy and sell more delicious milk.

loans.use: She will use the extra capital to buy and sell more delicious milk.

loans.name: Kelli

texts.en:
Kelli A. G. has a business selling rice, sugar, wheat, and corn in the town of Carabamba high in the sierras of La Libertad Region. As a distributor she provides many of the general stores in town with these goods. She has 7 years of experience and is very well known in the community.

Kelli is 25 years old, single, and has one child. She is happy because her economic situation is stable and she can send her child to school. Her main goal is to send her child to a University to study and become a professional.

A member of the community bank Union Y Fuerza, Kelli is requesting a loan of s/1000 to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to buy more rice, sugar, wheat, and corn.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy more rice, sugar, wheat, and corn.

loans.name: Santos Gaciela

texts.en:
Santos Gaciela R. R. is a proactive business woman in the town of Topacamyron high is the sierras of La Libertad Region. She has a general store, makes cheese, raises animals, and knits. One every week she travels to Trujillo to sell cheese and textiles. She has over 30 years of business experience and may loyal customers.

Santos is 54 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has had many different types of jobs over the years but she loves working and helping her family. Her businesses give her a great deal of self esteem.

A member of the community bank Union y Fuerzos, Santos is requesting a loan of s/2500 to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to buy piglets, ingredients for cheese, and restock her store.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy piglets, ingredients for cheese, and restock her store.

loans.name: Celmira

texts.en:
Celmira V. C. has a business knitting beautiful goods in the town of Moche near the city of Trujillo in La Libertad Region. She’s been knitting her entire life and has many different products and loyal clients. On the weekend, Celmira also runs a small eatery serving crillo food to people in her community.

Celmira is 38 years old, single, and has 1 child. She loves working from home where she can also spend time with her child. She works hard to save so she can one day send her child to university to study and become a professional. She also has the goal to one day own her own restaurant.

A member of the community bank Siempre Adelante II, Celmira is requesting a loan of s/800 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy the materials needed to make her beautiful goods.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy the materials needed to make her beautiful knitted goods.

loans.name: Alejandrina Leila

texts.en:
Alejandrina Leila O. M. has a general store in the town of Carabamba high in the sierras of La Libertad Region. Alejandrina has over 20 years of experience working in retail. Her parents also owed a general store. Her store is located right in the middle of town and is well stocked so she has plenty of loyal customers.

Alejandrina is 34 years old, married, and has 3 children. She enjoys being able to work from home where she can also take care of her children. Her husband is very supportive and they work well together.

A member of the community bank Alpha y Omega, Alejandrina is requesting a loan of s/600 to repay over 4 months. Alejandrina will use the loan to restock her store with all her best selling goods such as oil, sugar, corn, beer, and soda.

loans.use: Alejandrina will use the loan to restock her store with all her best selling goods such as oil, sugar, corn, beer, and soda.

loans.name: John King

texts.en:
John King A. owns a provision store. He is married and has seven children. He has been in the trading business for some years now. Business is going very well he wishes to increase sales.

He is asking for $1200.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell in his provision store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.en:
Rosendo A. C. has a cheese-making business in the town of Carabamba high in the Sierras of La Libertad Region. She makes the cheeses during the week and then travels to the city of Trujillo to sell her product. She has over 20 years of experience. Her slogan is “Better for Less” and she has many loyal customers.

A. is 61 years old, married, and has 7 children. Family is very important to her and she is happy she has a business to help support her children and grandchildren. A. is in wonderful health and looks forward to growing her business.

A member of the community bank Alfa y Omega, A. is requesting a loan of s/1300 to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to buy ingredients to make more cheese.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy ingredients to make more cheese.

loans.name: Faustina Blas

texts.en:
Faustina Blas V. N. has a general store in the town of Carabamba high in the sierras of La Libertad Region. She placed the store in the front room of her home, which is situated on a corner of the Plaza de Armas in the center of town. She is well known in her community and has many loyal customers. She has over 20 years of experience and has the only store in town that sells specialty products like champagne and other liqueurs.

Faustina is 57 years old, married, and has 6 children. She loves working and helping her family. She and her supportive husband believe it’s important to have two incomes. She looks forward to growing her business and helping her grandchildren attend school.

A member of the community bank Alfa y Omega, Faustina is requesting a loan of s/1500 to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to restock her store with all her best selling products.

loans.use: She will use the loan to restock her store with all her best selling products.

loans.name: Darlin Del Carmen

texts.es:
Darlin M. is a business woman in the municipality of El Sauce in the city of León. She works arduously in this field with the aim of supporting her two nephews, who are under her care. It is necessary to note that she is single, which means that her only source of income is this job that she carries out daily in order to cover the household expenses and offer her children an education.

It is important to emphasize the area in which she lives does not offer electricity, so she has obtained a solar panel in order to accomplish both the education of her two young nephews and the household chores. For this reason, upon obtaining the solar panel, she has sought Ceprodel’s financial support so that she can receive a loan that will allow her to pay off her debt, thus acquiring a better quality of life along with her loved ones and moving forward as the head of the household.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Darling M. es una dama que se dedica al negocio en el municipio de El Sauce en la ciudad de León. Se dedica arduamente a este trabajo con el propósito de mantener a sus dos nietos que están bajo su responsabilidad. Es necesario destacar que esta dama es soltera y por este motivo su único sustento es el trabajo que a diario ella lleva a cabo para suplir las necesidades del hogar y también para brindarles a sus hijos las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo escolar.

Es necesario destacar que en la localidad donde ella habita no cuentan con energía eléctrica y por tal motivo ha adquirido un panel solar para lograr llevar a cabo tanto el estudio de sus dos pequeños sobrinos como los quehaceres del hogar. Por esta razón es que al adquirir el panel solar ha buscado el apoyo crediticio en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la cancelación de esta deuda y así tener un mejor nivel de vida junto con los suyos para lograr mejorar y salir adelante como cabeza del hogar.

loans.use: Payment of home solar panel

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Eligio

texts.es:
Eligio M. is a gentleman from the municipality of El Sauce in the city of León. He works in the agricultural business in order to support his wife and three children, whom he must provide for and offer an education to because he is the sole provider. He arduously dedicates himself to his business with the aim of improving his family’s financial status.

One problem that Mr. Eligio faces is that there is no electricity in his neighborhood because he lives in a zone that is far away from the urban area. For this reason, he has requested the installation of a solar panel. Upon having obtained the panel, his obligation is to pay off his debt. For this reason, he seeks the help of Ceprodel to get a loan, improving his living conditions by counting on this invaluable service: electricity.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El caballero Eligio M. originario del municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León se ha dedicado al negocio agropecuario con el cual mantiene a su familia compuesta por su esposa y tres hijos los que tiene el deber de alimentarles y brindarles las posibilidades de estudio por ser el único ingreso del hogar. Se dedica muy esforzadamente a este negocio con el propósito de mejorar la situación económica de su hogar.

Una problemática que atraviesa el señor Eligio es que en su sector de habitación no poseen energía eléctrica por ser una zona muy alejada de la zona urbana, para ello ha solicitado la instalación de un panel solar para resolver esta situación. Al haber adquirido el panel su obligación es cancelar esta deuda y es por ello que ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la cancelación de esta deuda y así iniciar con el mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida de su hogar contando con este valiosísimo servicio como lo es la energía eléctrica.

loans.use: Payment of home solar panel

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Celina Esperanza

texts.en:
Celina Esperanza H. V. has a general store and small restaurant in the town of Carabamba high in the Sierras of La Libertad Region. She has 15 years of experience working in retail and 2 with her restaurant. She serves food typical to the region like rice with chicken, lamb, and more. She is very well know and has many loyal customers.

Celina is 52 years old, single, and has 3 children. She is happy to have her businesses because without them she wouldn’t have any way to make money and feed her children. Her dream and motivation to keep moving forward is to educate her children.

A member of the community bank Alfa y Omega, Celina is requesting a loan of s/2000 to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to restock her store and buy ingredients for her delicious meals.

loans.use: She will use the loan to restock her store and buy ingredients for her delicious meals.

loans.name: José Maria

texts.es:
Mr. José Maria D., known as “Chemita” in the municipality of El Sauce in the city of León, works in the agricultural business. He has his own farm in which he grows his crops and raises a small number of cattle.

Dedicated to his spouse and three children, Mr. D. works hard in order to provide them with better living conditions and an education. His dream is therefore to eradicate the problem that they have faced for a long time: the lack of electricity. They live in a distant rural area, which is why he has obtained a solar panel that allows them to install two lamps and access other appliances, such as a television set, an iron, and a radio. Upon having obtained this panel, he must now pay off his debt, which is why he wisely seeks the help of Ceprodel to get a loan so that he can pay the solar panel and see his dream of improving his family’s living conditions come true.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor José Maria D. conocido comúnmente como chemita en el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León se dedica muy esforzadamente al negocio agropecuario teniendo su propia finca donde da lugar a sus cultivos y donde cría su ganado que por cierto son pocos animales que desarrolla.

Comprometido con su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y tres hijos, el señor José Maria se esfuerza para proporcionar las mejores condiciones de vida para los suyos tanto a su cónyuge en el hogar como a sus hijos en el mantenimiento de sus estudios. Por esto sus sueños son erradicar la problemática que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado como lo es la ausencia de la energía eléctrica por vivir en una zona rural alejada. Por este motivo ha adquirido un panel solar que permite la instalación de dos lámparas y acceso a otro electrodoméstico como televisor, plancha o radio. Al haber adquirido este bien su necesidad es obtener el recurso económico para cancelar esta deuda y es por este motivo que muy sabiamente acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario que le permita el pago del panel solar para ver cumplido su sueño de mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia.

loans.use: Payment of home solar panel

loans.name: Mario De Jesús

texts.es:
Mario R. is a gentleman who has stood out as a hard worker in the agricultural business, having acquired vast experience over the years. He is the father of two children of whom he is really proud because they have excelled in their school in the municipality of El Sauce in the beautiful city of León, Nicaragua.

A problem that Mr. R. has faced for some time is that there is no electricity in his community because he lives in a rural area. It is difficult for them to have light at night, which he does by means of an oil lamp that only illuminates a section of the living room and not the rest of the house. As a result, he has requested the installation of a solar panel to have electricity. He now has a debt which he must pay off, so he is seeking the help of Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will help him pay for the panel, thus providing his beloved family with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Mario R. es un caballero que se ha destacado por ser muy trabajador y dedicarse al negocio agropecuario habiendo adquirido basta experiencia a través de los años que se ha dedicado a esta labor. Es padre de familia con dos hijos que según comenta se siente muy orgulloso debido a que ellos se han destacado como buenos alumnos en su colegio en el municipio de El Sauce en la bella ciudad de León en Nicaragua.

Una problemática que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado el señor Mario de Jesús es que vive en una comunidad donde no existe energía eléctrica por ser una zona rural y para ello le es imposible iluminarse por las noches por lo que lo hace por medio de un candil que no abarca toda su vivienda sino una cierta parte de la sala. Para esto, ha solicitado la implementación de un panel solar para usar la energía para iluminarse. Al haberlo adquirido tiene el deber de cancelar esta deuda y es aquí donde busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario que le permita la cancelación del panel y así iniciar a brindarle las mejores condiciones de vida a su amada familia.

loans.use: Payment of home solar panel

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 24, 2008)
Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Irma Lucia

texts.en:
Irma Lucia L. B. has a business raising and selling livestock in the town of Carabamba high in the Sierras of La Libertad Region. With the help of her family Irma raises lambs, pigs, and cattle. She has 6 years of experience and never has a problem finding customers.

Irma is 34 years old, single, and has 1 child. She is thankful to have her business as she has no one to rely on. Her dream is to continue to grow her business and send her child to University.

A member of the community bank Alfa y Omega, Irma is requesting a loan of s/1500 to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to buy a cow and food for her animals.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy a cow and food for her animals.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Mr. Pedro R. is a hardworking gentleman who from a young age has acquired vast experience in the agricultural business. Today, it is his only source of income with which he supports his family. He currently has a small farm which he cultivates at the right moment and also raises cattle, providing pasture for them to feed on. It is important to stress that this job requires a lot of dedication, which is why this gentleman works hard in order to improve his family’s living conditions.

He is currently in need of purchasing calves to raise. For this reason, he is seeking the help of Ceprodel so that he can obtain a loan that will allow him to buy the calves and make the most use of them, selling milk or other cow-derived products. It is important to note that he has a history of two loans with Ceprodel, which were paid on time and according to the guidelines specified by this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Pedro R. es un caballero muy esforzado que desde muy joven adquirió basta experiencia en el negocio agropecuario y hoy en día se dedica a este negocio siendo su único ingreso para mantener a su familia. Actualmente cuenta con su pequeña finca donde prepara las condiciones para la siembra cuando esto es necesario y de igual manera prepara las condiciones para la crianza de las vaquillas seleccionando el pasto para su respectiva alimentación. Es de mucha necesidad destacar que este trabajo requiere de muchísima disposición y por eso es que este caballero se esfuerza fuertemente para mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.

Hoy en día la necesidad que él atraviesa es la compra de terneros para su desarrollo. Por este motivo acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con el crédito que le permita la compra de estos animales para sacarle el máximo provecho y así comercializar ya sea la leche o el resto de sus productos derivados. Es necesario destacar que actualmente tiene un record de dos créditos con Ceprodel pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido con la institución.

loans.use: Purchase of calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Silia

texts.es:
The cattle business requires much hard work because one must treat the animals with care. Furthermore, one must transport them long distances, exposing the livestock farmer to physical strain and weariness caused by the sun and the activity. Despite this fact, Mrs. Silia M. works in this business in the municipality of El Sauce in the city of León with the aim of improving her family’s living conditions. She is a single mother who must support her children who so greatly need her.

She currently needs to purchase a pregnant cow, which is why she wisely turns to Ceprodel in order to obtain a loan that will help with the purchase. She would like to raise the cow and sell its milk in her locality in the municipality of El Sauce.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de la ganadería requiere de mucho esfuerzo por el hecho de que se debe de tratar muy cuidadosamente a los animales y además se necesita trasladarlos desde largas distancias exponiéndose la persona ganadera al desgaste físico y al cansancio proporcionado por el sol y la actividad. A pesar de esta situación, en el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León, la señora Silia M. se dedica a este negocio con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia ya que es madre soltera y con la necesidad de mantener a sus hijos que tanto necesitan de ella.

Actualmente la necesidad que esta dama atraviesa es la ausencia del recurso económico para la compra de una vaca en preñez es por este motivo que muy sabiamente ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito con el cual pueda comprarla con el propósito de desarrollarla y extraer sus derivados como la leche para su respectiva comercialización en su localidad de habitación en el municipio de El sauce.

loans.use: Purchase of pregnant cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Cristio

texts.en:
Maria Cristio C. R. has a general store in the town of Carabamba high in the sierras of La Libertad Region. At the store, which she placed in a room in her home, she sells all the goods people buy on a regular basis including rice, noodles, oil, sodas, and more. Her business is located outside of town so her neighbors don’t need to travel to the center to buy their goods.

Maria is 50 years old, single, and has5 children. She has no one to support her so she is happy to have her business. She has 15 years of experience and many loyal customers. Her dream is to send her two youngest children to University.

A member of the community bank Alfa y Omega, Maria is requesting a loan of s/1200 to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to restock her store with her best selling goods.

loans.use: She will use the loan to restock her store with her best selling goods.

loans.name: Robi's Mafanikio Group

texts.en:
Robi, age 33, is married with three children (ages 7, 4, and 2). She has been running a fruit and vegetable stand since 2000 and a small charcoal business since 2004. From her sales, she makes a total monthly profit of about $190. She works from 6:30am to 8pm daily in order to support her home.

In the past, Robi has taken 3 loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more charcoal, fruit, and vegetables, and to build a small house. Having paid them back successfully, she now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with her subgroup, whose members sell chickens, clothing, fruit, and general items. They belong to a loan group whose member guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Robi is standing on the right.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables and to continue construction on her new home

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Janet Esmeralda

texts.en:
Janet Esmeralda M. A. is a proactive business woman in Cortijo, a suburb of Trujillo in La Libertad Region. She has businesses selling beauty products and beer, and also owns a photocopy machine. Neighbors stop by to get documents scanned and copied. She’s sold beauty products since 1992 and has many loyal customers. All of her businesses are located in her home which she owns.

Janet is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children. She loves working from home where she can also take care of her children. She works so she will one day have the money to send all of her children to University.

A member of the community bank Fuente de Vida, Janet is requesting a loan of s/1200 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy paper, toner, and ink for her photocopier.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy paper, toner, and ink for her photocopier.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina L. has a general store in Porvenir, a suburb of Trujillo in La Libertad Region. She opened her store 1 year ago after working in a home washing clothes for most of her life. She now earns more money selling food and clothing to her neighbors.

Marina is 39 years old, married, and has 4 children. She is so happy she has her store. She can now work from home and spend more time with her children. She also feels betters because washing clothes everyday was very difficult on her hands. She dreams of one day being able to send her children to University.

A member of the community bank Mujeres al Progresso, Marina is requesting a loan of s/2500 to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to restock her store and add some new products.

loans.use: She will use the loan to restock her store and add some new products.

loans.name: Wendy Yovana

texts.en:
Wendy Yovana Z. S. has a general store in Cortijo, a suburb of Trujillo in La Libertad Region. She’s had her store for 5 years and sells all the goods that people buy most frequently. Her store is located in the front space of her home.

Wendy is 25 years old, married, and has 2 children. She works hard every day to take care of her family and business. She dreams of one day sending her children to University and owning a large store.

A member of the community bank Fuente de Vida, Wendy is requesting a loan of s/1500 to repay over 6 months. She will use the extra capital to restock her store and add new products.

loans.use: She will use the extra capital to restock her store and add new products.

loans.name: Ana Mercy

texts.es:
Mrs. Ana Mercy R. V. is a member of the Communal Bank “VISION 2000.” She lives in San Martín region of Picota province in San Hilarión state. Her business is located on Marginal avenue at Fernando Belaude Terri highway, where she sells groceries, candy, and other edible products for daily consumption.

Previously she sold clothing for children, men and women, but she didn’t have a great demand for her products. So she decided to open a grocery store, with the goal of improving her income and contributing to the improvement of her community.

With a loan for S/3000.00, which will be repaid in 6 monhts, she will buy a variety of packaged candy, sacks of rice and sugar, personal care items, items for the home, school and office supplies and stock up on soda pop.

Ana Mercy has 3 children together with her husband who support her always in her business. Together they dream of having a bigger business and ensure the well-being of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ana Mercy R. V., es socia del Banco Comunal “VISION 2000” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Picota y distrito de San Hilarión, su negocio está ubicado en la Av. Marginal , carretera Fernando Belaude Terri , en el vende abarrotes en general, golosinas y otros productos comestibles de consumo diario.

Anteriormente vendía ropas de niños, caballeros y damas, que no tuvo la demanda necesaria, por lo que decidió implementar una bodega, con visión a mejorar su economía y contribuir al progreso de la comunidad.

Con el préstamo de S/. 3000.00, el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará golosinas en paquetes de distintas variedades, arroz y azúcar en sacos, útiles de aseo personal y para el hogar, útiles escolares y de oficina, además de surtir con bebidas gasificadas.

Ana Mercy tiene 03 hijos que junto a su esposo son quienes la apoyan siempre en el negocio, juntos sueñan con tener un negocio más grande y asegurar el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more products for her store

loans.name: Mariamu's Mt Everest D Group

texts.en:
Mariamu, age 35, is married with 3 children (ages 12, 2, and 6 months). She runs a soft drink retail shop, which she started in 2001. She works from 6:30am to 3pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $180 from her sales.

In the past, Mariamu took a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more inventory of soft drinks. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with her subgroup, whose members have clothing businesses and sell general items.

In the picture, Mariamu is second from the right.

loans.use: To buy more inventory of soft drinks

loans.name: Maria Ercilia

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Ercilia B. P. is a member of the Communal Bank “Ayaymaman” and lives in the San Martín region of Moyobamba province in Moyobanba state. Her stand is located in the Ayaymaman market, where she sells groceries, vegetables, and other daily staples.

Upon finding herself a widow and seeing the necessity of supporting her children by herself, she found the possibility of a loan from the communal bank so she began selling bread products.

With a loan of S/1000.00 which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will buy: a variety of packaged noodles, crates of preserved fish, sacks of rice and sugar, liters of oil, and stock up on personal care products and products for the home.

She is 74 years old and lives with one of her daughters and grandchildren. She plans to keep working and have happy golden years.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Maria Ercilia B. P., es socia del Banco Comunal “Ayaymaman” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Moyobamba y distrito de Moyobamba, su puesto de ventas está ubicado en el mercado “Ayaymaman” en el vende abarrotes en general, verduras y otros productos comestibles de consumo diario.

Al quedarse viuda y viendo la necesidad de mantener sola a sus hijos y teniendo la posibilidad de un crédito en el banco comunal se inicia en la venta de productos de pan llevar.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 para pagar en 6 cuotas, comprará: fideos en paquetes de distintas variedades, conservas de pescado en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos en sacos, aceite en litros, además de surtir productos de aseo para el hogar y personal.

Actualmente tiene 74 años vive junto a una de sus hijas y sus nietos, anhela seguir trabajando y tener una feliz vejes.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Kouroka Group

texts.fr:
The Kouroke group is based in Ile de Carabane and intends to pursue commercial activity in the field of selling fresh and processed fish. Our village is full of potential in terms of seafood products which, once appropriately treated, could be a sustainable source of income for women and children. It is in this setting that we have come to ask for a loan with Kiva and SEM to be able to put in motion the marketing of the products fished by the villagers. We hope to be able to export our products using modern means to other regions of Senegal and to neighbouring countries, where there is always high demand thanks to the scarcity of fish in those areas.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Le groupe Kouroka est installé dans l'Île de Carabane et compte mener des activités commerciales dans le genre de vente de poisson transformé et frais. Notre village a plein de potentialité en matière de produits halieutiques qui une fois bien traitées, pourrait être une source de revenu durables pour les femmes et les jeunes. C'est dans ce cadre que nous sommes venues solliciter auprtès de Kiva et SEM un prêt pour pouvoir nous activer dans la commercialisations de ces produits qui sont pêchés par les villageois. Nous comptons pouvoir ,d'une façon très moderne, exporter nos produits vers d'autres régions du Sénégal et dans les pays limitrophes, où une forte demande se fait tous les jours à cause de la rareté de poissons dans ces localités.

loans.use: To buy processed seafood products

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa S. Q. is a member of the Communal Bank “VISION 2000.” She lives in the San Martín region of Picota province in San Hilarión state. Her business is located on Marginal avenue at Fernando Belaunde Terri highway, where she sells groceries, candy, and other consumable products.

She studied in the university to be a teacher but did not finish her degree due to lack of money for tuition.

With the loan for S/1500, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will buy a variety of packaged noodles, crates of preserved fish, sacks of rice and sugar, liters of oil, and stock up on soda pop and candy as well as home and personal care products.

Rosa has two children, her husband helps her with everything, and together they dream of have a bigger business and ensure the well-being of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa S. Q., es socia del Banco Comunal ,“VISIÒN 2000” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Picota y distrito de San Hilarión su negocio está ubicado en la avenida Marginal , carretera Fernando Belaunde Terri, vende abarrotes en general, golosinas y otros productos comestibles de consumo diario.

Tiene estudio superiores no concluidos de profesora, que los dejo por falta de medios económicos para continuar estudiando.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00, el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará fideos en paquetes de distintas variedades, conservas de pescado en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos en sacos, aceite en litros, además de surtir con bebidas gasificadas y golosinas y productos de aseo para el hogar y personal.

Rosa tiene doshijos, su esposo la apoya en todo, juntos sueñan con tener un negocio más grande y asegurar el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela is always very content and has great charisma which has served her well in her cosmetic sales business. She goes out during the afternoon as well as other times of the day in order to earn income that her family needs. Her daily efforts are inspired by her 9 year old son, who is her greatest inspiration. She sells brand name beauty products and she wants to also sell some home products thereby taking advantage of her daily house to house sales. This is why she needs a loan, which will be used to buy household and beauty products to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Adela, está siempre muy contenta, el carisma que ella tiene le ha servido de mucho para emprender su negocio de venta de cosméticos. Sale por las tardes y en otros momentos más para poder tener las ganancias que requiere su familia para su completo desarrollo, sus esfuerzos diarios son impulsados por su hijo de 9 años que su motivo más grande. Oferta productos de belleza de una marca reconocida y quiere vender también algunos artículos del hogar aprovechando su trabajo diario de visita de casa en casa. Es por ello que necesita un préstamo, monto que será destinado para la compra de artículos para el hogar y productos de belleza.

loans.use: Increase her income in ordder to also offer home products for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es:
Olimpia has much strength in spite of the accident she suffered when she fell from a second story floor, which left her bed ridden for a month during which time her family’s needs continued to grow. So Olimpia began to return to her daily activities as soon as she was able to do so. She sells coats and clothing items made of polartec. She began her business 2 years ago and she is happy that with daily effort her income has been growing and her family’s well-being ensured. Her wish is to continue growing her business. Recently she has gone in to business with her beloved daughter and they have decided to start their own seamstress shop, and for that reason she is asking for a loan in order to aquire a great quantity and variety of raw material to fulfill this business plan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Olimpia, tiene muchas fuerzas a pesar del accidente que tuvo tras caerse de un segundo piso la cual la mantuvo un mes postrada en cama y como es común las necesidades no se postergan, por esa razón Olimpia empezó a retomar sus actividades luego de tener pocos avances en su recuperación. Ella vende frazadas y prendas de vestir a base de tela polar, emprendió su negocio hace 2 años y está contenta de que con el esfuerzo diario van incrementándose sus ganancias y el bienestar de su familia. Su deseo es continuar e implementar su negocio. Hace poco se ha asociado con su amada hija y han decidido emprender su propio taller de confección, por esa razón solicita un préstamo a fin de adquirir gran cantidad y variedad de materia prima para llevar a cabo su propósito.

loans.use: Buy raw materials to being work in her small seamstress shop working together with her beloved daughter.

loans.name: Félix

texts.es:
Felix is a young father who day after day works to provide the best to his 1 year old and 1 month old children. Since he was a young boy he has dedicated himself to working as a tailor and all this effort and sacrifice have served him well and with his savings he bought a second hand sewing machine and this is how he began to make articles for cars. Thanks to the quality of his products he has seen his production grow and today his earnings have grown considerably and he has been able to acquire another sewing machine. Now his wish is to be able to expand his business making athletic clothing, and he is preparing to make this expansion now.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Félix es un joven padre de familia que día tras día se esfuerza por ofrecer lo mejor a sus dos pequeños hijos de 1 año y de un mes. Desde muy jovencito él se ha dedicado al trabajo de la costura en talleres de confección y todo ese esfuerzo y sacrificio le ha valido para que con sus ahorros compre una máquina de coser de segundo uso, es así que el comenzó a elaborar prendas para autos, gracias a la calidad de sus productos ha visto incrementada su producción y hoy por hoy han aumentado considerablemente sus ganancias y ha podido adquirir una máquina más. Ahora su deseo es poder incursionar en la confección de prendas de vestir deportivas para lo cual se está preparando.

loans.use: Increased capital in order to increase production

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 47513

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy is a lady who knows very well the benefits she wants to obtain for her family, and that is the reason why she has been making photocopies for several years with a huge photocopier, which allows her daily earnings. She gets up very early to attend to the needs of her 4 children who are presently studying, and she always faces life with optimism in spite of the difficult economic situation she has been living for years as she is separated from her husband. Her continuous effort has opened new horizons for her to support her home. She requests a loan to be able to buy more supplies for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Nancy es una mujer que tiene muy claro lo que desea conseguir para beneficio de los suyos y por esa razón se dedica desde hace varios años a realizar impresiones con su instrumento de trabajo, una fotocopiadota, que le permite las ganancias diarias del día. Se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus 4 hijos que actualmente están estudiando y siempre mira con optimismo la vida a pesar de la difícil situación económica que por años ha atravesado, debido a la separación de su esposo. Su continuo esfuerzo le ha abierto nuevos horizontes para poder sostener su hogar. Desea adquirir mayor cantidad de insumos para su labor y a esa razón atiende su petición de un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to increase service at a photo copy center.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 47514

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Doña Agripina is a courageous and enthusiastic lady who harvests excellent crops year after year thanks to her hard work in the field together with her loyal companion. Together they have created a beautiful family with decent children, and now both are working to support themselves. They still work their land growing potatoes, corn, and broad beans. The crop is sold in the city of Lima and also at the local market. The earnings have sustained her home for the past 4 years and she has been able to improve her house and today she needs the loan to adapt a small sales space at home.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Agripina es una mujer con mucho coraje y entusiasmo, año tras año ha cosechado excelentes productos gracias a su ardua labor en el campo en compañía de su fiel compañero. Junto a él ha formado una linda familia cuyos hijos son hombres y mujeres de bien y ahora ambos trabajan para poder sostenerse. Aún continúan labrando su tierra y cultiva en ella papa, maíz y habas, su cosecha la oferta en la ciudad de Lima y también en el mercado local de su comunidad. Por 4 años con estas ganancias ha sostenido la economía de su hogar y ha podido mejorar las instalaciones de su casa y hoy necesita un préstamo para concretar el anhelo de establecer un pequeño espacio de ventas en casa.

loans.use: Establish a general store at home.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
.Five years ago Edgar decided to breed small animals for a living, especially guinea pigs as he saw the opportunity and the cost-effectiveness generated in many families as the meat is nutritious and delicious. In a short period of time his farm has grown and he faces great challenges for the future and has decided to expand the breeding space and buy more chickens and guinea pigs to start sales in other towns.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 5 años, Edgar, decidió dedicarse a la crianza de animales menores, principalmente de los cuyes por la oportunidad que observó en ellos y la rentabilidad que genera hoy en día a muchas familias, gracias a su nutritiva y deliciosa carne. En poco tiempo ha visto crecer su granja y tiene grandes retos para el futuro, ha decidido ampliar su espacio de crianza y comprar mayor cantidad de pollos y cuyes para iniciar la venta de los mismos en otras ciudades.

loans.use: Expand breeding space for chickens and guinea pigs.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina is a young lady with high ideals for success, she knows that to reach them is not easy and has decided to set her goals accordingly and therefore she is breeding guinea pigs and growing hydroponics. Her knowledge and success are the result of having studied for 5 years at a prestigious university center. She wishes to continue with the project of breeding guinea pigs on a large scale and has decided to move to her native town of Huancavelica to fulfill her purpose and continue growing hydroponics on a larger scale to feed the guinea pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Marina, es una joven con grandes ideales de éxito, ella sabe que para lograrlo no es fácil y ha decidido fijar sus metas en torno a ellas, por esa razón se dedica a la crianza de cuyes y también a los cultivos hidropónicos. Los conocimientos que hoy pone en práctica son producto de los 5 años de estudio en las aulas universitarias de un prestigioso centro de estudios y hoy están dando sus frutos. Ella esta deseosa por continuar con su proyecto de crianza de cuyes a gran escala y ha decidido mudar su centro de crianza a su ciudad natal Huancavelica para alcanzar su propósito y continuar con sus cultivos hidropónicos en mayor cantidad para la alimentación de los mismos.

loans.use: Increase capital to make breeding business grow.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 47517

loans.name: Diena

texts.es:
For the past 5 years Diena has been selling firewood for a living as she discovered a great opportunity in this business because an enormous number of families in her community uses this material as fuel to carry out their varied activities. She wishes to increase her work capital to improve her earnings and attend to her clients’ requests.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Diena, desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de leña, observó una gran oportunidad de negocio en esta actividad debido a que los centenares de familias de su comunidad utilizan este material como combustible para realizar sus diversas actividades. Desea incrementar su capital de trabajo para mejorar sus ganancias y atender cada uno de los requerimientos de sus clientes.

loans.use: Increase capital to improve service.

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es:
It is Lupe’s wish to give the best and necessary to her 3 young children so they may become successful members of their community and she will spare no effort to reach her goal with the support of her beloved husband. She uses her talent to make beautiful fabrics and produce lovely bedspreads to be sold at the mine where her husband works and at the same time she gets to visit him periodically. It is her dream project to install a space there and start to prepare and offer varied dishes of food to the hundreds of workers that leave all their strength behind carrying out their work in the mine.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Lupe, tiene el anhelo de ofrecerle lo mejor y necesario a sus 3 pequeños niños para que estos puedan desempeñarse con éxito dentro de su comunidad y no escatimará esfuerzos para lograrlo con ayuda de su amado esposo. Ella utiliza su talento para realizar bellos tejidos y producir hermosas colchas de cama a fin de ofertarlas en la mina en la que labora su esposo y a la vez visitarlo periódicamente. Tiene en mente el gran proyecto de instalarse en este espacio e iniciar a preparar diversos platillos para ofrecerlos a los centenares de trabajadores que día a día dejan toda su fuerza en el desempeño de esta labor.

loans.use: Increase capital to start new business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
Anita wishes to embark on a promising future and for that reason she left the city where she was born, Pampas, to dedicate herself to growing potatoes in the middle of her country. She arrived at Huancayo city a while ago and has been selling them there since. She has been able to position herself in the market and she wishes to increase her production and prepare her land now in order to have excellent harvest results.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Anita, tiene deseos de emprender un futuro prometedor y por esa razón abandonó su tierra natal Pampas para dedicarse al cultivo de papas en el centro de su país. Llegó a la ciudad de Huancayo hace mucho tiempo y desde este punto las comercializa. Ha logrado posicionarse en el mercado y desea mejorar su producción y preparar sus tierras de cultivo desde ahora a fin de obtener excelentes resultados.

loans.use: capital to increase her potato production

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is an entrepreneur from Kherson. She runs a business selling women’s clothing in the central market. Focused, committed, and known for her integrity, Irina carries an excellent reputation among both clients and entrepreneurs in her region. With her excellent work ethic, Irina has multiplied her turnover capital since she opened her business three years ago. She is now making about $2200 in net profit each month.

Currently, Irina is seeking a loan of 2500 Grivnas ($US525) to re-stock her inventory of seasonal clothing. With her additional income, she plans to continue supporting her family and develop her business. Irina is very responsible and orderly in everything she does. She can always handle competition with decency and honesty. We believe her business integrity as well as the previous 10 loans she has promptly repaid to Nadiya Ukraine characterize her as a client capable of current loan repayment.

loans.use: Purchase inventory and seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Vadim

texts.en:
Vadim is a businessman from Kherson who sells sports footwear in the central city market. Over the last 10 years, Vadim has successfully increased his business to establish a stable income. With rich market experience in the sphere of trade and an enterprising spirit, Vadim has expanded his business to build $2000 in inventory and to where he makes $300 in net profit each month.

Currently, Vadim is seeking a loan of 2500 Grivnas ($US525) to increase assorted merchandise. With the increased profits from additional sales, Vadim hopes to expand his business even further. Eventually he would love to invest additional profits in new business projects.

We believe Vadim’s disciplined, analytical approach, flexibility of thinking, innovative methods, stress resistance and great business aspirations will guarantee the consistent growth of his venture and success in all his entrepreneurial endeavors.

loans.use: Purchase assorted merchandise for his shoe sales.

loans.name: Cira

texts.es:
Cira works constantly, creating her own source of income through selling merchandise, including personal items such as: hairpins, combs, ponytail holders, etc. She sells the merchandise in the fairs (markets) two days a week - Wednesdays and Sundays in the city of Jauja. Her perseverance in her job has permitted her to support herself for 5 years. In addition, her job has provided her with much satisfication with the money that she has earned. She wants to improve her small stand in the fair and although she still works by walking around and selling her items, the loan will supply her with better merchandise for her small stand and will without a doubt, improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Cira trabaja constantemente creando su propia fuente de ingreso mediante la venta de mercería es decir de artículos personales como ganchos, peines, colets etc. en las ferias de los días miércoles y domingos en la ciudad de Jauja, su constancia en el trabajo que realiza le ha permitido mantenerse durante 5 años y además le ha otorgado muchas satisfacciones por la rentabilidad que le genera. Ella quiere mejorar su pequeño puesto en la feria y aunque aún labora de manera ambulante surtirá con mayor mercadería su pequeño espacio de ventas que sin duda mejorarán sus ventas.

loans.use: Increase work capital to offer a greater quantity of products

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda, strives every day working to earn the income necessary to support her three children. For this reason, she has small stand where she sells items in the dairy products market. She also sells her products in the fair in Jauja two days a week - Wednesdays and Sundays, which makes her very happy. In the future she would like to provide more of her products, making it necessary to purchase of a better breed of cow, which is capable of the production of milk in greater quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Nilda, se esfuerza cada día para lograr en su trabajo los resultados esperados es decir las ganancias que requiere para sostener a sus 3 hijos, por esta razón sale a vender en el pequeño espacio de ventas que mantiene en el mercado productos lácteos, también los oferta fuera de este espacio los días miércoles y domingos en la feria de Jauja por lo que ahora ella esta muy contenta. Desea a futuro ofertar sus productos en mayor número valiéndose de la compra de una raza mejorada de vacas capaz de proporcionarle leche en mayor cantidad.

loans.use: Purchase a better breed of cow.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia is a humble mother of a hard-working and perseverant family. The training that she obtained from her family heritage has turned her into a magnificent producer of cheeses, which has become an important source of income for her loving family. She has a dream to improve her cow's food and diet. Her cow is very important and provides her every day with the necessary and indispensible means to make her cheese and as a result, improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Sonia, es una humilde madre de familia trabajadora y empeñosa, el aprendizaje que obtuvo en la cuna familiar la ha convertido en una magnífica productora de quesos y se ha convertido en una fuente importante de financiamiento para los propósitos de su amada familia. Ella tiene el deseo de mejorar la alimentación de su vaca que le proporciona a diario el insumo necesario e indispensable para fabricar sus quesos y a través de el mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchased healthy food for her cow

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 47525

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa works tirelessly out of her own home washing clothes for a living, which allows her to provide the best to her loving family. Her 5 children are all of the motivation she needs to work so arduously. She washes clothes almost the entire day, taking only very short breaks to rest. Her good work and dedication have made her popular, resulting in a greater demand for her work. Rosa is asking for a loan that she will use for two purposes; one of which to be able to buy larger washing tubs and more detergent, and the other to contribute to the expenses to repair tools that her loving husband uses for his job.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Rosa, trabaja incansablemente en su propia casa ofreciendo el servicio de lavado de ropa y a través de el otorgarle lo mejor a su amada familia, sus 5 hijos son toda la motivación necesaria para su ardua tarea. Lava casi todo el día teniendo pausas muy cortas para descansar, su buen trabajo y dedicación le han otorgado popularidad y ahora tiene mayor demanda. Doña Rosa solicita un préstamo con dos fines, el de poder comprar tinas más grandes y detergente en mayor cantidad y a la vez contribuir con el gasto de reparación de la herramienta de trabajo de su amado esposo.

loans.use: Purchase of washing tubs and detergent.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 47526

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
Every morning, in the district of Chilca in Huancayo, everyone sees a humble woman of noble heart selling all types of vegetables that are of excellent quality, even for the most demanding homemaker. Aydee is in debt to keep her daily job at her small stall in the markets. She seeks a loan with the purpose of increasing the variety of products she sells as well as help her lovely children fulfill their dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

En un pequeño mercado del distrito de Chilca en Huancayo verán todas las mañanas a una humilde mujer de noble corazón vendiendo verduras de todo tipo y excelente calidad a las más exigentes reinas del hogar. Aydee se empeña para desempeñar su labor día a día en su pequeño puesto dentro del mercado. Solicita un préstamo con el propósito de incrementar la variedad de sus productos y así contribuir al cumplimiento de los sueños de sus amados hijos.

loans.use: to increase capital to offer more variety of vegetables

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 47527

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María is an example of great responsibility and limitless courage. She is the mother in a family that doesn’t let itself get knocked down by the painful moments that they must live through. María does diverse activities that allow her to support her home by means of manual jobs. Using quality wool whose beauty is incomparable, and as a final ingredient in her work, awards a nice finish. Her products are constantly improved to the point where she now has buyers who pay a reasonable price for them. María covers wholesale orders for her clients and she would like to produce her products in greater quantity.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Un ejemplo de gran responsabilidad y valor sin límites es María, una madre de familia que no se deja abatir a pesar de los dolorosos momentos que le tocaron vivir. Realiza diversas actividades que le permiten sostener su hogar mediante trabajos manuales utilizando lanas de calidad, la belleza incomparable y como ingrediente final de su labor otorgándole un buen acabado, sus productos han mejorado constantemente al punto que ahora tiene compradores que pagan un precio razonable por ellos, Maria cubre pedidos al por mayor de sus clientes y su deseo es producirlos en mayor cantidad.

loans.use: Increase capital in order to purchase a larger quantity of raw materials.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy works everyday with the sole purpose to forge a future for herself and her young 7 year old son. For 6 years, she has sold a line of junior women's clothing. For the perseverance she has demonstrated these years, she has established herself in a store where she presents her products in very presentable manner, as to secure sales. Nancy's dream is to become a clothing manufacturer. To reach her goal, she will prepare herself and knows that behind a dream lies great amount of effort and perseverance. For this, she seeks a loan to increase the amount of merchandise she offers for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Nancy trabaja día a día con el único propósito de forjarse un futuro para ella y en especial para su pequeño hijo de 7 años. Hace 6 años oferta prendas de vestir para dama de la línea juvenil por la constancia que ha demostrado durante todo este tiempo se ha establecido en un local comercial donde ofrece sus prendas con mejor presentación que aseguran sus ventas, el sueño de Nancy es convertirse en fabricante de prendas de vestir, para alcanzar este propósito se capacitará y sabe que tras un sueño está una gran cuota de esfuerzo y constancia por lo que hoy acude a solicitar un préstamo a fin de incrementar la mercadería que oferta.

loans.use: to increase capital to offer greater amounts of clothing

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
The beautiful, high quality embroidered pieces give testimony to Blanca's efforts. Spending long hours in a space she set up in her house, she embroiders the pieces she will later sell to her customers, enabling her to earn the necessary income to help her family. With her goal of constructing her own home one day, she is requesting a loan so that she can increase her production and her earnings.

Los resultados y los bellos trabajos de calidad de Blanca dan testimonio de la ardua labor que ella realiza en su casa con el propósito de ofrecerle el sustento necesario para el cumplimiento de sus objetivos a su amada familia, en un espacio de su hogar permanece largas horas bordando y adornando con bellos colores los fustanes que luego ha de vender a sus clientes.
