Con el anhelo de construir su morada propia solicita un préstamo a fin de incrementar su producción y ganancias para llegar a cumplir su meta.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HER EMBROIDERY BUSINESS AND INCREASE HER EARNINGS.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha's perseverance and effort have served her well, so she can continue staying in control of her house through her separation from her husband. She confronted this great challenge by opening a store in which she offers bread, which has brought her successful results for her household finances. Thanks to the good location of her store, her portfolio of customers has increased, and she hopes to increase her working capital to attend to each one of the orders of her neighbors and friends.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Su constancia y esfuerzo le han servido a Martha, para continuar llevdo las riendas de su hogar tras la separación de su esposo. Afrontó este gran reto abriendo una tienda en el que oferta productos de pan llevar que le ha traído resultados exitosos en bien de su economía familiar.Gracias a la buena ubicación de su tiendita la cartera de sus clientes va en aumento y desea incrementar su capital de trabajo para atender cada una de las solicitudes de sus vecinos y amigos.

loans.use: Increase in capital to offer a larger quantity of products.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela is a very hard-working woman who took the reins of her home when her husband passed away. She makes a living by selling various items on the weekends in Sunday markets in her city. Above all, she strives daily to make coats and beautiful sweaters for her customers. Her weavings are known for their quality and excellent finish: in a short time, her effort has made her one of the most well-known weavers of the community.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Adela, es una mujer muy trabajadora que tomó las riendas de su hogar cuando falleció su esposo. Se dedica a comercializar diversos artículos los fines de semana en las ferias dominicales de su ciudad pero sobre todo se esfuerza diariamente por elaborar abrigadoras y bellas chompas par sus clientes.Sus tejidos son reconocidos por su calidad y excelentes acabados: en poco tiempo su esfuerzo la ha convertido en una de las damas tejedoras más reconocidas de su comunidad.

loans.use: Increase in capital to continue with the developing of her activities for the benefit of her family

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene is a hardworking mother. Her desire to improve the quality of life for her family led her to start a business selling backpacks and suitcases to the people in her small town. She got the idea when somebody she knew who made the suitcases offered her a small number of them to offer to her friends. Now three years have passed and business is going well. In the future, she would like to produce her own backpacks and suitcases, so she is requesting a loan so that she can grow her small business and increase her earnings.

Doña Irene, es una mujer luchadora y esforzada, sus deseos de superación la han llevado a desempeñarse efectivamente en el negocio de venta de mochilas escolares y maletines para las personas que habitan su pequeño pueblito. Esta idea comenzó cuando uno de sus familiares que fabrica estos artículos le ofreció una pequeña cantidad de estos para ofertarlos entre sus amigos y hoy han transcurrido 3 años de satisfacción. A futuro piensa tener su propia fábrica de mochilas y maletines, mientras tanto seguirá abasteciéndose de mercadería para lo cual solicita un crédito a fin de seguir desarrollando su labor.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INVEST IN MORE VARIETY OF BACKPACKS AND SUITCASES TO SELL TO HER CUSTOMERS.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad started raising guinea pig at home as a means for further familial development. She has been doing this for a couple of years and wishes to continue this activity, for she has become impassioned by it. For this reason, she would like to improve space for her mischievous dwellers and a balanced diet for them.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Soledad, como iniciativa de desarrollo familiar ha iniciado la labor de crianza de cuyes en casa hace un par de años, desea seguir manteniendo esta ocupación que ha legado a apasionarla y por esa razón desea mejorar su espacio de crianza y el alimento de sus traviesos inquilinos.

loans.use: improve space and provide a balanced diet for her guinea pigs

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 47534

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda has become a mother recently, and due to the concern of increasing her income to be able to support her home better, she decided to start selling prestigious brands of cosmetics around her city and among her friends. She hopes to continue this work, and through it, to offer well-being to her beloved baby.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Hilda, se ha convertido en madre recientemente y ante la preocupación de incrementar sus ingresos para mantener mucho mejor su hogar ha decidido incursionar en la venta de artículos cosméticos de las prestigiosas marcas por los alrededores de su ciudad y entre sus amistades.Desea continuar con esta labor y a través de ella otorgarle bienestar a su amado bebé.

loans.use: Increase in capital to offer a better quantity of products

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia has put into practice what she learned in a class on basic industry, where they taught how to produce all kinds of sweets including marmalades. She offers consulting services on this production in a dairy, and she also prepares marmalades in her house to sell to her neighbors and to people whom she knows. With the growing demand, she is requesting a loan to be able to purchase the ingredients she needs.

Delia puso en práctica lo que una vez aprendió en su periodo de capacitación en un curso de industrias alimentarias, en el le enseñaron a fabricar todo tipo de dulces y aprendió también a elaborar toda clase mermeladas, a raíz de este hecho ofrece servicios de asesoría para su fabricación en una planta lechera y también prepara en casa estas mermeladas y las ofrece a sus vecinos y personas conocidas. Ante la demanda que ha ido albergando solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos para su preparación.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE INGREDIENTS NEEDED TO MAKE HER MARMALADES, WHICH SHE SELLS TO HER NEIGHBORS AND TO PEOPLE WHOM SHE KNOWS.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Lalis

texts.es:
Lalis offers various items in small quantities in accordance with the dates and seasons of celebration of one or another large event. She has two small school-aged children who have become her best partners and her main motive for her daily effort. They have in mind to establish a sales space in their home so they can offer their beautiful items with better comfort in this space.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Lalis, oferta diversos artículos en pequeña cantidad de acuerdo a la fecha y a las temporadas de celebración de uno u otro acontecimiento masivo. Tiene dos pequeños niños en edad escolar que se han convertido en sus mejores socios y en su principal motivo de esfuerzo diario.Tienen en mente establecer un espacio de ventas en casa para que desde este lugar oferte con mayor comodidad sus bellos artículos.

loans.use: Establishment of a sales space in her home

loans.name: Ludomila

texts.es:
Keeping her family united and happy is what motivates Ludomilia to work so hard every day. An enterprising woman, she and her husband take advantage of the local markets in Huancayo to sell all kinds of utensils for the kitchen at reasonable prices. Her goal is to one day have their own shop, and until then, she will continue working hard to make her goal a reality.

Mantener a su familia unida y en completa alegría es lo que sostiene los esfuerzos y el trabajo diario de Ludomilia, una mujer emprendedora que aprovecha las ferias dominicales de Huancayo para que junto a su esposo venda la mayor cantidad posible de artículos para implementar el espacio dedicado en los hogares a la preparación de alimentos, la cocina, es así que ella oferta estos artículos a precios accesibles. Su meta es poder establecerse en un local comercial y mientras tanto seguiráEsforzándose para convertir este anhelo en realidad.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HER BUSINESS AND HAVE A GREATER SELECTION  OF COOKING UTENSILS TO SELL.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Every day Doña Dolores lets her demanding customers taste delicious dishes from their beautiful region and this fills her with satisfaction. The decision to open a restaurant two years ago in her own home on the advice of her neighbors was the best decision and today she has enjoyed a wonderful reception from hundreds of people. She is happy because her business has allowed her to support her youngest son, 15 years old, to reach his goals and future desires. She would like to continue her work and for this goal she requests a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Todos los días Doña Dolores hace degustar a su exigente clientela ricos platillos de su bella región y esto la llena de satisfacción. Haber decidido hace 2 años abrir un restaurante en su propia casa por consejo de sus vecinos fue su mejor decisión y actualmente goza de la gran acogida de centenares de personas. Está contenta porque este negocio le ha permitido apoyar a su ultimo hijo de 15 años a alcanzar sus metas y próximos anhelos.Desea continuar con su labor y para este fin solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase capital in order to expand and improve her restaurant.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 47539

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Doña Hermelinda is a supportive and enthusiastic woman. For many years, she has dedicated herself to working in different trades, and together with her husband, she chose to make a living by selling hardware items more than a year ago. At first they sold these items out of their home, but afterwards, they decided to sell by traveling to the different markets in their community. All of their effort is concentrated on making their youngest son, who is 17, able to gain admittance to college, which is why they are saving. Her wish is to implement her business and to increase the items that she offers, which is what drove her to request a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Hermelinda es una mujer solidaria y muy entusiasta, durante muchos años se ha dedicado a laborar en diferentes rubros y junto a su esposo escogió hace más de un año dedicarse a la venta de artículos de ferretería que al inicio los ofertaba desde su casa, pero después decidieron vender de manera ambulante en las ferias de su localidad.Todo su esfuerzo está concentrado en hacer que su hijo menor de 17 años acceda a formarse en un centro de educación superior para lo cual ahora está ahorrando. Su deseo de implementar su negocio e incrementar los artículos que ofrece la conducen a solicitar un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase in capital to offer a larger quantity of items

loans.name: Betzabe

texts.es:
After the separation from her husband 10 years ago, Betzabe has constantly fought to fulfill the roles of both mother and father to her children. Her desire to succeed has inspired her to create hand-knitted items according to meet the high number of orders she receives. She wishes to continue with this work which benefits her beloved family and she is asking for a loan to acquire a great quantity of wool in order to continue making her beautiful articles of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Tras la separación de su esposo hace 10 años Betzabe ha luchado constantemente para desempeñar los papeles de padre y madre para sus hijos. Los deseos de seguir adelante la animaron a realizar trabajos de tejido a mano de acuerdo a los pedidos que ahora alberga y en mayor número.Desea continuar con esta labor en beneficio de su amada familia y solicita un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de lana para seguir con la confección de sus bellas prendas.

loans.use: Purchase a great quanity of wool

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Doña Luz has perseverance and for that reason after several years of having a store in her small home she has decided to remodel and repair it. During our visit we found her finishing the final details to once again reopen her store with better and a greater number of products compared to what she sold before. She is asking for a loan to finish this great goal and soon fill the display cases with new products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Luz, es una persona perseverante por esa razón tras varios años D. tener su tienda en su pequeña casa ha decidido refraccionarla y repararla. En nuestra visita la encontramos ultimando los detalles para implementar nuevamente su tienda y reabrirla con mejores y mayores productos que las que antes ofertaba. Solicita un préstamo para culminar con esta gran meta y pronto llenar las vitrinas con novedosos productos.

loans.use: Increase working capital in order to buy a great quantity of items for her store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Sintia

texts.es:
Sintia is a pregnant young mother due to give birth and this little baby is inspiring her to work even more. She earns an income by raising chickens and guinea pigs, and she has noticed that selling chickens is very profitable and enable her to quickly earn income. Therefore she has decided to install a bigger coop with improved quality so she needs a loan that will enable her to complete this business proposition.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Sintia, es una joven madre en espera de su pequeño que ha de nacer y esa dulce espera le motiva a trabajar aún más. Se dedica al cuidado de pollos y cuyes que le sirven de sustento, tras observar que la venta de pollos es un negocio rentable que le permite obtener las ganancias de manera rápida ha decidido instalar una granja más grande y mejorada con los estándares de calidad que se exige, por esa razón solicita un préstamo que le permita llevar a cabo este propósito.

loans.use: Purchase a large quantity of chickens

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia is a decisive woman: Having observed her neighbors’ needs to enjoy sandwiches away from home at night, she decided to buy a small cooking cart and sell from the door of her home. She has worked hard in this role for two years and has been able to provide a lot of satisfaction. .

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Celia,| es una mujer decidida; luego de haber observado la necesidad de sus vecinos por degustar de algún bocadillo fuera de casa por la noche , decidió comprarse un carrito sanguchero y vender en la puerta de su casa. Lleva dos años desempeñándose en esta labor y ha podido albergar muchas satisfacciones.

loans.use: Capital to improve her selling conditions.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is a born farmer. For many years, she has been tied to farm work and since 10 years of age, she has done so independently. She now has her own cows and bulls, which she fattens and sells in her local cattle market and from which she earns the necessary income to support her two children who are in school. She also owns fields in which she sows potatoes and maize, among other vegetables. Her desire to improve her cattle activities has driven her to request a loan so that she may acquire a greater quantity of balanced feed for her bulls and cows.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth, es agricultora de nacimiento, desde hace muchos años ha estado ligada a las tareas agrícolas y desde hace 10 años lo hace de manera independiente y tiene ahora sus propias vacas y toros a los que engorda y vende en la feria local ganadera y de los cuales obtiene las ganancias necesarias para poder sostener a sus 2 hijos que están estudiando. También tiene sus terrenos de cultivo en los que siembra papa y maíz entre otros vegetales. Su deseo de mejorar su actividad ganadera la conducen a solicitar un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de alimento balanceado apara sus toros y vacas.

loans.use: Purchase balanced food.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #47545

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Over the years, ClotilD. has worked hard to obtain what she always longed for: to have a tight family and solid financial base. For this reason, on a daily basis, she applies the teachings that she learned as a girl from her beloved parents. She is devoted to the raising of animals and, thanks to her hard work, she has continued to be able to improve their living conditions and the breed of her animals. She wishes for a loan in order to acquire a greater quantity of balanced food and to improve her stable. .

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Durante años Doña ClotilD., se ha esforzado por conseguir lo que siempre ha anhelado, tener una familia muy unida y una sólida economía; por esa razón aplica a diario las enseñanzas que aprendió desD. niña D. sus amados padres.Se dedica a la actividad ganadera y gracias a su desempeño continuo ha podido mejorar sus condiciones D. crianza y la raza D. sus animalitos. Desea un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad D. alimento balanceado y para mejorar su establo.

loans.use: Purchase balanced food.

loans.name: Mapato Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Alex O. is a young Kenyan father, aged 30 with 6 children. He also lives with 2 orphan children of his late sister who perished 2 years ago.

Alex started his business 3 years ago after accumulating savings from his former work place. He currently operates a small posho mill (maize grinder) in the neighborhood. He also stocks maize, which he sells to his customers who want to buy and grind it.

With the little profit that he gets from the business, Alex still struggles to feed, clothe, and educate his children and to pay his rent. With the help of his loan, Alex will be able to expand his business by purchasing maize in bulk and to increase his monthly sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase maize in bulk, for his posho mill (maize grinder)

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is a young woman with many overcoming wishes. She is an entrepreneur and this quality has allowed her to live comfortably and support herself. She has opted to devote herself to rearing of animals. At the same time, she is preparing to become a successful professional. She wishes to improve the rearing conditions in her small stable and for this reason, she is requesting a loan. .

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth, es una joven con muchos deseos D. superación, es emprendedora y esa cualidad le permite vivir cómodamente y auto sostenerse, ha optado por dedicarse a L. ganadería y a L. vez se está preparando para convertirse en una profesional D. éxito. Desea mejorar las condiciones D. crianza en su pequeño establo y a esa razón atienD. su petición.

loans.use: Improve the conditions in her small stable.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
Segundina is a hard-working person and over many years, this has allowed her to earn enough income to support her four children. She is devoted to the raising of animals, especially cows which she buys and sells in her local market. In this manner, she obtains the income that she needs. Her wish is to improve the food for her cows and bulls by cultivating more forage for which she is requesting a loan. .

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Segundina, es una persona muy empeñosa y durante muchos años esto le ha permitido obtener ingresos suficientes para sostener a sus 4 hijos. Se dedica a la crianza de animales ye en especial de vacas ya que las compra y las vende en la feria de su localidad y de esa manera consigue las ganancias que necesita, su deseo es mejorar la alimentación de sus vacas y toros, para este fin cultivará más forraje y es por ello que solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Planting of forage to feed her animals.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda has worked in the agricultural field since she was young. Her parents instilled in her the value of hard work which she demonstrates today. She buys and sells goats and, in this manner, earns income for her family. She does not have a lot of confidence in the agricultural production of their fields because of strong cold waves which have several times seriously damaged the land. So she has now opted to devote her time to raising animals. She uses her land now only to produce food for herself and her animals. Currently, Hermelinda lives with the youngest of her children, who is 19 years old and studies at university. She hopes to improve the rearing conditions of her young animals and for this reason is seeking a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Hermelinda, trabaja en las labores agrícolas desde su niñez, sus padres inculcaron en ella el trabajo esforzado que hoy da testimonio de su ardua labor, se dedica a la compra y venta de carneros y de esa manera obtiene los ingresos económicos para su familia, ella no confía mucho en la producción agrícola de sus campos porque las fuertes olas de frío han perjudicado seriamente y en varias oportunidades sus tierras de cultivo por lo que ahora ha optado por dedicarse netamente a la actividad ganadera y solo sus campos de cultivo le sirven para consumo propio y cultivo de forraje para la alimentación de sus animales. En la actualidad vive con el menor de sus hijos que tiene 19 años y estudia en la universidad. Desea mejorar las condiciones de crianza de sus animalitos y a esa razón atiende su petición de un préstamo.

loans.use: Improve the rearing conditions of her animals.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee is a woman who works a lot in order to achieve improvements in her life. She decided to live in the land of her parents (and her childhood home) and is trying to reconstruct it better for her children. Actually, she is dedicated to the work of growing fodder in order to grow food for her animals. She also grows potatoes,barley, wheat, corn, and vicias (a food especially for animals.) The fodder that seh grows is used to feed hogs and rabbits. She is requesting a loan to better improve her conditions of growing her products and for growing fodder for her animals.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

Haydee, es una mujer de mucho trabajo para lograr mejoras en su vida, ha decidido vivir en la tierra de sus padres y de ella misma con muchos esfuerzo construir un futuro mejor para sus hijos.Actualmente se dedica al cultivo de forraje para el alimento de sus animales, también cultiva papa, cebada, trigo, maíz y vicias (un tipo de forraje especial para sus animales). El forraje que ella cultiva le sirve apara alimentar a los cerdos, cuyes y conejos.La solicitud de un préstamo es para mejorar las condiciones de siembra de sus productos y también del forraje para sus animalitos.

loans.use: To buy Seeds

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel is a young mother who strives to provide the best she can for her family. She has been farmer since childhood and comes from a family that has had great success in agriculture. This is the livelihood that has allowed her to live independently. She has dedicated herself for the past 5 years to the cultivating of maiz, potato and wheat. At the end of the harvest, she sells her goods direct to consumers in the marketplace of her city. The loan she is requesting will be used for the purchase seeds, fertilizer and to rent a tractor to prepare her farmland for the next growing season.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Raquel, es una joven madre de familia, que se esfuerza por lograr obtener los mejores ingresos para su familia, ella es agricultora desde muy niña, ya que su familia es cuna de famosos agricultores y esta es la fuente de ingreso que le permite vivir de manera independiente. Ella lleva 5 años dedicándose al cultivo de maíz, papa y trigo. Al término de la cosecha los oferta directamente en el mercado de su ciudad.Su solicitud atiende al deseo de adquirir mayor cantidad de semillas, abonos y para alquiler un tractor a fin de preparar sus tierras para la próxima siembra.

loans.use:
Purchase seeds, fertilizer and to rent a tractor.

Compra de semillas abonos y alquiler de un tractor.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is very hard working and the physical strength required for her day-to day activities is very intense. She is a farmer and also raises pigs & cows. She does this with her husband's help every day. Currently the lack of rain is threatening her crops. Her crops are slowly drying and dying. She sells her goods in the city. As a way to avoid any more losses, she hopes to get more pigs in order to maintain her financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa es muy trabajadora y el esfuerzo físico que demanda su actividad día a día es muy intenso. Ella es agricultora y también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y vacas, en compañía de su esposo cuida a diario de sus animalitos y sus campos de cultivo y pesar de que en la actualidad la escasez de lluvias está perjudicando seriamente las plantaciones, ya que se están secando los sembríos, continúa dedicándose a esta conocida labor en el centro de su país.Para evitar pérdidas cuantiosas y un posible déficit económico desea adquirir mayor cantidad de cerditos y mejorar las condiciones de sus plantaciones de vegetales.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs

loans.name: Noemy

texts.es:
Noemy is a hard-working woman. The love of a mother makes her work very hard in the planting of seeds and the sell of alfalfa, food for the animals, etc. She gets the help of her mother, she helps her on a daily basis. At the start of the day she cultivates the goods and sells them as a wholesale. She hopes to establish another of these businesses and improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Noemy es una mujer muy empeñosa, y el amor de madre la impulsa a trabajar incansablemente en la siembra y venta de alfalfa, pastos para los animales, en compañía de su amada madre emprende este trabajo a diario.Al iniciar el día presurosa los recorta de sus campos de cultivo para venderlos al por mayor, desea establecer este negocio para hincar otro a fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de su amada familia.

loans.use: Increase of her materials to improve her farm

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
The years of work that Yovana has put in have helped her to adapt and to successfully launch her business. She makes delicious juices at a stand in the market near the center of the city and from this location serves her entire community. The good service that she provides has enabled her to increase her customers that enjoy her delicious juices. For this reason she is now thinking of improving her sales stand and is placing her request for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Los años de trabajo de Yovana la han ayudado a adaptarse y emprender un negocio con éxito. Se dedica a preparar exquisitos jugos en un puesto dentro del mercado cerca de la zona central de la ciudad y desde aquí presta sus servicios a su comunidad entera; la buena atención que brinda le ha permitido incrementar su clientela que disfruta de sus deliciosos jugos es por ello que ahora está pensando en implementar su puesto de ventas y a esta razón atiende su solicitud.

loans.use: Improve her small sales stand.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz is a very enterprising woman and has a beautiful personality, a quality that helps her to win over her customers. The ability to be convincing in her sales has helped Luz very much as she goes out daily selling her various lines of cosmetics, and later collecting installments of her revenues. She is always motivated in her work due to the great love that she has for her children who are in school. Her husband also works but many times the income is low and with the work that Luz performs their financial condition has greatly improved. To continue moving forward, Luz is requesting a loan to invest in purchasing wholesale cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Luz, es una mujer muy emprendedora y de un hermoso carácter y precisamente esta cualidad le brinda ayuda para conquistar a sus clientas, ese poder de convencimiento para obtener las ventas le favorece bastante a Luz que diariamente sale a ofrecer sus cosméticos de las diferentes líneas de belleza, luego va a cobrar por partes lo que vende, siempre está motivada a realizar su trabajo por el inmenso amor que tiene hacia sus hijos que están estudiando, su esposo también trabaja pero muchas veces los ingresos son bajos y con el trabajo de Luz la economía de su casa ha mejorado mucho.Para seguir adelante Luz está solicitando un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de cosméticos al por mayor.

loans.use: Increase of capital to purchase a larger quantity of cosmetics

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Mrs. Irene wishes very much to continue to work and is very young at heart. She takes care of her grocery store daily and through her daily efforts can achieve her own support and also has the satisfaction of providing the support for her five children. Her wish to improve her store and this way be able to increase her income is what is motivating her to seek this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Irene, tiene muchos deseos de continuar trabajando y lleva la juventud dentro de su corazón. Ella atiende diariamente su bodega y con su labor diaria puede conseguir su auto sustento, ya que tiene la satisfacción de ser el sustento de sus 5 hijos. Su deseo de mejorar su tienda para así poder incrementar sus ganancias la conducen a solicitar un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of a larger quantity of products.

loans.name: Anace

texts.es:
Anace is a young mother of a family who is very determined and hard working. She has not been satisfied with only fulfilling her role as housewife, her wishes to improve her financial condition and channel the development of her family motivated her to open a store in her own home. This allows her to be close to her 2 children and take care of them. She is now happy with her decision because she enjoys attending to her customers. She wishes to improve her store and supply it with more products and precisely for this reason she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Anace, es una joven madre de familia muy empeñosa y laboriosa ella no se ha conformado con desempeñarse sólo como ama de casa pues sus deseos de mejorar su situación económica y encauzar su desarrollo familiar la motivaron a abrir una tienda en su propia casa que le permite poder estar al tanto de sus 2 hijos sin descuidarlos y ahora está satisfecha de esta decisión tomada porque ella disfruta atender a su clientes. Desea mejorar su tienda e implementarla con más artículos y precisamente a este anhelo atiende su petición de un préstamo.

loans.use: Stocking her small grocery store.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is a diligent young lady of 26 years of age. Her major wish is to become a professional and through effort and dedication she is at a point of realizing her dream. She is currently studying civil engineering in a private university in the city of Juliaca. Thanks to the support of her parents and the income that she receives from her business of selling clothing and shoes, she can cover the expenses of her education.

This hard working young woman gets her products in the city of Tacna, and sells them every two weeks in the district of Pinaya, a little town far away from her home in Santa Lucia. Since she is in the tenth cycle of her professional studies her expenses have increased substantially and that is why she wants to acquire more merchandise to increase her sales. Yolanda is sure that this investment will improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Yolanda, es una diligente joven de 26 años de edad. Su mayor deseo es ser profesional y con esfuerzo y dedicación está a punto de concretar su sueño; actualmente estudia Ing. Civil en una universidad privada de la ciudad de Juliaca , gracias al apoyo de sus padres y a las ganancias que obtiene con su negocio de venta de ropa y calzados puede cubrir sus gastos de educación.

Esta laboriosa joven adquiere su mercadería en la ciudad de Tacna y los oferta quincenalmente en el distrito de Pinaya, pueblito muy lejano de su natal Santa Lucia. Ahora que ya cursa el X ciclo de su carrera profesional aumentó sustancialmente sus egresos, es por ello que tiene pensado adquirir mayor mercadería para incrementar sus ventas, Yolanda está segura que esta inversión mejorará sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: Increase of capital in order to purchase a larger quantity of shoes.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura is a young and responsible mother, 22 years old. Since she started her family, she has been devoted to her family and is prepared to give the best of herself so they can get ahead. That's why she decided to dedicate herself to selling electronics and small appliances in the Pinaya district, a little town far away from her home city of Santa Lucia. With this business, she is managing to keep up her household, and at the same time support her husband with his higher education expenses. Currently, they are living with her in-laws, and she hopes to build her own home to provide their own safe roof for their three-year-old little boy, Franco.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Laura, es una joven y responsable madre de 22 años de edad. Desde que formó su hogar siempre estuvo consagrada a su familia y presta a dar lo mejor de sí para seguir adelante, es por ello que ha decidido dedicarse a la venta de artefactos en el distrito de Pinaya, pueblito muy lejano de su ciudad natal, Santa Lucia. Con este negocio está logrando sostener su hogar y al mismo tiempo apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su educación superior.Actualmente viven en el domicilio de sus suegros, y tiene la esperanza de construir pronto su propia morada para ofrecerle un techo propio y seguro a su pequeño niño Franco de 3 añitos de edad.

loans.use: Increase cash to increase the supply of her products

loans.name: Matungu Photographers Shining Group

texts.en:
Mathias Ang’eti is a young Kenyan father, aged 42 with 4 children. He also lives with 2 orphan children of his late sister who perished 2 years ago.

Mathias started his business 3 years ago after accumulating savings from his former work place. He currently operates a small retail cereal stall, but would like to expand his business and start operating a wholesale cereals unit. Being the primary bread winner for his family, it would enable him to support both his children and his wife, who has a low-paying job. With the little profit that he gets from the business, Mathias still struggles to feed, clothe, and educate his children and to pay his house rent. With the help of his loan, Mathias will be able to purchase more cereals to increase his business sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase assorted cereals

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Her desire to help support her 4 children become successful professionals has pushed Mrs. Marta and her husband to put all their effort in their daily jobs. She worked selling food on the street in the main square in her hometown of Santa Lucia for several years. After she saved some money she opened her own grocery store, and with these two jobs and her husband’s income (he works as a driver) they have been able not only to cover their daily expenses, but also to send their kids to study in a prestigious university in the area of Puno. Marta wishes to increase her stock and the variety of products in her store, which is widely accepted by numerous people.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

El afán de colaborar para que se conviertan en profesionales de éxito sus 4 queridos hijos es el motivo suficiente de doña Marta y su esposo para esforzarse y canalizar lo mejor de sí en sus respectivas actividades. Esta diligente madre, durante muchos años estuvo dedicada a la venta de comida en forma ambulatoria en la plaza de armas de su pueblito natal Santa Lucia, luego de ahorrar pudo abrir e implementar su tiendita de abarrotes, con estas 2 actividades y con el trabajo de su esposo como chofer están logrando cubrir los gastos de su hogar y sobre todo la educación de sus hijos, quienes muy orgullosamente estudian en una prestigiosa Universidad del departamento de Puno.El deseo de Marta es aumentar el stock y variedad de su mercadería, debido a que goza de la aceptación de muchas personas.

loans.use: To increase her working capital so that she can offer more products in her store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
In the Panamericana Sur road, divison of Santa Lucia she has a small sweets and soda stand. Doña Elizabeth, who began this business three years ago, thanks her sister for all her guidance.

Elizabeth begins her job at 8:00am every morning and ends at 6:00pm. Thanks to the benefits he gets from this job she is able to help offer financial help to her elderly family members and younger siblings. She helps them with home expenses. At this moment she wishes to receive a credit in order to increase quantity of her products and earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

En la carretera Panamericana Sur, precisamente en el desvió Santa Lucia, tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de golosinas y bebidas gaseosas Doña Elizabeth, quien emprendió este negocio hace 3 años, gracias a la iniciativa de su hermana mayor.Elizabeth empieza su trabajo a las 8 de la mañana para culminar a las 6 de la tarde, gracias a los beneficios que obtiene con este negocio apoya a sus ancianos padres y menores hermanos con los gastos de su hogar, en esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de productos a fin de incrementar sus ganacias.

loans.use: Incremento de capital para ofertar mayor cantidad de dulces.

loans.name: Emakina Self-Help Group

texts.en:
George O. is a young Kenyan father aged 30 with 2 children. He also lives with 1 orphan child of his late brother who perished 2 years ago.

George started his business 3 years ago after accumulating savings from his former work place in a local petrol station in Busia town. He currently deals in men’s second-hand shoes but would like to diversify to children's and ladies' collections as well.

Being the bread winner for his family, it would enable him to support his family better. With the little profit that he gets from the business, George is still able to provide his family the basic needs of life. With the help of his loan, George will be able to purchase more second-hand shoes to enable him boost his business sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase shoes in bulk

loans.name: Faraja Youth Group

texts.en:
Dancan M. is a young Kenyan father aged 30 with 4 children. He also lives with 1 orphan child of his late sister who perished 2 years ago.

Dancan started his business 3 years ago after accumulating savings from his former work place. He currently operates a small posho mill (cereal grinding mill) but would like to diversify into selling cereals like maize and wheat, along with running the posho mill.

Being the primary bread winner for his family, it would enable him to support both his children and wife, who has a low-paying job. With the little profit that he gets from the business, Dancan still struggles to feed, clothe, and educate his children and to pay his house rent. But with the help of his loan, Dancan will be able to expand his business and increase his monthly sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is a mother who recently suffered the painful loss of her beloved husband. Since then, she has been both father and mother for her four kids. Through tenacity and scarcity, she has opened a small bookstore in a strategic location in her hometown, Santa Lucia. Due to health problems, though, it remains shut for now. Elizabeth is currently living with her children in a rental space that they are adapting to become the new location for the book store. This mothers dream is to build her own home, a safe and suitable place to provide for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth, es una madre que hace poco sufrió la penosa pérdida de su amado esposo, desde entonces se ha convertido en padre y madre de sus 4 retoños, con mucho empeño y privaciones ha implementado su pequeña librería en un lugar estratégico de su pueblito natal, Santa Lucia, pero por problemas de salud actualmente permanece cerrada. Elizabeth en este momento vive junto a sus hijos en una vivienda alquilada, lugar donde está adecuando un espacio para trasladar su librería a este espacio. El deseo de esta madre es construir su propia morada, lugar seguro y apropiado que desea brindar a sus hijos.

loans.use: Injection of cash to finish moving their tiny source of income, their bookstore,  to a new space

loans.name: Kenda Kaala Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Evelyn A. is a young Kenyan woman aged 30 with 3 children. She also lives with 2 orphan children of her late brother who perished 2 years ago.

Evelyn started her business 3 years ago after accumulating savings from her former work place. She currently operates a small retail shop in the neighborhood where she resides with her family, located in Busia district. She would like to expand her business and start operating a wholesale shop. As she is the primary bread winner for her family, it would enable her to support both her children and her husband, who has a low-paying job. With the little profit that she gets from the business, Evelyn still struggles to feed, clothe, and educate her children and to pay her house rent. With the help of her loan, Evelyn will be able to increase her shop's stock to enable her to boost her monthly sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To increase her shop's stock

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Angélica is a native of the department of Ica; for family reasons, she moved to the little town of Santa Lucia in Puno 27 years ago, and since she set up her household, she has devoted herself to innumerable activities to earn her own income. One of these was the sale of electric appliances, but unfortunately, she suffered a break-in. Since then she has worked at selling fruit juices, while her hard-working husband, Valerio, works as a laborer for the mining operation San Rafael. A couple months ago, Angélica had an operation, which is why she had to stop working at her business. But now she finds herself eager to retake the reins of her business, and with her earnings, build her own little home.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Angélica, es natural del departamento de Ica, por situaciones familiares hace 27 años radica en el pueblito de Santa Lucia – Puno y desde que formó su hogar se dedicó a innumerables actividades para generar sus propios ingresos económicos, una de ellas fue la venta de artefactos eléctricos, desafortunadamente sufrió un robo, desde entonces se dedica a la venta de jugo de frutas, mientras que su laborioso esposo, Valerio, trabaja como obrero en la empresa minera San Rafael.Hace un par de meses doña Angélica fue operada, es por ello que dejó de dedicarse a su negocio, pero en estos momentos se encuentra deseosa de retomar las riendas de su actividad y así con las ganancias concretar su anhelo de construir su propia casita.

loans.use: Injection of cash to get her juice stand started up again

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is a 21 year-old woman who at her young age is already the mother of four young children. These kids have become her main motivation for effort, work, and constancy. As her family has grown, things have begun to change and her expenses have increased. For this reason Elizabeth, along with her hard-working husband, have dedicated themselves to diverse activities in order to generate more income. Currently Elizabeth works as an artesan, weaving beautiful garments. After collecting a large quantity she sends them to be sold in the city of Lima for a higher price. Elizabeth’s husband works in skilled construction.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Elizabeth, es una joven de solo 21 años, a su corta edad ya es madre de 4 pequeños niños que se han convertido en su principal razón de esfuerzo, trabajo y constancia; conforme iban llegando más miembros a su hogar las cosas fueron cambiando y los gastos se incrementaron, es por ello que junto a su laborioso esposo se dedicaron a diversas actividades para generar mayores ingresos.Actualmente Elizabeth se desenvuelve como artesana, tejiendo hermosas prendas de vestir, luego de reunir una buena cantidad los despacha para ser vendidas a un precio más rentable en la ciudad de Lima, mientras su esposo labora como maestro de construcción.

loans.use: To increase capital in order to increase production

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Weaving has always been the principle occupation of Rebeca’s parents, and Rebeca herself is not a stranger to this beautiful work. With great patience, diligence and enthusiasm she goes about producing each one of her beautiful garments, which are then sent in large numbers to the city of Lima, Peru to be sold. Thanks to beautiful designs and finishing touches, Rebeca’s pretty garments are very sought after in the market, and for that reason Rebeca is thinking of purchasing another weaving machine and contracting employees in order to increase the volume of her production. With your help and your good will this hard-working mother will be able to put her plans into action and improve the quality of life for her two young children.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

El tejido siempre fue el oficio principal de los padres de Rebeca y ella no es ajena a este bello trabajo que con suma paciencia, diligencia y entusiasmo viene realizando y produciendo cada una de sus hermosas prendas de vestir que luego son enviadas en gran número a la ciudad de Lima para su comercialización. Gracias a los bellos diseños y a los finos acabados sus hermosas prendas de vestir son muy solicitadas en el mercado, es por ello que Rebeca tiene pensado comprar otra máquina te tejer y contratar personal para acrecentar el volumen de su producción.Con tu ayuda y su voluntad esta laboriosa madre concretará sus proyectos de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus 2 menores hijos.

loans.use: To purchase a weaving machine

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 47570

loans.name: Maisha Bora Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Fredrick M. is a young Kenyan father aged 37 with 5 children. He also lives with 1 orphan child of his late sister who perished 2 years ago.

Fredrick started his business 3 years ago after accumulating savings from his former work place. He currently operates a small retail cereal stall selling maize, rice, and green grams (lentils) but would like to expand his business to a wholesale unit in future.

Being the primary bread winner for his family, it would enable him to support both his children and his wife, who has a low-paying job. With the little profit that he gets from the business, Fredrick still struggles to feed, clothe, and educate his children and to pay his house rent. With the help of his loan, he will be able to purchase cereals in bulk to enable him to boost his business sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase cereals in bulk

loans.name: Obekai Traders Group

texts.en:
Charles K. is an average father aged 36 and married with 3 children.  

He has been running his business for two years.  He got his capital from small savings commonly referred to as a “merry-go-round” from a local welfare group.  His business is located next to a bus terminal, and most of his clients are people traveling from one destination to another.   

Charles uses the little profits he gets from his business to feed, clothe, and educate his children.
 With the help of his loan, Charles will be able to diversify his business and start selling fresh fruit juice along with the grocer business.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To expand his grocery business

loans.name: Ongaroi Jua Kali Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Rosemary I. is an average woman aged 30 with 3 children. She also lives with 1 orphan child of her late brother who perished 2 years ago.

Rosemary started her business 3 years ago after accumulating savings from her former work place in a local hospital located in Busia town. She currently deals in ladies' shoes but would like to diversify to include children's and men’s collections as well. Being the bread winner for her family, it would enable her to support both her children and her husband, who has a low-paying job. With the little profit that she gets from the business, Rosemary still struggles to pay her house rent and to feed and clothe her children. But with the help of her loan, Rosemary will be able to add more stock of second-hand shoes and increase her monthly sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Aboke Kinda Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Monicah A. is an average Kenyan woman aged 48 and married with 4 children.

Monicah has been running her business for a period of 4 years, and she got her initial capital by accumulating savings from her former work place.  Currently Monicah deals in ladies' clothes, but she would like to diversify to a men's and children's collection in the near future.  She purchases her bales of clothes every month from various shops in Nairobi, the capital city of Kenya, and sells to her customers in Busia town.  With the little profit she gets from her business, Monicah is still able to clothe, feed, and educate her children.  With the help of her loan, Monicah will be able to purchase more bales of clothes to boost her business sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes

loans.name: Mboga Safi Women's Group

texts.en:
Wilkista A. is an average Kenyan woman aged 46 with 3 children. She also lives with 1 orphan child of her late brother.

Wilkista started her business of selling vegetables and fruits 2 years ago after accumulating savings from her former work place in a local school in Busia district. She currently sells her vegetables and fruits at Busia Municipality market on a retail basis, but would like to expand her business and start operating on a wholesale basis to enable her to support her children and her husband, who currently has a low-paying job. With the help of her loan, Wilkista will be able to purchase more stock of different vegetables and fruits to enable her increase her business sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To expand her business to wholesale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nandasakulira Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Caroline A. is an average young Kenyan, married with 3 children of her own and 2 children of her late sister.

Caroline started her tailoring business two years ago after completing her tailoring course in the district of Busia. Before venturing into the tailoring business, Caroline used to work for a friend for a commission fee in the Busia Municipality market, from which she accumulated her savings to start her own business. She initially started with one sewing machine, but she has worked hard to expand her business, and she currently has two sewing machines.

With the little profit she gets from her business, she is still able to provide food, clothing, and shelter for her children and to pay school fees. With the help of her loan, Caroline will be able to purchase one more sewing machine and clothing materials for her business.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and materials

loans.name: Carola Lastenia

texts.es:
Mrs. Carola Lastenia C. F. is originally from the city of Bluefields. She is 54 years old and is married to Mr. Rupert Doren Porter; together they have three grown children. Mrs C. has been a street vendor for more than five years. Her customers are women working in the government and non-governmental offices who prefer her for her wide variety of items.

At this time, she needs to buy two comforter sets at $68 per set, a dozen umbrellas at $8 each, 2 dozen boxes of Menticol (an antiseptic lotion) at $5 each, 2 dozen units of Bay Rum aftershave at $5 each, a dozen units of perfume at $10 each and 1 roll of linoleum at $8 each. With this investment, she will be able to meet her demand.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Carola Lastenia C. F. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 54 años de edad esta casada con el Sr. Rupert Doren Porter ambos tienen 3 hijos mayores edad. La Sra. C. es vendedora ambulante por mas de 5 años sus clientes son las mujeres que trabajan en oficinas gubernamentales y no gubernamentales que la prefieren por tener una variedad de productos en estos momentos necesita comprar 2 juegos de confort a $ 68.00 dólares cada juego, 1 docena de paraguas a $ 8.00 dólares cada unidad, 2 docenas de menticol a $ 5.00 dólares cada unidad, 2 docenas de bayrum a $ 5.00 dólares cada unidad, 1 docena de agua florida a $ 10.00 dólares cada unidad y 1 rollo de linolium a $ 8.00 dólares el rollo con esta inversión podrá satisfacer su demanda.

loans.use: Purchase assorted personal products for her stand that caters to working women.

loans.name: Alton Fernando

texts.es:
Mr. Alton Fernando N. H. comes from the city of Bluefields, Nicaragua. He is 76 years old and is married to Mrs. Lucia Lacayo. Together they have 10 adult children. Mr. N. has been selling cheese for more than 10 years. His clients are residents in the neighborhood where Mr. N. resides, and they like his cheese because he offers fresh products. Currently, in order to meet demand, he needs to purchase 300 lbs of cheese at $1.00 per pound and 700 kg of beans at $36.00 dollars per kilogram.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Alton Fernando N. H. es originario de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 76 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Lucia Lacayo ambos tienen 10 hijos mayores de edad. El Sr. N. vende queso por más de 10 años teniendo como clientes a los habitantes del barrio donde reside que lo prefieren por ofrecer productos frescos, en estos momentos necesita comprar 300 libras de queso a $ 1.00 dólar la libra y 7 quintales de frijoles a $ 36.00 dólar el quintal para poder satisfacer su demanda.

loans.use: To purchase 300 lbs of cheese and 700 kg of beans

loans.name: Odengero Jua Kali Group

texts.en:
Lawrence M. is a young Kenyan father, aged 36, with three children. He also lives with the two orphaned children of his late brother, who perished a year ago.

Lawrence started his business four years ago after accumulating savings from an informal rotating savings fund that his group had. (This is commonly referred to as “merry go round.") His business is located in the municipality market. His clients are mostly people from the neighborhood who give him furniture orders. Lawrence uses the profits from his business to feed, clothe, and educate his children. With the help of his loan, he'll be able to purchase timber in bulk to make more furniture for his regular clients and increase his business sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Lawrence would purchase timber in bulk with his portion of this group loan.

loans.name: Tujikaze Women's Group

texts.en:
Jeremiah W. is a young Kenyan father aged 36 with 4 children. He also lives with 2 orphan children of his late brother who perished 2 years ago.

Jeremiah started his business 4 years ago after accumulating savings from his former work place. He currently operates a small retail shop in the neighborhood where he resides with his family, located in Bungoma district. He would like to expand his business and start operating a wholesale shop in future.

As he is the primary bread winner for his family, it would enable him to support both his children and his wife, who has a low-paying job. With the little profit that he gets from the business, Jeremiah still struggles to feed, clothe, and educate his children. With the help of his loan, Jeremiah will be able to increase his stock and boost his monthly sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To increase his shop's stock

payments.comment: correction due to overpayment for business 47580

loans.name: Rusinga Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Abraham K. is a young Kenyan father aged 29 with 2 children. He also lives with 1 orphan child of his late brother who perished 2 years ago.

Abraham started his business 3 years ago, after accumulating savings from his former work place in a local hospital in Bungoma town. He currently deals in men’s second-hand shoes but would like to diversify to children’s and ladies’ collections as well in the future.

As he is the bread winner for his family, it would enable him to support both his children and his wife, who does not have a job. With the little profit that he gets from his business, Abraham still struggles to feed, clothe, and educate his children.

With the help of his loan, Abraham will be able to purchase second-hand shoes in bulk to enable him to boost his sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase shoes in bulk

loans.name: Nazareth Youth Group

texts.en:
Geofrey M. is a young Kenyan father aged 38 with 4 children. He also lives with 2 orphan children of his late brother who perished a year ago. Geofrey started his business 4 years ago, after accumulating savings from an informal rotating savings fund which his group used to have. This is commonly referred to as “merry-go-round.”

Goefrey stocks maize, millet, and sorghum which he sells to his customers from the neighborhood. With the profits that he gets from his business, he is still able to clothe, feed, and educate his children. With the help of his loan, Goefrey will be able to purchase cereals in bulk to enable him to increase his business sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase cereals in bulk

loans.name: Solemba Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Salima K. is an average Kenyan woman aged 30 and married with 4 children. Salima has been in this business for a period of 4 years, and she got her initial capital by accumulating savings from her former work place. Currently Salima deals in ladies’ wear, but she would like to diversify to men’s and children’s wear as well.

Salima purchases her bales of clothes every month from various shops in Nairobi, the capital city of Kenya. With the little profit she gets from her business, Salima is able to clothe, feed, and educate her children. With the help of her loan, Salima will be able to purchase clothes in bulk to enable her to increase her monthly sales. Her long term vision is to open up a boutique.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Tafutatafuta Group

texts.en:
Patrick S. is a young Kenyan father aged 39 with 3 children. He also lives with 1 orphan child of his late sister who perished 2 years ago.

Patrick started his business 2 years ago, after accumulating savings from his former work place in a local petrol station in the Bungoma district. He currently deals in the sale of electronic spare parts for TVs and radios, but he would also like to diversify into selling computer accessories in the near future.

As Patrick is the bread winner for the family; the business enables him to feed, clothe, and educate his wife and children. With the help of his loan, Patrick will be able to purchase more electronic spare parts to enable him to increase his monthly sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase more electronic spare parts to sell

loans.name: Upendo

texts.en: Upendo is a 34 year old mother of two. She lives in the Tabata area of Dar Es Salaam. She runs a wholesale shop that sells cosmetics, a business that is becoming common among Dar es Salaam traders. She is in need of a loan to help her expand the business.

loans.use: To help expand her wholesale cosmetics business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Youth Self Employment Foundation (YOSEFO) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Johannes

texts.en: Johannes is a 44 year old resident of Dar Es Salaam. He runs a pig husbandry from his home. His business is one of the most challenging but pays well, considering the fact that half the population of Dar Es Salaam is Muslim. Johannes wants to transform his small farm into a bigger one to accommodate other animals, like goats and chicken. He is in need of a loan to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his pig husbandry business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Youth Self Employment Foundation (YOSEFO) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Baz Mohammad

texts.en: Baz Mohammad lives in district 9 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with one son and lives with his own family. He has a small flower shop. He has been involved in this business for more than five years and his business is going well so he wants to expand. He is requesting an individual loan to complete his lease purchase and make his business larger. This will increase his income and help his family.

loans.use: To complete his lease purchase

loans.name: Iris Johanna's Group

texts.en:
Iris Johanna is twenty-nine years old and coordinator of a group of five women that carry on different businesses in the San Luis community of Santo Domingo.  Iris Johanna sells shoes and silver jewelry through a catalog.
She explains that she has been running her business for three years, and has been trying very hard to grow it.  Iris also says that she doesn’t have a local to operate the business, but she plans to rent a small shop when she’ll have put sufficient money aside and have the necessary amount of capital to do so.
Iris is asking for a loan to buy more goods to add to her stock in order to meet her customers’ needs.  She will receive the funds together with the following entrepreneurs:
Ana Lilian C., a clothing retailer
Ileini Orquidia P., to buy materials for her beauty salon
María Irlanda P. C., to buy silver jewels.
Zuleika M. A., for a small jewelry shop.
Photo: From left to right: Iris Johanna, Ana Lilian, Ileini, María Irlanda, and Zuleika.

loans.use: To bulk-buy silver jewels and shoes to move expand her business

location.town: San Luis, community of Santo Domingo

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Iris María's Group

texts.en:
Iris María is a well experienced entrepreneur who has been carrying on businesses for more than fifteen years in the San Luis community of Santo Domingo.  She has five children, two of whom live with her.  
Iris María is operating a small store and people of the community visit her regularly to purchase different kinds of goods such as beauty products, perfumes, clothing and the like.
The entrepreneur plans to invest more capital in the business in order to add more varieties to her stock and attract new customers.  She says that at her age, she can walk no more all along the streets, and therefore will be operating the business from her house.
Iris María hopes that her business will allow her maintain a comfortable lifestyle for her family.  Iris will receive the funds with the following entrepreneurs:
Ana Teresa C. L., to purchase beauty products
Clara María C., for a small cafeteria
Yohanna B. C., to buy products for a beauty parlor
Angelica C. P., to buy clothing for her store.
Picture: Left to right: Iris María, Ana Teresa, Clara María, Yohanna B. and Angelica.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of beauty products, clothing and perfumes for a small business.

location.town: San Luis, community of Santo Domingo

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Cristina's Group

texts.en:
Cristina is fifty-two years old and an excellent cook.  She had been operating a small cafeteria for ten years before diseases and economic issues forced her to stop.  Fortunately, she has restarted her business of preparing tasty Dominican dishes.
Cristina explains that she has put her best foot forward to make sure that her business will be successful this time. Cristina needs this loan to add new dishes to her offering to her customers.  She hopes her business will allow her to have enough money to repay the loan and improve her living conditions.  Cristina seems to be very confident and she says that she cooks like nobody’s business.  So, she believes that her business will succeed.
Cristina will receive the funds together with these entrepreneurs:
Sarita S. F., to buy women’s clothing to resell in her community
Neris G. R., a hard-working jewelery retailer
Ana Luisa E. B., for a small sewing shop
Beatriz V. A., to buy clothing for her store.

loans.use: Loan will be invested to add new varieties of dishes in a small cafeteria.

location.town: San Luis, community of Santo Domingo

loans.name: Nesto

texts.en: Nesto is a medical assistant who works with a dispensary in Kariakoo, Dar es Salaam’s busiest trading center. Apart from his work, Nesto runs a small brick laying factory where he employs three people to help him. He is in need of a loan to help buy another brick laying machine, so as to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his brick laying business

loans.name: Grupo Esperanza Group

texts.en:
E. is a sweet 35-year-old woman who lives in the community of 30 de Marzo with her 4 kids and husband. As we walked to her house to chat with her about the new business she wanted to start and to meet her family, we learned that there had just been a drive-by shooting in the community. There were 4 bullet holes in her neighbor’s wall, and all of the women were eager to explain what had happened. 30 de Marzo is one of the most dangerous areas in Puerto Plata, with drug usage and prostitution overwhelmingly prevalent in the community. Our group of 10 women genuinely want to see a better life for themselves and their families. E. lives in a one bedroom shack with her entire family. She, her husband, and two of their kids sleep on the one bed, while the two other children sleep on the cold, hard floor.

With this loan, E. wants to start a small business selling clothing and shoes around her neighborhood. Esperanza is excited to see what will happen in each of these women’s lives, and we want to thank all of the lenders in advance for their support and generosity. God Bless!

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Luisa's Group

texts.en:
Luisa is a forty-year-old woman who with her husband's help has been operating a mini-market for a couple of years.  She operates in the San Luis community of Santo Domingo.  Luisa plans on buying more items to add to her stock.  The entrepreneur explains that currently she has to invest a large amount of money to purchase the same quantity of goods because of the increasing scarcity of food at a global level.
Luisa says that before there was a lot to be said for running a mini-market, but presently it’s getting difficult to make business profitable.  The entrepreneur hopes that loan received will help her move her business forward and improve her family’s living conditions.
Luisa will receive the funds together with these following women:
Leonora M. D. J., to buy women’s clothing to retail in her community
Carmela R., to bulk-buy clothing for her small store
Odiana R., to replenish a small grocery store
Sandra R., to buy goods for a beauty parlor.
Photo: From left to right: Leonara, Carmela, Odiana, Luisa Y Sandra.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of many goods to replenish a mini-market.

location.town: San Luis, community of Santo Domingo

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Jesila's Group

texts.en:
Jesila leads a group of five women of Haitian descent, all of whom live in the San L. community of Santo Domingo.  Jesila is forty years old and a proud mother of two sons and two daughters.  Her husband works as an independent cabinet-maker.
To supplement her family’s income and help her husband fend better for the children, Jesila plans to start selling women’s clothing for a couple of months. She says that each day, after preparing breakfast for the family, she’ll be visiting her friends and other people of the neighborhood in order to sell her products.  Jesila is very confident and says that she knows how to convince people to make them accept a product.
The entrepreneur is expecting an improvement of her family’s lifestyle as a result of her new business.
The other members of Jesila’s group are:
Cristina L. L., a clothing retailer
Felicia L. B., to buy perfumes and beauty products to add to her stock
María G., to replenish a small clothing store
Zelandia L. L., to buy perfumes, hand and body lotions and cosmetics.
Photo. Left to right: Zelandia, María, Felicia, Cristina Y Jesila.

loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk in order to start a small business.

location.town: San Luis, community of Santo Domingo

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Vor Preng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Samon R. is the Village Bank President in Vor Preng. She is a rice farmer and vegetable seller. She currently has an old house and poor living conditions and so she now wants to build a new house. Unfortunately, she does not have enough money to afford to build it; thus she has asked for a loan for this purpose.

Mrs. Samon R. is 58 years old. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other one is enrolled in school. Previously, Mrs. Samon R. obtained a loan from Amret Co.,LTD to buy cows for breeding. Last year, she got gangrene and she did not go to hospital. She called a doctor to come to cure her at home and she spent $50, which is approximately the equivalent of one month’s food consumption for a family in Cambodia. Because of this unforeseen expense, Mrs. Samon R. does not have enough money to build her house now.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To build a new house in order to improve her living condition.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Mrs. Suon M. owns a small general store from which she sells desserts, cakes, biscuits and drinks in Sre Au Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Sambath Pen, is a land broker, but now he wants to start a motorcycle taxi driver business; thus Mrs. Suon M. has asked for a loan to buy a motorbike.

Mrs. Suon M. is 31 and has four children, three of whom are enrolled in school while the fourth is too young to work or study. Mrs. Suon M. and her husband work hard to support all their family expenses. Mrs. Suon M. has never obtained a micro-loan before.

loans.use: To start a motorcycle taxi driver business.

loans.name: Sopiyah

texts.id:
Everyday Sopiyah sews decorations made of beads on bags, clothes, sarongs and sandals according to their shapes and functions. Usually, she buys her sandals directly from a distributor in Denpasar and her beads from other places that sell the beads in lower prices. With some samples from the distributor, she can design or decorate the sandals with the beads according to her customers' requests. She works from afternoon until evening. Sopiyah is hoping that this loan can help increase her business capital.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Sopiyah, seorang pengepul sandal mote. Kegiatannya sehari-hari adalah menjahit hiasan-hiasan mote pada tas, baju, sarung dan sandal. Barang-barang tersebut dihiasi dan diperindah sesuai dengan bentuk dan fungsinya. Biasanya dia mengambil sandal-sandal langsung dari Garmen diwilayah kota Denpasar, sementara mote-motenya ia beli ditmpat lain yang lebih murah. Dengan membawa sampel dari garmen, ia bisa membentuk atau menghiasi sandal dengan mote sesuai dengan selera pemesan. Kegiatan seperti biasanya dilakukan Sopiyah dari siang hingga malam hari. Sopiyah sangat mengharapkan bantuan kali ini bisa dijadikan tambahan modal usaha.

loans.use: To add business capital

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.id:
This is the second loan that Muhammad D. is requesting. He paid off his first loan, and this time, Muhammad D. wants to request another loan because his business is growing. He wants to use this loan to buy more inventory to increase his overall business profit even more. At this time, Muhammad D. lives alone in Denpasar because his son and wife must live in Java with their extended families. His living space is clean, and Muhammad D. is a very resilient entrepreneur. His daily profit of $5 is not sufficient to meet his own needs and to be sent to his family in Java.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Pinjaman kali ini adalah pinjaman yang kedua bagi Muhammad D.. Pada periode sebelumnya sudah melunasi pinjamannya dan kali ini Muhammad D. ingin meminjam lagi karena usahanya cukup berkembang dan ingin menggunakannya untuk menambah modal usaha agar omset penjualannya lebih banyak lagi. Saat ini klien tinggal sendiri di Denpasar karena anak dan istrinya harus tinggal di Jawa bersama keluarga besarnya. Keadaan tempat tinggalnya cukup bersih dan klien sangat ulet dalam bekerja.
