Penghasilannya sebesar 50.000 perhari dirasanya belum cukup untuk kebutuhannya sendiri dan untuk dikirimkan ke keluarganya di Jawa.

loans.use: To add business capital

loans.name: Siti

texts.id:
Balinese statuettes are made of bronze, rocks and wood. Selling the statuettes needs a certain dilligence, which Siti B. has. Siti has been selling Balinese statuettes for four years, and she is very grateful that her business has been doing well all this time. Most of her customers are from Jakarta, and almost every month, they order the statuettes in large quantities. She even exports her statuettes abroad because of the well-known quality of her items. Siti believes that her business has a good future, and thus, wants to add her capital through the loan that she is requesting. Her husband, Adol Kadir, is a trader, and the profits from their businesses together are used to meet their family needs.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Patung arca identik dengan perunggu, batu dan kayu. Usaha ini perlu ketekunan seperti yang dilakukan oleh Siti B.. Sudah 4 tahun Siti menekuni usaha jual arca dan Siti sangat bersyukur karena sampai saat ini usahanya masih bertahan. Konsumen yang biasanya mengambil arca Siti berasal dari Jakarta dan hampir tiap bulan memesan arca dalam jumlah yang besar. Karena kualitasnya bagus, biasanya arca ini bahkan ada yang di ekspor. Karena usaha ini dirasa memiliki prospek, Siti sangat ingin menambah modal usaha. Diharapkan, dari pinjaman kali ini bisa dijadikan tambahan modal usaha. Keuntungan yang didapat dari hasil usahanya cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya bersama suaminya Adol Kadir yang berprofesi sebagai pedagang.

loans.use: To add business capital

loans.name: Ruessei Srok I Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. San V. is the Village Bank President in Ruessei Srok I Village Bank. He is a farmer and he usually grows vegetables and banana trees during the dry season. During monsoon season, he grows rice and it is for this that he has asked for a loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer.

The Russei Srok Village Bank consists of 15 members. Mr. San V. is 55 and he has six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory and two who are enrolled in school. The remaining children stay at home and help their father grow crops. His wife, Mrs. Kong Kheom, is also a farmer and she always works with her husband in the field. Last year, Mr. San V.’s plantation lacked water and his crop declined. During that time Mrs. Kong Kheom gave birth to a child, and Mr. San V. spent $125 for that. Mr. San V. has previously obtained a loan from Amret Co.,LTD, to buy fertilizer and vegetable seeds.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Dei Edth Kaoh Phos Iv Village Bank Group

texts.en:
There are 14 members in the Dei Edth Kaoh Phos IV Village Bank. Mr. Chhuon R. is the Village Bank President. He makes white wine and breeds pigs in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos Village in Kandal Province. He has asked for a loan to buy pig food. He is 55 and the father of five children; one of them is a pig breeder while the other four help their father make white wine. His wife, Sareourn Keot, assists her husband’s business. The family incoM. usually is spent on food, wedding ceremonies and funerals. Last year, Mr. Chhuon R.’s pig faced disease and died.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy pig food.

loans.name: Chreob Lim Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chreob L. is the group leader of six in Sdao Kanleng Village in Kandal Province. She is a tailor and can generate only a small income. She wants to start a new pig breeding business in the village;, and so she has asked for a loan to buy pigs to raise.

Mrs. Chreob L. is 30 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are studying in a local school while the other one is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Samnamg C., is a garment factory worker. Last year, the youngest child suffered a high fever and Mrs. Chreob L. went to a private hospital. She had unforeseen expenses because of that fever. Now, the family is very healthy and Mrs. Chreob L. needs to start a new business in order to improve her living conditions.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy pigs for breeding

loans.name: Saveth

texts.en:
Mrs. Saveth V. is a subsistence farmer in Dei Edth Kaoh Posh Village in Kandal Province. Her plantation has no obstacles; thus, she now asks for a loan to purchase more fertilizer and vegetable seeds to expand her field.

Mrs. Saveth V. is 46 years old and the mother of three children, all of whom are attending school. Her husband, Mr. Mao Sam, is a farmer and he always works with his wife in the field. Previously, Mrs. Saveth V. obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to buy fertilizer and vegetable seeds. Last year, the second child became ill and Mrs. Saveth V. went to see a doctor and had to buy medicine to cure her child.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Korn Kheav Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Korn K. is the leader of a four-woman group in Tie Pram Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small restaurant in the local village and has asked for a loan to purchase more rice to cook for her customers. Mrs. Korn K. is a 56-year-old widow, mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory. She has previously obtained a loan from AMK to buy the ingredients to make Khmer cakes to sell in the village.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more rice for a restaurant

loans.name: Nom Oam Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nom O. is the group leader of a four-member group in Chro Moh Chrouk Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a cook who has been hired to cook for workers and she generates a small income to support the family. Because she and her family still live in poor conditions, however, Mrs. Nom O. would like to start breeding pigs in addition to her cooking business. She has therefore requested a loan to buy pigs.

Mrs. Nom O. is 48 years old and a widow. Her child is a construction worker who earns too little money to improve their standard of living.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To start a pig-breeding business

payments.comment: This group has an End of Term loan. This means that principal is due at the end of the loan. AMK allows for pre-payments, thus some the members might pay some principal before the end of the loan. So Mr. Mon Leng decided to pay $13 as a repayment.
This is the repayment on June 2008.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina O. owns a provision store. She is married and has 2 children. Business is doing very well, and she wishes to increase sales. She is running out of stock.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: The loan will be used as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Seourn Kheav Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Seourn K. is the group leader in Tie Pram Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a stove maker and she now wants to expand her business. She needs to ask for a loan to buy clay to make stoves. What money is left over will be used to buy firewood for resale.

Mrs. Seourn K., 48, is the mother of three children, one of whom is working in a garment factory while the others are studying at school. Her husband, Vanna Oak, is a construction worker in the village; additionally, he also goes to find work outside the village. Last year, Mrs. Seourn K. obtained a loan to buy clay to make stoves for selling to middlemen.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clay to make stoves for sale

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric Q. is in the communication business. He buys mobile phone credit cards from service providers and sells them at the road side. He is not yet married. Business is doing very well, and he wishes to increase sales. She is running out of stock.

He is asking for $425 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: The loan is for additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty G. sells charcoal, maize, beans and other groceries. She is a single parent of 2 children. Her income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. She wishes to increase sales.
She is running out of goods.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: The loan is for additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes K. sells maize and cassava, and also prepares food for sale. She is a single parent of one child. Her income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. She wishes to increase sales, but she is running out of goods.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: The loan is for additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Lugazi Kweyamba Women's Group

texts.en: Prossy N. is the chairperson of Lugazi Kweyamba Women, a group that was set up four years ago. She has a retail shop selling soda, juice and mineral water in Namawojjolo, a highway gathering place for selling roasted meat and chicken to passengers on the Kampala-Jinja road. She employs boys and girls to run around to the various stopping vehicles to increase profits, now that the price of soda has increased. She is a married woman with four children and also takes care of her sister’s child. All of the children are still in primary school. Her dream is to own a much bigger shop with more soda, mineral water and juice so that she can employ more people, since the more people you have, the more you earn with this kind of job. The group is really thankful for the loans from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more soda, juice and mineral water for her shop

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita A. sells rice and other food items. She is married and has 4 children. Business is doing very well, and  she wishes to increase sales. She is running out of stock.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys A. sells tailoring materials. Her major challenge is the constant change in fashion. She is married and has 2 children. Business is doing very well, and she wishes to increase sales. She plans to open another shop close to her distant clients.

She is asking for additional capital to acquire for herself an additional shop for the sale of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Kyosimba Onanya Women's Group

texts.en: The saying, “a man’s downfall is not the end of his life,” befits Hadijah N., the chairperson of Kyosimba Onanya women’s group, which formed in Lugazi in 1997. Before starting her raw food selling business, Hadijah used to move on market trucks to sell new clothes for men, women and children at daily markets around Lugazi. Then robbers attacked her on her way back from work and left her with nothing. This scenario prompted her to enter her current business, which does not require so many movements. She buys sweet potatoes from farmers, packs them in sacks and takes them on a hired truck to Nakawa market for sale once a week on a Monday or Wednesday. She buys a bag of sweet potatoes at $15 and sells it at $35. She is widowed with four children and also cares for four grandchildren singlehandedly. Her dream is to see her children have a bright future after completing their education, and this keeps her going.

loans.use: To buy more sweet potatoes to increase profits

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
K. Margaret sells bags. She is a single parent of 4 children. Her income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. Her major challenge is the unavailability of a proper shop for her goods. Her goods are most often damaged by rain.

She is asking for additional capital to acquire a shop to sell her goods.

loans.use: This loan will be for additional capital to acquire a shop to sell her goods.
